jobTitle: Assoc Director Compliance & Inspection Excellence, Patient Safety
jobDescription: Job Title: Associate Director Compliance and Inspection Excellence Location: Onsite with Flexibility in Gaithersburg MD or Wilmington DE Do you have a passion for quality in Pharmacovigilance? Would you like to apply your expertise to drive continuous improvement in a global Pharmacovigilance system? Do you enjoy supporting global and local regulatory inspections around the world? Then this role in AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and have a passion for Patient Safety, then you’re our kind of person. Impact You Will Make: Working with Compliance and Inspection Excellence (CIE) Leads in the QPPV&PV Excellence Team in Patient Safety, in Chief Medical Office (CMO), you will take responsibility for the management of assigned projects and partnerships including: Coordinating Patient Safety input to GCP and GMP inspections and supporting and leading preparation, delivery and response to GVP inspections; driving continuous improvement; supporting issue reporting and CAPA development; monitoring of quality and compliance. You will need to develop relationships across CMO and other relevant AZ functions, to execute the delivery of the QPPV&PV Excellence strategy and priorities. Your responsibilities will include: Drive a culture of continuous improvement, high performance, flexibility and quality emphasizing a “can do” attitude and innovative approaches, across the AZ Pharmacovigilance system. Lead coordination activities for GVP, GCP and GMP audits/inspections both globally and with local affiliates. Working across Patient Safety globally, coach CAPA owners to develop effective Root Cause Analysis and CAPA. Provide training to Patient Safety and other functional groups in key areas of expertise. Working collaboratively, provide expertise and sharing best practices across all regions and in all partnerships. Serve as the delegate, where appropriate, for the CIE Leads. Essential Education, Skills and Experience: A science, pharmacy, or nursing degree at Bachelor's level A minimum of 5 years relevant experience (pharmaceutical pharmacovigilance, regulatory or QA) Knowledge of pharmacovigilance requirements Experience supporting regulatory inspections Knowledge of QMS and continuous improvement methodologies Proven ability to work cross-functionally, across cultures and time-zones in a virtual/remote environment Leadership skills, including experience of leading project teams Desirable Skills and Experience: Experience in leading preparation, delivery and response for regulatory inspections Experience of working cross functionally within a global organization in the pharmaceutical or biotech industries Thorough scientific knowledge sufficient to understand all aspects of pharmacovigilance issues Thorough knowledge of the drug development process Demonstrated ability to lead change without authority What Makes AstraZeneca A Great Place To Work? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. AstraZeneca – An Employer of Choice AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be! We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We offer a competitive Total Reward program including a market driven base salary, bonus and long term incentive. We also provide a generous paid time off program and a comprehensive benefits package! If you have what it takes to create a culture of courageous leadership, creativity and collaboration, please apply today! AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law. AstraZeneca only employs individuals with the right to work in the country/ies where the role is advertised.

jobTitle: Associate Director, AI Scientist – Audio and Signal Processing
jobDescription: Barcelona (ESP), Gothenburg (SWE), Cambridge (UK), Gaithersburg (US), Toronto (CAN) Competitive Salary + Benefits Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is forward-thinking. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society The Center for Artificial Intelligence (CAI) is a lab focused on applying machine learning research to the toughest challenges at AstraZeneca. We are a team of experts from different subject areas including Machine Intelligence, Data Science, Real World Evidence and Bioinformatics. We innovate together with our leading biologists, chemists, and clinicians to close the gap between today's challenges and the forefront of machine learning. If you want to have an impact on transforming patients' lives by accelerating new medicines to patients, this may be the position for you! What You’ll Do In this role, you will design, implement, test, and analyze machine learning algorithms to help contribute to the overall improvement and automation of the drug discovery pipeline. You will work on feasibility studies, discovery, development, and deployment of machine learning models. You will be required to interact extensively with other teams across the organization, and our academic partners with the goal of delivering products in a timely manner. It is expected that you will present to various stakeholders, represent us at conferences, and publish your findings in scientific journals or top conferences such as ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, TASLP, TSP, Interspeech, ICASSP, etc.     Accountabilities Work efficiently in a team of 3-10 (led by a Senior AI Researcher) to optimally deliver projects using the latest ML methods and modern engineering best practices  Analyze challenges from the drug development process and provide creative solutions from the fields of representation learning, audio and signal processing, active learning, statistical learning theory, ranking and recommendation  Remain at the forefront of ML Research by participating in journal clubs, mentoring, contributing publications and personal development projects.    Examples of projects this team works on are discovery of novel and non-invasive biomarkers, patient screening and diagnostics, discovery of novel clinical endpoints, longitudinal patient tracking, exacerbation prediction, and management of therapeutics. Essential for the role  PhD degree in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, applied mathematics, related field, or a completed MSc and at least 3 years of experience in developing machine learning models.  At least 3 years of experience in developing machine learning models.  ML Ops experience: model tracking, model governance, multiple models in different production contexts.  Desirable for the role  A research program demonstrated by journal and conference publications in prestigious venues (with at least 1 publication as a leading author). Examples include but are not limited to: NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, JMLR, TASLP, TSP, Interspeech, ICASSP.   A high impact model deployment (e.g., developed over a period of 2+ years) or 2+ small-to-medium scale deployments can be considered as an equivalent experience.  Deep understanding of drug development and clinical trial process and data (all phases).  Track record of collaborating successfully with AI engineering teams to deliver complex machine learning models.  Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. Why we love it If your passion is science and you want to be part of a team that makes a bigger impact on patients’ lives, then there’s no better place to be. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. jobTitle: Associate Director, AI Scientist - Machine Learning for Biologics Engineering
jobDescription: Job title: Associate Director, AI Scientist - Machine Learning for Biologics Engineering Location:Barcelona (Spain), Toronto (Canada), Gothenburg (Sweden), Cambridge (UK), Gaithersburg (USA), Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is bright. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society The Center for Artificial Intelligence (CAI) is a lab focused on applying machine learning research to the most challenging problems at AstraZeneca. We innovate together with our leading biologists, chemists, and clinicians to close the gap between today's challenges and the forefront of machine learning. If you would like to have an impact on transforming patients' lives by accelerating new medicines to patients, this may be the position for you! What You’ll Do You will be part of an interdisciplinary team (in partnership with the Biologics Engineering) that is responsible for the discovery and optimization of next generation biological drug candidates for all the key therapy areas across AstraZeneca. You will be working on the design and development of a cyclic discovery process for biologics engineering based on active learning/optimization/search (machine learning models inform the design of wet-lab experiments, the wet-lab automation generates new high-throughput data that is used for model re-training and update of the hypothesis informing the next design step), as well as development of deep learning algorithms for virtual screening of antibodies (supporting the efforts for in silico lead identification and de novo design of antibodies). You will design, implement, test, and analyze machine learning algorithms to help contribute to the overall improvement and automation of the pipeline for biologics engineering. You will be required to interact extensively with other teams across the organization, and our academic partners with the goal of delivering products in a timely manner. It is expected that you will present to various partners, represent us at conferences, and publish your findings in scientific journals or top conferences such as ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, etc. Accountabilities Work efficiently in a team of 3-10 (led by a Senior AI Researcher) to optimally deliver projects using the latest ML methods and modern engineering standard processes. Work multi-functionally with our partners from Biologics Engineering to develop machine learning methods for the design of antibodies with improved biological activity. Analyze challenges from the drug development process and provide creative solutions from the fields of representation learning, reinforcement learning, active learning, statistical learning theory, causality, ranking and recommendation. Remain at the forefront of ML Research by participating in journal clubs, mentoring, contributing publications and personal development projects. Essential For The Role PhD degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, related field, or a completed MSc and at least three years of experience in developing machine learning models. Experience with active learning/optimization, graph neural networks, and large language models for proteins/antibodies. Expertise in developing machine learning methods for antibody design, lead optimization and identification. Knowledge of computational biology and demonstrated experience of incorporating it into machine learning models. Experience with deep learning methods and their applications to biology. ML Ops experience: model tracking and governance, multiple models in different production contexts, etc. Desirable for the role A research program demonstrated by journal and conference publications in prestigious venues (with at least 1 publication as a leading author). Examples include but are not limited to: NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, JMLR, etc. Deep understanding of drug development and clinical trial process and data (all phases). Track record of collaborating successfully with AI engineering teams to deliver complex machine learning models. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Would you like to use your clinical project management experience to help deliver life changing medicines to patients? If you would please read on! At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. Come join an inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration where different views and perspectives are welcomed and valued, an environment that champions inclusion, and teams that reflect the diversity of the communities that we serve. We’re currently looking for an Associate Director Biosampling Project Leader to join a dynamic Biosamples team based in South San Francisco. What You'll Do In this role, you will project manage the delivery of laboratory related activities in both early and late phase global development projects. We’ll look to you to work independently with the clinical project teams and our global external laboratory partners / alliances to ensure operational delivery of the clinical laboratory testing of biological samples, the efficient deployment of tests (including biomarkers, central safety and clinical bioanalysis), as well as data generation and delivery throughout the project lifecycle. This is a fantastic opportunity to progress your career in clinical development and to play a key role in the development of an exciting portfolio of medicines that will change the lives of patients worldwide. Your position will be varied and include the responsibility for ensuring the delivery of all laboratory activities through external partners, meet internal and external quality and regulatory standards all whilst using your operational expertise to advise clinical teams on operational lab strategy, development and deployment. You will regularly be involved in providing advice to clinical teams on laboratory related documentation, operational design and new ways of working, as well as managing external providers to oversee the delivery of relevant lab services and data. Essential For The Role We are looking for a candidate that have experience in some or all of the following. Experience of contributing to the operational deployment of clinical laboratory testing on global clinical development projects. Project Management skills to provide operational expertise and guidance to the multiple internal and external parties involved in a clinical project, and a proven record in overseeing external partners, especially multidisciplinary clinical laboratory service providers. Influencing skills and experience of negotiations A solid knowledge of early or late stage clinical development, as well as an understanding of GCP and GCLP. Suitable candidates may have a science background and would like to extend their knowledge to clinical study operations (degree educated preferable, but not essential) or have backgrounds including laboratory project management, investigator site coordination or study operations. Desirable for the role Experience of working collaboratively with external vendors in partnerships or alliances Experience of working in more than one company or country multi-nationally Hands-on experience in a clinical laboratory setting or clinical research site Project management experience Why AstraZeneca? jobTitle: Associate Director, Brand Marketing EGFR Lung Cancer
jobDescription: At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. AstraZeneca's vision in Oncology is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused on multiple disease states. These therapies are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies. The Associate Director, Brand Marketing will be responsible for the coordinated implementation of the promotional brand plans across the Early-Stage EGFR Lung Cancer Franchise and its growth brand. Key areas of responsibility for this role include ownership of strategy and tactics for HCP marketing as well as significant contribution in future indications launch preparation and execution. This position will report directly into the Director, Early-Stage EGFR Lung Cancer Marketing and will work in close partnership with the broader marketing team across the EGFR Lung Cancer franchise. The role will require effective collaboration with the Sales, Insights & Analytics, Field Marketing, Access, and Diagnostics teams. They will play a critical role in the execution of our marketing plan across indications and in partnership with the IO franchise. This position is based at our Gaithersburg, MD campus (Washington DC Metro area), and will work predominantly on site. Gaithersburg, MD is one of over 400 sites here at AstraZeneca, providing a collaborative environment where everyone feels comfortable and able to be themselves, which is at the core of AstraZeneca’s priorities. The Gaithersburg site offers various amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, a full-service cafeteria, state-of-the-art on-campus Daycare facility, copy center, game rooms, community garden and more! This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based workspaces to suit a variety of working styles while strengthening collaboration between teams. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of the Oncology Business Unit in the US. Responsibilities Collaborate in the development of the US HCP Strategy and lead execution of the strategy, collaborating with colleagues to ensure strong cohesion and consistency across customer segments. Lead creation and delivery of core HCP assets. This includes building strong alliances with internal partners across brand team members, business insights, market access, and medical to optimize cross-functional planning leading to a strong, evidence-based delivery of materials. Establish imporatnt metrics including multi-channel media measurement and analytic plans. Partner seamlessly with customer facing teams (sales, diagnostics, regional marketing) to customize offerings based on regional and local needs Engage in the oncology tactical planning and execution with a specific focus on business growth activities within early-stage EGFR Lung Cancer Participate in the annual operational planning process by shaping the tactical plan and budget required to achieve the brand’s stated objectives Lead partner agency relationships, workflow and related expense budgets Work with internal and external partners to define success metrics and analyze performance of marketing programs on an ongoing basis, ensure plans are optimized as needed to improve impact, and develop recommendations for future plans based on resulting measures Ensure legal/regulatory compliance and medical accuracy of all marketing materials Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in relevant field 5+ years of experience in pharmaceutical or healthcare industry with proficiency in one or more of the following: managed markets, brand marketing, sales, market research/analytics, strategic planning Effective communication and cross functional collaboration skills Driven to be proactive, strategic and innovative Ability to lead multiple complex projects Proven track record to lead without authority Ability to gauge the feasibility, impact and risks of proposed programs Comfort operating in a highly regulated environment and industry Possess strong business acumen skills, as role is responsible for leading multiple program budgets, timelines, process and procedures High ethical standards and personal integrity Preferred Qualifications MBA Oncology experience preferred Customer Facing or in-line marketing experience preferred Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Next Steps -- Apply today! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

Do you have a passion for science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Manufacturing Sciences team, based in Gaithersburg, Maryland, is a fully integrated process scale-up and cGMP biomanufacturing function. At our Pilot Plant Facilities, our dynamic clinical manufacturing team performs bioprocessing operations for novel molecules to support the development of new medicines. We produce pre-clinical and early through late stage clinical drug products that advance AstraZeneca’s biologics pipeline. Our integrated team collaborates with our counterparts in technical process development; manages and assures the supply of raw materials; performs non-conformance identification and resolution activities; and provides engineering, technical service, and process automation functions. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Participates and Lead initiatives involving individuals from cross-functional teams to solve complex issues. Interacts regularly with subordinates, other production sub-groups, Process and analytical development, functional area peers, and area management. Serves as product/process or equipment lead/champion in the introduction and implementation of new equipment, innovative technologies, and novel products from concept through bench scale, scale-up areas and cGMP manufacturing. Ensuring operational efficiency including adequate training and qualification of personnel. Facilitates and/or contributes to standard operating procedures as well as strategy development such as lean manufacturing used to improve process performance. Regularly works on non-routine manufacturing assignments where the ability to assess/analyze identifiable factors, situations and/or data is required. Works under minimal supervision to resolve daily operational issues and implement business solutions that may span across multiple functional areas. Education & Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in the sciences or engineering and 8+ plus years’ experience in a Downstream / Purification manufacturing environment, preferably including 2+ years supervisory experience. Note: This is a 2nd shift position, M-F, 2-11 pm Required Skills: Large scale downstream purification hands on operation and troubleshooting. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. Summary Of Group: The Manufacturing Sciences team, based in Gaithersburg, Maryland, is a fully integrated process scale-up and cGMP biomanufacturing function. At our Pilot Plant Facilities, our dynamic clinical manufacturing team performs bioprocessing operations for novel molecules to support the development of new medicines. We produce pre-clinical and early through late stage clinical drug products that advance AstraZeneca’s biologics pipeline. Our integrated team collaborates with our counterparts in technical process development; manages and assures the supply of raw materials; performs non-conformance identification and resolution activities; and provides engineering, technical service, and process automation functions. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Participates and Lead initiatives involving individuals from cross-functional teams to solve sophisticated issues. Interacts regularly with subordinates, other production sub-groups, Process and analytical development, functional area peers, and area management. Serves as product/process or equipment lead/champion in the introduction and implementation of new equipment, innovative technologies, and novel products from concept through bench scale, scale-up areas and cGMP manufacturing. Ensuring operational efficiency including adequate training and qualification of personnel. Facilitates and/or contributes to standard operating procedures as well as strategy development such as lean manufacturing used to improve process performance. Regularly works on non-routine manufacturing assignments where the ability to assess/analyze identifiable factors, situations and/or data is required. Works under minimal direction to resolve daily operational issues and implement business solutions that may span across multiple functional areas. Education & Experience Requirements: Manager Level: Bachelors's degree in engineering, biological sciences, physical sciences, or equivalent focus of study with 5+ years of experience in biotechnology. Associate Director Level: Bachelor’s Degree in the sciences or engineering and 8+ plus years’ experience in a GMP manufacturing environment, preferably including 2+ years supervisory experience. Required Skills: Large scale manufacturing hands on operation and troubleshooting. Demonstrated knowledge of manufacturing unit operations. Demonstrated broad understanding of the science that drives our business Demonstrated knowledge of GMP manufacturing principles and its application Microsoft Office efficiency applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Why AstraZeneca? jobTitle: Associate Director Clinical Pharmacology and Pharmacometrics (Clinical Pharmacology)
jobDescription: The Associate Director Clinical Pharmacology is a scientific role that works closely with Clinical Pharmacometricians and with the clinical team to create clinical pharmacology development programs providing a clear strategy towards the right dose to patients. This person will also design, conduct, analyse and interpret results from Clinical Pharmacology studies to support decisions at study and project level. Working with Clinical Pharmacometricians, the individual will drive the application of foundational and cutting-edge pharmacometrics techniques for their projects, in combination with business domain knowledge, and participate in advanced modelling strategies to generate business and scientific insights. The individual will provide coaching, task management and support to junior staff and promote best practice across multiple domains, and/or stakeholder groups. Typical Accountabilities Accountable for expert data integration, analysis, interpretation, and reporting of clinical pharmacology results at the study level to support project (project team/governance) Jointly accountable with the pharmacometrician for providing a scientific justification for the dose selection Participation in and accountability for peer review of ongoing activities, reports and presentations Contribute to regulatory documents and interactions (written and oral) Presentation of Clin Pharm results to internal and external forums Contribute to internal initiatives to develop the clinical pharmacology discipline including its processes Compliance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) regulations as well as internal/external guidance’s Required Expert knowledge of pharmacokinetics and Model-Informed Drug Development (MIDD) Good knowledge in pharmacology, drug targets and core disease areas Demonstrated broad translational development expertise and experience exemplified by at least 3 years drug development experience, with emphasis on Clinical Pharmacology Demonstrated ability to identify, develop and execute clinical pharmacology activities at a project level Good oral and written communication skills Good knowledge of global regulatory, compliance, processes, standards and issues specific to clinical pharmacology PhD degree preferred or equivalent (M.Sc./Pharm.D.) with relevant experience required Relevant regulatory experience (written) Training and experience with PK software (Phoenix, WinNonlin Desirable International scientific reputation gained from scientific publishing in the field of DMPK/Clinical Pharmacology Experience in early and late stage drug development Experience with relevant software and tools within the field of MIDD (e.g. SIMCYP, R, NONMEM)

jobTitle: Associate Director, CMC Regulatory Affairs - Synthetics
jobDescription: Here at AstraZeneca, we are looking to enable you to be the best you can be. We thrive in our inclusive and ambitious environment. We draw on our knowledge to take thoughtful risks and uncover creative ways to better deliver for our patients and our business. Our Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC) Regulatory Affairs function delivers expert CMC regulatory input for projects spanning across the product lifecycle and leads the regulatory strategy for the development, manufacturing and testing of all of our medicines. With our expertise we interpret, anticipate and craft global Health Authority expectations to build CMC and Device Regulatory Strategies. We are seeking a CMC Regulatory Affairs Associate Director to add to our hard-working team in either our Gaithersburg (MD), US; Macclesfield, UK; Cambridge, UK; Gothenburg, Sweden or Sodertalje, Sweden hubs. This role will support the synthetics technical area, encompassing both traditional and novel molecules. CMC Regulatory Affairs Associate Directors are a core member of our cross-functional Regulatory Strategy, Pharmaceutical and Global Supply Teams. Working in partnership with the technical functions, CMC Associate Directors collaborate with colleagues in AZ marketing companies across the globe to ensure successful regulatory outcomes for clinical trials, marketing applications and complex post approval changes to meet the needs of our patients and the business. We pride ourselves on our encouraging culture and cross-project knowledge sharing. As a CMC Regulatory Affairs Associate Director you will: Use your regulatory experience to devise creative strategies to support a range of new chemical entities and novel products, from development to post approval lifecycle management. Provide strategic, tactical and operational expertise and direction to AstraZeneca project teams, based on understanding of global CMC regulations; Handle high level risk by making sophisticated judgments, developing innovative solutions and applying comprehensive cross-functional and industry understanding; Have a high level of interactive social skills and cultural sensitivity which you will use to advise CMC teams on how to achieve successful regulatory outcomes; Support project driven regulatory interactions with health authorities, e.g. FDA, EMA, for CMC scientific advice; Lead and/or deliver CMC Regulatory components of business process improvement projects. Ensure the application of global CMC regulations and guidance within AstraZeneca and lead development of new guidance Share your knowledge actively within CMC RA and the wider business, participate in the coaching and mentoring of colleagues and keep up to date with emerging global regulatory requirements; Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a science or technical field such as pharmacy, biology, chemistry or biological science Breadth of knowledge of manufacturing, project, technical and regulatory project management; Strong understanding of regulatory affairs globally, particularly with respect to the CMC field; Regulatory Affairs CMC experience with submissions for synthetic drug substances and products. Desired Qualifications: Advanced degree in a science or technical field such as pharmacy, biology, chemistry or biological science The position can sit at our Macclesfield or Cambridge, UK; Gaithersburg, MD; Gartuna or Gothenburg, Sweden locations Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Competitive Salary And Benefits Package On Offer. jobTitle: Associate Director, Compliance Biosamples - Cell Therapy
jobDescription: Would you like to use your experience in Biosamples Regulations to make a positive impact to millions of patients' lives across the world? If you would, this could be the role for you... At AstraZeneca be empowered to be innovative and creative where difference is valued. Join a place built on innovation and creativity. Where different views and perspectives are welcomed and valued. An environment that champions inclusion, and teams that reflect the diversity of the communities that we serve Human Biological Samples (HBS) are fundamental to medical research in the discovery, development and implementation of new treatments and diagnostics. HBS are ethically sensitive materials and the collection, handling and access to HBS are subject to strict regulations, principles and ethical guidelines The HBS Compliance Associate Director is responsible for defining and managing processes to deliver HBS compliance across AstraZeneca R&D in relation to programmes involving use of HBS in Cell Therapies. They identify and support establishment of effective HBS compliance procedures and advise the business on requirements. This includes requirements related to use of HBS in developing Cell Therapy strategies with respect to AZ HBS policies and standards, working with Biosamples Clinical Sampling on studies using such therapies. The role may support clinical or pre-clinical activities as required by the buisness and is expected to ensure senior leaders are aware of changing regulations and the impact to AZ of these changes. Typical Accountabilities, what you will be doing: Lead the Identification and establishment of effective HBS compliance procedures across R&D. Manage HBS processes to ensure standards are adhered to and compliance requirements are consistently applied for use of HBS in development of Cell Therapies. Ensuring senior stakeholders are aware of changing legisation that impacts them Support the buisness with compliant use of HBS through expert advice and decision making Ensure risks arising from HBS due diligence activities are identified and recorded. Maintain the documentation/SOPs associated with HBS due diligence activities Monitor the effectiveness of HBS due diligence processes and identify opportunities for improvement. Support approval of HBS suppliers and orders to deliver timely and effective decisions Perform HBS due diligence reviews for AZ clincial sample use and re-use requests for HBS in the biobank to support delivery of timely and effective decisions Support activities to enable access to new HBS sources ensuring AZ compliance with regulation Act as subject matter expert, reviewing informed consents and making recommendations on HBS use and carrying out audits to ensure compliant use of clinical HBS related to Cell therapy strategies. Active member of HBS Governance and Compliance related forums, including the dissemination of policy positions and decisions to key stakeholders Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience: Essential: Degree level education Experience in pharmaceuticals, a healthcare related industry or academia/hospital environment related to HBS Excellent analytical, written and oral communications skills Knowledge of strategies for development of Cell Therapies and relevant regulations High ethical standards, willingness to challenge inappropriate proposals/actions of senior leaders Strong collaborative, partnering, and interpersonal skills Strong ability to work independently Willingness to take decisions. Fluent in English as the AstraZeneca working language Knowledge of HBS regulations, laws and standards Desirable: Direct experience of working with HBS Experienced of working with multiple stakeholders Previous experience as a process owner and process improvement Experience in collection and use of HBS as part of ongoing clinical trials Expert in relevant global regulations relating to HBS and cell therapies Locations: UK, Cambridge (Melbourn Science Park) USA, Gaithersburg Sweden, Gothenburg Canada, Toronto Salary: Competitive + Excellent Benefits Next steps, if the role looks suitable please apply with your cover letter. Where can I find out more? At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life-changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big, and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we can really change the course of medicine and bring new and innovative ideas to life. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. AstraZeneca Oncology is looking to hire an Associate Director, Data Optimization & Governance to join the Data Management team in the US Oncology Sales Force Operations organization. This is a strategic and dynamic role that is positioned to drive effectiveness creating value through centralized data acquisition, governance and collaboration across US Commercial Oncology business, Commercial Operations, Procurement, Information Technology and Vendors (navigating account team through to contract and integration planning). S/he will establish a Center of Excellence (COE) developing and leveraging strategic partnerships, commercial governance solutions, data asset optimization, data acquisition efficiencies and innovative commercial solutions to drive business value and speed of solutions/business impact. In this role s/he will bring extensive business acumen and strategic agility with a ‘business-first’ perspective that drives the impact of data through optimal purchases of strategic data sources (in place & emerging), business & vendor relationships, solutions/services, insights & analytics, account management, other capabilities and best practices in this discipline. This role is also the primary interface for day to day interaction managing opportunities & innovation with both commercial data providers, internal customers and AZ’s enterprise master data management team. S/he may have additional responsibilities in the Data Management area based on capacity and experience. Core Responsibilities: Leadership Capabilities & Values: Quickly identifies and acts on opportunities, combining forethought with action; also fosters the same in others. This is based on an understanding of the internal and external data environment and its potential for positive impact on our business. Presents an underlying courage to drive simplification and prioritization that identifies opportunities for AZ to win via strategic thinking and smart-risk. Holds self and others accountable for the achievement of performance expectations. Creates an environment that enables others to perform at their best. Actively creates and promotes cross-boundary collaboration and ultimately data governance with the aim of achieving better business results. Implementing innovative and collaborative data governance aligned to business strategy will play a key role in the success of this position and deliver both top and bottom-line impact. Accountabilities/Responsibilities: Act as subject matter expert for commercial data inquiries via creating and managing a data acquisition Center of Excellence (COE) delivering value from data asset optimization of our current strategic data partners while cultivating new strategic relationships with emerging data partners. Shape the creation and oversight for the matrixed data optimization team while partnering with leads from Insights, Data Management, Field Reporting, Procurement and other functions as they are needed. Partner with current strategic data vendors to generate further insight from current data assets while cultivating new strategic relationships with current and emerging data partners. Demonstrated ability to manage and mature strategic relationships. Well developed and politically savvy with senior managers and above. Experience interacting with, presenting to and/or advising senior management Manage data purchases within and across budgets and other commercial/brand cost centers as well as experience shaping multiple detailed multi-cost center purchase orders. Able to form, develop and communicate business insights/impact of the data, and options to internal teams; as well as the ability to socialize, influence and/or defend those insights. Partner with Commercial procurement, legal, finance, insights and brand teams throughout vendor negotiations, contracting and account management in order to drive strategic critical initiatives maximizing the value for AZ. Drive the communication, alignment and implementation of our commercial data strategy throughout Commercial business & Operations. Manage and optimize the AZ US Oncology commercial relationships with our current and emerging vendors, including third party agreements and data sharing. Implement value-added balanced scorecard(s), processes, visibility and KPI to enable optimal alignment of Commercial data purchases. Develop processes for expedited/refined review of data purchases and/or inquiries Ability, want and purpose to transform and shape the future of commercial operations and the value we bring. Ability and want to be “hands-on” as we partner, shape and build the Data Acquisition COE capabilities. Requirements: Minimum 5 years pharmaceutical, biotechnology experience with a focus in Commercial Operations Experience in commercial data products, insights, data management and analytics Experience working with and optimizing Specialty Distribution data Demonstrated analytics skills and use of multiple software tools (Access, Excel, other) Ability to combine a strong qualitative & quantitative foundation with business acumen, influence and delivery Ability to engage in multiple work streams simultaneously Preferred Skills & Experience Experience in multiple channels and/or Therapeutic Areas preferred with a focus on Specialty Care / Oncology (including Hospital/non-retail, Specialty Distribution (Specialty Distributors & Specialty Pharmacy) and government entities Experience working in an/or establishing a COE Success leading and developing Relationship Management and Portfolio Management Financial/cost center experience managing spend >3M Account Management Experience Previous role in a consultative position and/or experience BA/BS degree in relevant field required; Advanced degree preferred. Travel: <10% regional travel is aligned to this position Why AstraZeneca? jobTitle: Associate Director / Director, Lab Operations and Compliance
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while growing teamwork between teams. Summary of the group: BPD’s Business Planning and Operations team leads the development and implementation of BPD’s functional strategy and operational business planning and support. Major areas of responsibility include supporting the creation of long-term technical objectives, development of annual budgets, functional resource management, contract management, ensuring is operating in a compliant state and ensuring cross functional leadership bodies and business processes are effective. Main Duties & Responsibilities: The overall responsibility of this position is to ensure that all non-GMP Biopharmaceutical Development labs are in a state of compliance with the AZ General Laboratory Standard (GLS) and in a state of audit readiness. The GLS standard sets the minimum laboratory quality requirements for all Research and Development (R&D) laboratories within AstraZeneca. Research and Development (R&D) within AstraZeneca Builds, supports delivery of and ensures compliance with required laboratory training programs across non-GMP laboratories in BPD. Coordinate and assist in developing business processes related to laboratory operations in BPD Lead functional self-inspection and readiness activities for all non-GMP areas of Biopharmaceutical Development including Provide oversight and management of BPDs network of functional lab managers Conducting site functional self-inspections (May travel nationally/internationally and represent company during audits) Lead creation and management of remediation plans Lead development of quality metrics to present to management periodically Coordinate regulatory surveillance activities and tasks with AZ Quality Assist in improving and maintaining a regulatory surveillance for Biopharmaceutical Development including reviewing regulatory documentation for compliance and coordinating gap assessments as needed Lead the generation and alignment of responses to internal quality audit observations in the non-GMP area Lead creation of quality / compliance remediation plans and ensure timely completion of remediation tasks. Assist in planning and coordinating Corporate, Customer and Regulatory Agency audits/inspections Education / Experience: BS University degree in a relevant scientific field is required and a master’s degree is preferred 10+ years of experience working in a regulated pharmaceutical laboratory environment Required Skills: Ability to effectively lead in a matrix organization where execution depends on a team that does not directly report to you. Basic understanding and application of GxP principals, concepts, practices and standards General knowledge of regulatory requirements (eg. 21 CFR Parts 210, 211, 820; EU Volume 4; PIC/S; ICH; ISO; Pharmacopoeia) Demonstrated experience with regulatory and/or internal audits and inspections Understanding and use of LEAN and/or Operational Excellence (FMEA, DMAIC, root cause analysis etc.) concepts Experience authoring and following standard operating procedures (SOPs) Able to apply and lead risk management philosophy Ability to transfer knowledge: developing training materials and conveying sophisticated concepts Strong interpersonal skills and the flexibility to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Check out our landing page for more information on our BPD group https://careers.astrazeneca.com/bpd Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

Job title: Associate Director, Healthcare Analytics Location: Gothenburg (Sweden), Macclesfield (UK), Barcelona (Spain), Mississagua (Canada) Competitive Salary + Benefits Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. At AstraZeneca, we work together to deliver innovative medicines to patients across global boundaries. We make an impact and find solutions to challenges where the answer is not obvious. We do this with integrity, even in the most demanding situations, because we are committed to doing the right thing. We are looking for an Associate Director to join our Healthcare Analytics team within Biopharmaceuticals R&D Data Science & Advanced Analytics group. We focus on developing and applying innovative, data driven solution, to some of the hardest problems in R&D. Our team of data scientists, Real World Evidence experts, and bioinformaticians work right next to leading clinicians and scientists, allowing us to be close to the questions that matter . Our work informs critical decisions in R&D and we have direct impact in transforming patients' lives by accelerating access to new medicines to those most in need. What You’ll Do In this role, you will apply your expertise in developing novel analytical methods that support disease understanding, assess treatment pathways and unmet need, and optimize drug development programs using Real World Data. You will work closely with drug project teams to inform critical business decisions and find opportunities where Real World Data can have a significant impact in accelerating drug development. You will be a subject matter expert in cross functional projects and mentor junior team members. Examples of projects that team works on are: Use Real World data to optimise clinical development programs Evaluate unmet medical need in patient population and compare diagnostic and treatment pathways Create novel methods to understand disease progression, risk factors, and predict outcomes of interest Assess generalizability of clinical trials and contextualise results in real world patient population Research and develop machine learning models on Real World Data to identify biomarkers and further our understanding of disease Essential For The Role BSc or MSc in a Life Science, Computer Science or equivalent experience Extensive experience in designing and conducting observational studies using epidemiological methods with demonstrated impact on decision making In depth knowledge of Real World Data assets, such as claims, EHRs, registries Disease/therapy area and/or biological sciences domain knowledge Demonstrated experience in method development and application using Python, R and database languages (e.g. SQL) Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with others to achieve objectives Desirable for the role PhD in a Life Science or Computer Science preferred Expertise with clinical data standards, medical terminologies and controlled vocabularies used in healthcare data and ontologies Use of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence in the generation of hypotheses from patient level Real World Data Experience of working in a global organization with complex/geographical context Strong track record of delivering and managing multi-disciplinary analytics projects Multiple published papers and/or patents, contribution to external open source projects Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Additional information: Our Gothenburg site: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our-science/gothenburg.html Inclusion & Diversity at AstraZeneca: https://careers.astrazeneca.com/inclusion-diversity #DSAI #DataAI

Associate Director At AstraZeneca, we win through science, it’s at the heart of our every success. That science is only possible when we all work together – we’ll always make sure you’re clear about how your role is connected to our wider mission to really show what science can do! As an Associate Director in the Integrated Bioanalysis team you will be delivering bioanalytical strategies, solutions and data for AstraZeneca biologics including new modalities subject to preclinical and clinical studies with focus on cell-based bioanalytical strategy, immunogenicity assessment, method development and validation, GxP Bioanalysis and Regulatory submission. Position Responsibilities: As immunogenicity assay expert, lead ADA and neutralizing ADA assay development, validation and immunogenicity assessment for all biotherapeutics including cell and gene therapies with viral or non-viral delivery. Responsible for bioanalysis and bioanalytical support of pre-clinical, clinical and biodistribution studies. Manage the transfer and validation of ADA and neutralizing ADA assays to CROs. Work closely with outsourcing team to ensure high quality and timely delivery for the method setup and sample analysis. Stay current on a variety of immunogenicity assay techniques. Propose and implement new techniques as well as strategies and practices that are in line with industry practices and regulatory requirements. Review and approve bioanalytical data and reports to ensure quality and integrity. Contribute to regulatory document preparation including responses and submissions. Establish internal and external influence through initiatives, consortium activities, presentations, and publications. Ensure that work is conducted in a safe and compliant manner; maintain lab documentation and practice in accordance with established SOPs, GLP and GCP regulation. Education/Skills Requirement: PhD in immunology, cell biology or related discipline or 5 or more years of immunogenicity assay experience in the pharmaceutical industry or CRO. Strong background in the development of immunogenicity assays . Strong knowledge of industry practices and regulatory guidance for the development, qualification/ validation of LBA, cell-based assays, and competitive ligand binding assay-based neutralizing assays. Experience with supporting complex biologics including multi-domains, cell and gene therapeutic products Laboratory experience with GxP regulations, documentation and regulatory guidance. Detail oriented, good documentation practices, technical writing and verbal communication skills. Ability to handle multiple projects and/or tasks in a fast-paced environment. This position is located in Gaithersburg, MD The AstraZeneca Gaithersburg campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This green, sustainable, modern, vibrant scientific campus is where we host some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces. Newly designed, state of the art research spaces and open seating floor plans are just a couple of ways we work cross functionally and collaboratively. The Gaithersburg campus also provides an award winning café, free garage parking with electric car charging stations, bike racks, free fitness center to include classed and personal training game rooms, outdoor patio, bocce ball court, arcade games and game tables, recharge Pod’s, library, walking trails, onsite dry cleaning pickup, haircutting service, health and wellness center, starbucks café, and much more! Benefits: AstraZeneca is a leading company in the healthcare industry, with a mission to enrich the lives of others. It’s our business to support healthy living, not only for our patients, but also for our employees. Our benefits program is flexible enough to meet employees’ varying needs, offers valuable choices, and is highly competitive. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Come and join our journey - Apply today! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/

Do you have expertise in, and passion for Marketing? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Respiratory Therapeutic Area in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! The BioPharmaceuticals Business Unit (BBU) creates and implements meaningful therapeutic area and product strategies that are focused on addressing the unmet needs of patients around the world. We are committed to changing the course of medicine and bringing innovative therapies to enhance the quality of life for our patients. The BBU integrates commercial, market access, medical, digital, and corporate functions to drive scientific development and commercial excellence in the core areas of respiratory, cardiovascular, renal and diabetes disease. As an Associate Director, Marketing in Wilmington, DE, you'll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients' lives. In this role, you will contribute to the development and execution of marketing plans to enhance the value of AstraZeneca's portfolio and pipeline. You will be responsible for working with Brand Leadership team to develop and measure aspects of the brand strategy with a specific focus on opportunity assessments, channel leadership, positioning, messaging, and launch/lifecycle planning. What You’ll Do Input into the development of all aspects of the brand strategy, with specific focus on market opportunity assessment, brand positioning, messaging, asset planning and maximization, and launch/lifecycle planning Collaborates with cross-functional partners to bring Brand Strategy to realization through leadership of: Market Research/Insight and analytics Brand positioning and messaging Integrated launch plans Establish strong alliance with Global and US Medical, Corporate Affairs, Regulatory and MAPs partners, providing input to cross-functional planning and programs by communicating brand strategy and identifying market opportunities and risks Work effectively to build Patient campaigns/programs that deliver (TA) brand plan elements Demonstrated ability to motivate, develop, and inspire employees. Ability to clearly communicate brand vision with passion and authenticity to marketing and cross functional teams Responsible for leading defined work streams and brand opportunities as defined by the Sr Marketing Director or Marketing Director with accountability for end product Collaborate with Director, Marketing in developing product forecasts applying analytical sources. Understand key levers to pull in an effort to meet or exceed projections Collaborate and lead without authority across functional areas; organize people, activities, communication & resources around a common goal and to achieve business objectives in a timely manner Create sustainable, long-term relationships with thought leader advocates and customer advocacy groups Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree required; preferably in business, marketing or the sciences 3+ years of pharmaceutical or healthcare related experience and 2 years Marketing experience Leadership experience and team management skills Experience developing brand channel strategy and executing against it Experience handling complex projects at the project management level Strong financial skill with the ability to assess and get results Successful project management experience with the ability to work with cross functional partners Vendor/agency management - handle relationships with agencies, consultants, and other third-party groups to enhance the product opportunity Preferred Qualifications Advanced Degree in business, marketing, or the sciences; Experience in Market access/managed markets Experience in Insight/Market Research Experience across product life cycle (emerging, launch, in-line, mature) Experience related to therapeutic area (Respiratory) Why AstraZeneca? Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Associate Director/Senior Scientist Mass Spectrometry Proteomics/Metabolomics Would you like to be part of a team that is at the leading edge of omics technologies and data science? Do you aspire to work in a world-leading, innovative and cross-functional environment? Are you looking to join a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! We are seeking an Associate Director/Senior Scientist to join Integrated Bioanalysis organization to support biomarker discovery and validation, mechanistic studies as well as pharmacokinetic/toxicokinetic assessments for critical projects within AstraZeneca portfolio employing mass spectrometry-based approaches within the context of non-clinical, pre-clinical and clinical studies. We are looking for an enthusiastic and innovative team player with detailed knowledge of proteomics and metabolomics LC-MS workflows and demonstrated hands-on experience. Your primary responsibilities will include: Develop novel proteomics/metabolomic mass spectrometry workflows for biomarker discovery and mechanistic studies in a variety of biological matrices Develop, validate/qualify state-of-the-art mass spectrometry assays in support of pharmacokinetic, toxicokinetic, pharmacodynamic, mechanistic, safety, prognostic and diagnostic biomarkers Apply state-of-the-art mass spectrometry instrumentation to address sophisticated bioanalytical challenges related to drug discovery and development Sample analysis for exploratory, GLP and clinical studies using automated and manual sample extraction platforms Operate, maintain and troubleshoot a variety of recent instruments Collaborate with pharmacologists, statisticians, data scientists across global AstraZeneca teams Perform data analysis on acquired datasets, document results and communicate insights to both experts and non-experts Lead internal/external collaborative projects Serve as functional representative/expert on multidisciplinary project teams Adhere to established Standard Operating Procedures, industry practice and regulatory guidance as appropriate Contribute to validation/qualification protocols and reports, bioanalytical reports, clinical study reports, etc., as appropriate Requirements: Senior Scientist PhD in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology or Pharmaceutical Sciences 2-5 years of postdoctoral or equivalent experience Associate Director PhD in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology or Pharmaceutical Sciences 5+ years of relevant industry experience in mass spectrometry-based proteomics/metabolomics Excellent skills in study design, implementation of challenging and innovative LC-MS assays and data interpretation in the fields of proteomics and metabolomics Hands-on experience in the operation of high resolution (qTOF, IMS-TOF, Orbitrap) and QqQ instruments and demonstrated competency in troubleshooting Demonstrated experience with various acquisition modes (DDA, DIA, PRM, MRM, etc) Proven track record of sample preparation and data acquisition method development and optimization Proficiency with proteomics and metabolomics data processing tools Strong record of productivity and scientific publications Excellent organizational, documentation and technical writing skills Excellent command of English (written and oral) Strong communication and interpersonal skills Desirable: Pharmaceutical/biotech Industry experience Experience with automated/semi-automated sample preparation Basic programming skills for data analysis of omics datasets (i.e. R, python, etc) Background in bioinformatics/statistical analysis of -omics datasets Familiarity with chromatographic assay validation guidelines, GLP regulations and fit-for-purpose biomarker validation principles Familiarity with gas chromatography (GC-MS), Capillary Electrophoresis (CE) or ion mobility (IMS) Experience in bioanalysis of antibody-drug conjugates Familiarity with drug metabolite identification and profiling studies Why AstraZeneca? jobTitle: Associate Director of Regional Marketing, Great Lakes – Central (Field Based)
jobDescription: At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As the Associate Director of Regional Marketing (ADRM) for GI Oncology you will use your clinical diagnostic knowledge and experience in order to make a significant impact on patient care with a global pharmaceutical company. The ADRM develops and implements Regional Marketing Plans that align with the strategic imperatives of the brand strategy plans to influence and shape local brand commercial success. The ADRM coordinates with Oncology Business Managers and National Oncology Account Directors to inform geography strategic planning by being the connection between the headquarters marketing team and the needs at the geography. The ADRM generates timely and actionable on-label customer insights that inform real-time commercialization approach and strategic insights with appropriate data to inform annual brand planning at the regional level. The role develops tailored initiatives that compliantly educate given the unique local market opportunities consistent with the regional business plan. This role will identify and engage with regional customers on appropriate, on-label or disease education topics and integrate their input to build market leadership and achieve commercial objectives. Also, this role ensures ethical business decisions and actions are consistently demonstrated. The Associate Director of Regional Marketing has a strong marketing background to independently create proposed marketing plans to field and internal brand teams. This position is field based, supporting the Oncology teams in Chicago, Minneapolis and Denver. Responsibilities Strategic Regional Marketing: Develop, design and implement Regional Marketing Plans that align with brand strategy plan strategic imperatives and that influence and shape local brand support. Use compliant input from external thought leaders to help build market leadership and achieve commercial objectives. ESE Customer Engagement: Identify and engage a core group of 35-50 National and Regional ESEs, using advanced scientific, communication and business skills that lead to advocacy of the brand. Insights Generation: Generate timely and practical customer insights that inform Brand strategic decision-making and other important marketing adjustments through interactions (1:1s, congresses, consultancies and advisory board meetings). Business Ethics and Acumen: Compliantly leading multiple program budgets, timelines, processes and procedures. Internal Collaboration: Collaborate with field sales leadership and other AD’s and Brand Teams to develop and implement local regional strategies and tactics based on local market opportunities. Is a role model for living AZ values who diligently and consistently upholds our ethical standards and compliance expectations. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 10+ years of Pharmaceutical or Healthcare industry experience 3+ years of Oncology Experience Marketing Experience 50-70% overnight travel including evening and weekend conferences when necessary Preferred Qualifications MBA 3+ years HCP, Product or Brand marketing experience Skills And Experience ESE engagement with National/Regional ESEs. Demonstrate well-developed interpersonal communication and interaction skills and apply them in engagements with ESEs, ask tough questions and build strategic advocacy. Oncology Business Acumen and a fundamental understanding of the delivery of oncology care, including the role of large Payers, GPOs, cancer care delivery in different practice settings, precision medicine, and organized oncology customers. Marketing Acumen: Demonstrate the capacity to work with agency/vendor partners on complex projects. An ability to identify regional marketing opportunities, and then project manage and implement regional marketing initiatives. Cross-functional collaboration w/CBDs/DSMs, MA/MSLs, NOADs, Brand Marketing. Project management, with support, to plan/execute Ad Boards, Reg Marketing Tactics, taking assets through the MLR process, conduct operational planning & budget management. Execution: Demonstrated potential to develop and execute regional marketing initiatives that deliver against brand strategic imperatives in the BSP. Strategic Thinking: Generate strategic insights to inform brand strategic decision-making. Why AstraZeneca?
