The US Oncology Commercial Effectiveness -Director is the business facing lead for all US Oncology Business Intelligence for HQ, Brand, Above Brand and Field. This position has portfolio responsibilities supporting our growing 5+B$ US Oncology business across our 5 Franchises (and cross functional field teams) comprising multiple business functions, products and indications. The Commercial Effectiveness Director’s responsibilities span 3 principles functions (commercial effectiveness (CE), localized analytics (Capabilities & Platform), and Reporting) each highlighted below. This role is critical to the success of our business as we transform into our new US Oncology Go To Market Model and pivot to focus on our effectiveness vs ‘reporting. This leader will lead this change is our ambition to be predictive & prescriptive in our measures and actions vs descriptive and diagnostic. Commercial Effectiveness: This leader will be the change agent who further establishes Commercial Effectiveness capabilities and drives cultural change (increasing the value of/in a scalable action-based measurement approach that is focused on our effectiveness of key risk & opportunities). Partner with Oncology Commercial Functional Leaders to shape the C.E. Dashboard by Bus function & KPI (introducing new localized KPIs and connecting across appropriate AZ functions). Establish the forum for the business review of the C.E. Dashboard driving optimal outcomes via action and accountability. Form and develop C.E. COE focused on optimized localized insight enabling effective access & analysis of localized business opportunities across Field, C.E. and I&A. Shape the strategic roadmap for Commercial Effectiveness (within the US Oncology Commercial enterprise) while partnering with Oncology leaders linking strategy, tactics, operations and measurement. This accountability is both for the initial CE transformational “build” as well as the focus on planning ahead of our organizations growth in portfolio depth. Partner cross-functionally and up/down/across the organizationally to educate and train the org/COE in concepts, process, methods, opportunities and benefits of CE Analytics Capabilities & Platforms: Aligned to and connecting to the Commercial Effectiveness ambitions above, this Director will be accountable for the analytics capabilities across the oncology portfolio. This includes multiple function-based self-service analytics hubs enabling our Commercial Business (Teams, Brands, Functions (Access Strategy, Diagnostics, Nurse Education, Insight & Analytics), and roles (eg our new Field-Based Commercial Analytics Leaders and their associated field leadership). This also includes the analytics platform leveraged by our Insights & Analytics teams supporting the US Oncology Business. Reporting: Aligned to the above; inculcate CE and best practices into reoccurring reporting capabilities transforming the focus, value and impact of the team. Functional accountability of this team ncludes the delivery and platform management of the following reporting capabilities supporting our +5B$ US Oncology business: Executive Performance Reporting, Headquarters Reporting, Field Team Reporting (all 5 Tumor Based Sales & Non-Sales teams (ONE, PM, NOAD, GPO, Contracting) + additional ad-hoc Commercial Reporting. This Director will be accountable for the business relationship management correlated with the delivery of capabilities above with key customers including Franchise Heads/CBD/Field Analytics Leads, Marketing, Insights & Analytics, Access Strategy, Precision Medicine, Finance and compliance. The Director will be accountable for their teams engagement for any training related activities (eg onboarding new Regional Analytics Leaders. Organizational education, for example introduction to Commercial Effectiveness. The Director will also maintain key relationship with their peer roles in Commercial Data Management, Information Technology, Vendors/Suppliers as well as compliance, privacy and legal. They will shape, manage and have overall accountability for strategy, roadmap, budget, projects and performance of their team (per capabilities above). In managing their team, s/he will center on business outcomes by successfully combining oncology acumen, data (both in place and emerging) with optimized visualization to deliver differentiate, innovative and timely business intelligence capabilities for/with their internal customers/teams. This role will report to the Head, US Oncology Business Excellence. Core Responsibilities Responsible for Oncology Commercial Effectiveness team: leading a direct team of :6 + and extended team of 12 (Field -Based) Commercial Analytical Leaders that dotted-line here for their functional disciple/development while being directly allocated (each) to an Oncology Area Directors) Deliver Leadership-level Business relationship management across the US Oncology Portfolio (Franchise Heads and other OLT Leads) to pull through the team’s capabilities per accountability and/or business objectives Portfolio management and roadmap of items/functions within ‘umbrella’ Commercial Effectiveness - Business Intelligence capabilities aligned to the customer groups above driving operational effectiveness and innovation across current, changing and future state business objectives. Lead ongoing business reviews (per above functions) with Insight, Brand, and Field-based customers, including cross-functional partners. Incorporate feedback into continuous improvement, strategy and roadmap Shape, influence and manage the new Oncology Commercial Effectiveness COE Program management with cross functional team in Sales Force operations to deliver departmental objectives in which there are shared goals / experience / interoperability across and including other capabilities (Customer Experience- CRM, IC, Digital Marketing, and other outcomes) Accountability of the relationship with external suppliers to assess current opportunity in data and BI tool driving efficient and empowering state of the art delivery Management of practical deployment and training for any/all self-serve tools for insight analytics teams/end users Assemble facts and insight to tell a simplified, cohesive story that clearly communicates a project request, enhancement request and/or current data (ability to simplify the complex) Makes and act on decisions quickly and effectively while fostering the same in others. The US Oncology Commercial Effectiveness – Sr Manager is the operations lead for the Commercial Effectiveness program. This position has customer engagement responsibilities supporting our growing US Oncology business delivering effectiveness measures across our 5 Franchises (and non-sales field teams) comprising multiple business functions, products and indications. The Commercial Effectiveness Sr Manager’s responsibilities drive deeper in the strategy, effectiveness and measures of our business. This role is critical to the success of our business as we transform into our new US Oncology Go To Market Model (North Star) and pivot to focus on our effectiveness vs ‘reporting’. This role will lead this change is our ambition to be predictive & prescriptive in our approach and actions (and measure this) vs descriptive and diagnostic. With the support of the Director Commercial Effectiveness (C.E.), this role will further establish Commercial Effectiveness capabilities and drive the cultural change (increasing the value of/in a scalable action-based measurement approach. This role will shape the strategic roadmap for Commercial Effectiveness (within the US Oncology Commercial enterprise) while partnering with Oncology leaders linking strategy, tactics, impact and measurement. This accountability is for both the initial CE transformational “build” as well as the focus on planning for our organization’s continued growth in portfolio depth. The Sr Manager will partner with Oncology Commercial Functional Leaders and North Star Transformation team to shape the C.E. Dashboard by Tumor Team KPI (introducing new localized KPIs and connecting across appropriate AZ functions). This role will establish the forum for the business review of the C.E. Dashboard driving optimal outcomes via action and accountability. Gather the raw data and/or end measurements for the Dashboard from collective functions. Partner cross-functionally and up/down/across the organizationally to educate and train the org/COE in concepts, process, methods, opportunities and benefits of CE. This role will form and develop the C.E. COE focused on optimized localized insight enabling effective access & analysis of localized business opportunities across Field, C.E. and I&A. The Sr Manager will be accountable for the business relationship management correlated with the delivery of effectiveness capabilities above and with their peers on the delivery side. In managing their team, the Sr Manager will center on business outcomes by successfully combining oncology acumen, data (both in place and emerging) with optimized visualization to deliver differentiate, innovative and timely business intelligence capabilities for/with their internal customers/teams. This role will be based in Gaithersburg, Md and will report to the Director, Commercial Effectiveness within US Field Force Operations. Core Responsibilities Deliver Leadership-level Business relationship management across the US Oncology Portfolio (Franchise Heads, brand leads and other functional leads) to pull through the Commercial Effectiveness capabilities per accountability and/or business objectives As necessary, represent the insight behind the dashboard on ongoing business reviews (per above functions) with Insight, Brand, and Field-based customers, including cross-functional partners. Incorporate feedback into continuous improvement, strategy and roadmap Shape, influence and manage the new Oncology Commercial Effectiveness COE Management of practical deployment and training for any/all Commercial Effectiveness deliverables Assemble facts and insight to tell a simplified, cohesive story that clearly communicates a project request, enhancement request and/or current data (ability to simplify the complex) Makes and act on decisions quickly and effectively while fostering the same in others. This is based on an underlying courage to enable smart risk-taking for the business and value on time to market (business request through to visualization/output) Actively creates and promotes cross-boundary collaboration with the aim of achieving enhanced business results and organizational growth (acumen, capability, experience, exposure, innovation). Application of feedback from business users to further enhance capabilities and correct any issues with business, data management and technical owners of AZ data platforms to improve business intelligence capability output (visualization/reporting/analytics/extracts) Partner with Information technology and Vendors to deliver optimization of cloud-based environments to improve capability performance ease of use and accessibility. Requirements Bachelor’s degree Minimum 5+ years pharmaceutical or biotechnology experience Broad understanding of Field, Field Operations and Marketing Operations Ability to effectively communicate vision and opportunity applicable to team, franchise or brand level objectives Demonstrated ability to manage cross-functional teams and integrate objectives with executive leadership Experience operating in complex functional matrixes engaging cross-functionally and x-franchise developing deep collaborations, creditability and rapport with peers as well as executive leadership Balanced strategic thinker with strong emotional intelligence and operational ‘best practice’ mindset Ability to deliver high quality results while working on multiple projects at the same time. Behaves with a high level of autonomy – identifies and challenges needs, acting accordingly identifying, initiating and solutioning across both ambiguous and complex business dynamics Preferred Qualifications Advanced Degree in technical, life-sciences, or business field Oncology/Specialty Care business acumen and experience Previous experience developing and delivering sales methodologies and/or channel design Development of automated reporting solutions integrating BI tools (Qlik, N-Printing, Microstrategy) or other end to end cyclical report generation, new reoccurring analytics and ad-hoc analytics Understanding of US based Oncology/Specialty Care product distribution channels and their associated data sets Advanced US data source knowledge: Claims, Distribution, Syndicated sales, EMR, Diagnostic and other secondary data Understanding of the distribution channels and product flow for oncology medications Previous commercial effectiveness experience Travel: <10% regional travel is aligned to this position Together, as ambitious experts, we’re building the future and leading the next wave of transformation for our patients, business, and Oncology. We are in search of a business-minded problem solver who is interested in joining a growing Procurement team! Contribute to our truly global Procurement team, which reflects the full diversity of the people we serve. Your voice counts: different experiences, backgrounds and ways of working are respected here. United by curiosity, we share insights to challenge conventions. By collaborating and innovating with each other, our stakeholders and our suppliers, we are creating the most competitive supplier ecosystem. The role sits on the Americas Procurement team reporting to the Senior Director of Oncology Procurement, Global & US. The role will work with the Global Procurement Category Team for the categories under its responsibility and coordinate with the Oncology Business Unit (OBU) marketers; ensuring strong and collaborative relationships are built and maintained to define the category strategies and lead the category plans execution. The role is focused on supporting both the Global and US markets within top Commercial categories such as Media, Advertising, Meetings & Events, etc. The Procurement Specialist will work with relevant Procurement peers and Marketers to manage a spend category and help develop long-term strategic plans for the entire spend area within the Oncology Business Unit. He/She will work closely with customers and suppliers to ensure that Category Strategies are highly aligned to current and future Business needs and that the supply base is capable of supporting these strategies. Additionally, the role will be responsible for managing the implementation of category plan to ensure that the underpinning process improvement and procurement activities deliver the expected business value in accordance with the strategic plans. What you will do: Oversee the implementation of category or subcategory plan Manage and/or execute key projects aligned to overall procurement strategy Ensure the underpinning process improvement and procurement activities deliver the expected business value in accordance with the strategic plans Support the regional or global Associate Director / Manager in the development of long term strategic plans for agreed scope of spend area to ensure that category strategies are highly aligned to current and future business need and that the supply base is capable of supporting these strategies Analyze and resolve issues raised in procurement audit reports Advise on contracts and agreements for the supply of products and services with new and existing suppliers Develops, evaluates, or manages internal and external relationships with suppliers and other cross-functional teams Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in relevant field 1+ years of applicable experience Strong analytical skills Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications: Contract management/negotiation Supplier Relationship Management experience Project management experience Understanding of Marketing, Advertising and other commercial areas Why AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. At AstraZeneca, every one of our employees makes a difference to patient lives every day. Each and every one of us believes that science has the ability to change lives and that to deliver this takes many people with many skill sets. When we deliver a life-changing medicine, that success comes from the combined efforts of all of our people. As the Consumer Marketing Director in Wilmington, DE, you’ll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. Omnichannel marketing is a customer centric approach that allows AstraZeneca to interact with our Healthcare Physicians (HCPs) and Consumers seamlessly across all available channels, delivering a more integrated, informed and connected customer experience – one that drives values for both AstraZeneca and our customers. Main Duties And Responsibilities The Consumer Marketing Director is a key position within the CVRM (Cardiovascular Renal Metabolic ) Commercial Marketing Team, and reports directly into the Sr. Director, Consumer Strategy - CVRM. In this role, you will contribute to CVRM attaining leadership in groundbreaking healthcare through omnichannel marketing, a deep understanding of customer needs and channel expertise. The Consumer Marketing Director will work across the CVRM Brand Teams to integrate omnichannel marketing into brand plans and ways of working specific to Consumer needs. The person in the role will be responsible for leading the creation of a holistic experience for our customers by taking brand objectives and developing the strategic approach using omnichannel communications and tactics to achieve those objectives. In turn, this role works directly with the Senior Director, Consumer Strategy - CVRM, to present the strategy and solution to brand leadership and to secure buy-in. This individual will co-create and direct the deployment of approved strategies, including definition, design, execution and measurement of omnichannel strategies. This role will lead insight generation to drive ongoing optimization of brand campaigns and continual alignment of plans & strategies with brand objectives, goals and budgets. The Director will develop strategic partnerships and innovation for marketed and late-stage products through creative thinking and ideation that transcends traditional pharmaceutical marketing and sales approaches. This role will bring externally sourced innovation that is pivotal to AstraZeneca’s success in improving patient experiences, while growing revenues and market share. The Director will be a visionary that can execute plans to design, develop and oversee programs, and the external suppliers/partners used for delivery, that result in the overall growth and development of practical innovation across the US business. The Director will lead exploration into areas adjacent to but outside traditional business boundaries to source unconventional, yet practical, approaches to uncover high value opportunities and to convert them into new and sustainable business models. Will require a dual focus exploring the intersection of multiple emerging trends and defining how the convergence of two or more technologies or capabilities might satisfy powerful latent patient needs. In this exciting role, you will be responsible for the following: Strategy & Execution Develop a robust pipeline of disruptive innovation that drives incremental and profitable growth. Provide thought leadership to inspire greatness, divergent thinking, and ongoing inspiration for business building platforms for sustained growth. Lead the strategic definition, design, implementation and measurement of a consumer marketing solution that will improve the patient experience (CX) and support brand objectives. Lead the planning and execution of the omnichannel strategy across digital channels and media platforms to drive interest and demand. Designs omnichannel measurement plans, selecting KPIs and setting goals, targets and measurement milestones aligned to business and capability building objectives. Cross Functional Collaboration Effectively works across the Commercial interface to successfully build relationships and drive performance collectively through all marketing and sales channels -- includes HCP and Consumer marketing teams, supporting digital and technology teams, insights & analytics teams, creative agencies, digital agencies, media agencies, and other vendor partners. Leads internal and external stakeholder engagement to assess the business need, identify opportunities, and implement and measure solutions. Vendor Management Successfully partners with vendors and agencies to ensure the strategy, approaches, and requirements for omnichannel execution are understood and interpreted appropriately for quality delivery and execution. Leads insight generation efforts and makes informed optimization recommendations to business partners. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree required; preferably in business, marketing or the sciences 5+ years Marketing and Promotions experience, with digital platforms, including multi and omnichannel campaigns Experience leading brand strategy and executing against it Demonstrated experience in working within cross-functional business units essential Strong financial acumen with the ability to assess and drive results Strong understanding of local healthcare system pricing and reimbursement Successful experience leading change transformation Experience with technologies and services that shape the current healthcare environment (Health IT, Point of Care communication, Digital Health) Preferred Qualifications Advanced Degree in business, marketing, or the sciences; 8+ years of Pharmaceutical or Healthcare experience; preferably in a related industry 5+ years of Pharmaceutical Marketing and Promotions experience, with digital platforms, including multi and omnichannel campaigns Clinical experience in Cardiovascular area & Diabetes experience is strongly preferred Experience in Market Access/Managed Markets Experience in Insight/Market Research Experience across product life cycle (emerging, launch, in-line, mature) Why AstraZeneca? Do you have expertise in, and passion for, Consumer Marketing? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Renal therapeutic area in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. The BioPharmaceuticals Business Unit (BBU) creates and executes meaningful therapeutic area and product strategies that are focused on addressing the unmet needs of patients around the world. We are committed to changing the course of medicine and bringing innovative therapies to enhance the quality of life for our patients. The BBU integrates commercial, market access, medical, digital, and corporate functions to drive scientific development and commercial excellence in the core areas of respiratory, cardiovascular, renal and diabetes disease. As a Consumer Marketing Manager - Renal in Wilmington, DE, you’ll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. The Marketing Manager is responsible for working with Brand Leadership and across global and partner collaboration teams to develop, implement and measure aspects of the brand strategy. This role is specifically focused on, but not limited to launch promotional planning, positioning, disease education, and marketing campaigns. What You’ll Do Lead the execution of the digital multi-channel tactical marketing plan Work closely with Global Commercial Operations to support aspects of our messaging and execution to patients including in-office promotion, digital, social and other DTC channels. Manage ad agency performance and staffing to support brand goals. Collaborate with the Associate Directors and Directors to define and facilitate development of the brand's promotional plan and programs and ensure their consistency with brand strategy Partner with Business Insights and Market Research Team to define success metrics and analyze performance programs Participate in the annual operational planning process by shaping the tactical plan and budget required to achieve the brand's stated objective. Develop a patient advisory panel to ensure an evolved understanding of the unmet needs and insights of our patients and assessment of the value and patient-centricity of our on-going communications Work with corporate affairs and advocacy partners to develop patient-centric programs Manage promotional budget associated with brand marketing activities Manage regulatory and legal review and approval process for key tactics and promotional assets Support and participate in team activities to build a positive work culture Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably in Business, Marketing or in the sciences 3+ years of marketing experience and 1+ year in pharmaceutical industry OR 3+ years of pharmaceutical or Healthcare experience Demonstrated ability to lead without authority Consumer marketing experience with paid, owned and earned media Experience with audience segmentation, content strategy and CRM workflow development Experience with digital, social and mobile marketing channels, technology and analytics Ability to gauge the feasibility, impact and risks of proposed programs Comfort operating in a highly regulated environment and industry Strong communication and interpersonal skills Preferred Qualifications Field sales, Cardiovascular/Renal/Metabolic therapeutic-area experience Experience launching new products or indications MBA Why AstraZeneca? Competitive salary and benefits apply Locations: UK - Cambridge or Macclesfield US - Wilmington, Gaithersburg or Boston Poland - Warsaw or Cracow Ireland – Dublin College Park AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious diseases. But we're more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, we're proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives - and are made to feel valued, energised and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. AstraZeneca has integrated and transitioned into sourcing, purchasing and paying processes on a common Coupa platform with the strategic business objective to transform the way we buy and improve user experience. Coupa COE manager will work with the finance, IT & procurement peers on enhancing system features and developing new capabilities. He/she will act as the platform owner and will chair the centre of excellence team with the ambition to bring Coupa release notes and new enhancement to its full potential. They will have high visibility to senior stakeholders and will build a platform to influence the future of AZ source to pay strategy. The role holder reports to the Global Systems Lead for purchase to pay. Responsibilities Service delivery Run the team of experienced Coupa system admins and representing AZ in front of internal and external partners Deliver Coupa projects and adoption of latest features as part of the release note management Build a strong network with Coupa vendor, IT, Finance, Master Data & Procurement to enable an efficient way of managing Coupa projects Provision of customer and service insight in a clear and concise manner to key stakeholders (GPO, GPDD) to support decision making, customer communications, vendor management and support continuous service improvement. Chair the Design Authority forum and arbitrating on best utilization of Coupa features Process & technology governance and continuous improvement Enforces global template and design standards previously agreed and consulted with GPO office and GPDD Identify and escalate (if necessary) process deviations that are not driven by local, regulatory or tax considerations Consistently promote integration of best practices and leading trends Actively assess system enhancements and deploy them in accordance with the latest Coupa product release Identifies process improvements and implements change with clear outcomes of improvement and standardisation Stakeholder engagement and communications Coordinate and engage with key stakeholder groups across the business, Global and Local/BU functional teams and external providers Engage with Coupa product owner and be seated at the monthly governance calls Training Alignment Drive the development and updates of business process document (BPD) KPIs and Metrics Define, implement and monitor metrics to identify improvement opportunities, service gaps and key trends Strong ability to resolve issues partnering with technical, procurement, finance teams and vendors to implement change as required. Clear focus on end to end process performance across the AZ business. Builds and maintains strong enterprise partnership for delivery (Finance, IT and the wider business) Essential experience required: Experience in Coupa service management Experience in managing and developing 3rd party business relationships Extensive process experience (development, management and application of) Energetic and self-motivated qualified or experienced finance professional Proven ability to manage multiple projects/tasks effectively Able to communicate at all levels within the organisation and with strong communication and stakeholder management drive a change agenda to delivery and benefits Track record of driving simplification & continuous improvement across key business processes Significant experience in Service delivery and processes in a complex, multinational, corporate environment required Thorough understanding of Finance and/or Procurement processes Experience related to the outsourcing industry Strong delivery, influencing/ communication skills An ability to work and collaborate effectively in a matrix organization is essential A self-starter with high levels of drive, energy, resilience and a desire for professional excellence Ability to analyse/ prioritise requests or issues/ changes and provide the best possible solution Ability to make decisions in pressure situations at a management level Good insight into IS ways of working and contractual relationships Candidate will be qualified at a university degree level and have relevant years of experience in the domain area. Excellent understanding of P2P systems and business solution which drive business value Desirable experience required: Coupa certification Comprehensive experience in process design and / or optimization; experience with SSCs with a finance background Delivers message confidently and is consistent, removes blockers to success. Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills around accounting analytics and processes PMI or Prince@2 certification So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Location: Cambridge UK / Gaithersburg, US Competitive salary and benefits package Based in Cambridge (UK), the CVRM Patient Advocacy Director role leads the development and implementation of patient advocacy strategies to support patient access to new medicines, market access and uptake of existing medicines, and value creation for AstraZeneca’s product portfolio throughout the product lifecycle. The role focuses on AstraZeneca’s CVRM’s portfolio, which is one AstraZeneca’s therapeutic areas of focus. AstraZeneca is committed to transforming healthcare by ensuring medical innovation reaches patients as part of sustainable healthcare systems and achieve better outcomes. The Patient Advocacy Director serves as the lead for our relations with patient advocacy groups critical to enabling this objective, including developing and delivering best practice collaborations with relevant organisations. Collaborations will be focused on shaping government and healthcare system policies, increasing understanding of unmet patient/medical needs and building world class evidence that supports improvements to care and access to medicines. The work also includes ensuring patient insights shape AstraZeneca’s work internally and the patient voice is prominently embedded in our culture. Across the role, programmes are developed and delivered through collaboration with internal stakeholders including the CVRM therapeutic area global team covering Commercial, Medical Affairs and Payer functions, and Corporate Affairs colleagues including policy, government affairs and communications at the global, regional and market-levels. Main Duties And Responsibilities: Serve as the patient advocacy group relationship lead for CVRM, accountable for the continuous development and improvement of AstraZeneca relationships with relevant patient groups for the purpose of enabling effective collaboration across shared goals, garnering insights and enhancing AstraZeneca’s reputation. Ensure effective framework for AstraZeneca colleagues across functions to interact and collaborate with relevant patient advocacy groups/organisations/key contacts. Collaborate with other functional advocacy leads in enhancing AstraZeneca’s patient advocacy-relevant standard-operating-procedures and processes. Working as part of cross-functional teams, define and implement multi-year global/regional/local country programmes aligned to business priorities that empower patient and clinical advocacy and inform the development of health system policies that improve patients’ access to appropriate treatment and care. Implement signature initiatives/campaigns that engage and align patient groups in support of patient education, engagement, capacity building and reform of health system policies that improve patients’ access to timely and appropriate care and treatment. Flagship campaigns may be multi-year, multi-organisation and multi-disciplinary reaching different audiences and leverage a variety of communications and government relations disciplines (evidence generation, events, inquiries, digital campaigning, summits/roundtables/symposia/seminars, media, etc.) Work with patient advocacy groups to enable/commission creation of external resources, consultation papers, peer review literature, evidence and argumentation needed to support the advancement of therapeutic area access, policy and broader care agendas, working with third parties as appropriate. Serve as a centre of excellence for the patient advocacy function. Provide expert counsel to global/regional/market colleagues in developing similar relationships and programmes. Provide coaching and expertise to global/regional/market colleagues in developing relationships with relevant contacts/groups. Creates framework for and supports within resources available the use of patient advocacy groups to provide insights to inform AstraZeneca business and embed patient voices in AstraZeneca culture. Supports inhouse capability to pull- through patient insights, perspectives and testimonials for internal and external opportunities including leadership meetings, launches, and external stakeholder engagements. Experience & Expertise required: A proven track record in managing multiple long-term, collaborative relationships with global, regional and local level patient advocacy groups, in politically and culturally diverse areas, across all aspects of the patient experience. Ability to understand and influence complex healthcare system and policy issues globally. Record of shaping policy matters with government and within healthcare systems on issues involving varied stakeholders. Demonstrated effectiveness working with payers (directly or indirectly) to achieve tangible outcomes, either globally, regionally or locally. A track record for building advocacy, evidence and campaigns in support of shared agendas with patient advocacy groups. Politically astute, with an ability to horizon scan for opportunities and challenges. A collaborative mindset that understands the global environment and how to engage / partner with countries to drive pull through and activation. Ability to manage, internally and externally, large complex, culturally-diverse, matrixed programmes, achieving results through others without direct reports. Strong planning and systematic thinking, including project management and budgeting. Strong interpersonal, communication, and influencing abilities as well as excellent written skills, and problem solving – ability to resolve conflict and deal with a wide range of complex problems independently. Biopharmaceutical industry and/or healthcare industry experience required (understanding of CVRM and the healthcare environment a plus). Experience working in an associated field, such as Communications, Government Affairs or Policy work, preferred; English is a requirement; Bachelor’s degree. A commitment to living the AstraZeneca value of Putting Patients First. Why AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and spark your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours Where can I find out more? Barcelona (Spain), Toronto (Canada), Gothenburg (Sweden), Macclesfield (UK), Gaithersburg (USA) Salary plus Benefits - Competitive Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is forward-thinking. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society Sustainable, FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable & Reusable) data is the lifeblood of AstraZeneca as a science-led, pure-play pharmaceutical company and critical for the delivery of the AstraZeneca corporate strategy, in which Data, AI and Digital is a foundational value driver for Innovative Science and a potential corporate differentiator. Job holder will contribute to shaping implementing and managing a Data Policy that balance benefit and risk for responsible reuse - in concert with data customers, CMO, legal, data privacy, information security, and corporate risk and compliance offices. Contributing to strategy and execution that builds strong relations and effective and efficient business processes with internal and external partners and collaborators, based on excellent insight of customer needs, Legal, Ethical, and Security considerations, and standard methodology for Data Policy. Critical member of the Policy Operational Team and contributor to wider R&D Data Policy strategy. Accountabilities Job holder will be working on shaping, implementing and managing a Data policy that balance benefit and risk for responsible reuse and will be required to employ a range of skills including policy expertise, project management, knowledge of external regulations e.g. global data privacy regulations such as GDPR and clinical trial regulations and have an ability to develop strong relations and effective business processes with internal partners. Job holder will be working together with a broad set-of partners, including members in the Data Office but also together with data customers, data privacy, legal, information security, and corporate risk and compliance offices. Job holder will be working on projects to continuously improve R&D / Enterprise-wide processes for Data Policy and reuse; Contribute to forums shaping policy Maintain and co-ordinate key data protection assurance activities – Record of Processing Activities (ROPA) / Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) Lead defined projects related to risk mitigation and compliance for data re-use and use Support internal partners with advice and guidance relating to data protection and shaping data sharing projects (internal & collaboration) according to policy Lead defined policy implementation projects e.g. Legal and Informed Consent Framework Contribute to compliance checks to ensure data re-use / use processes follow policy Essential Relevant degree in Information/Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics, IT, Medical, life sciences, Legal or other related subject area. Experience of pharma and the life sciences Experience working in Data Protection Excellent communication skills and ability to build strong relationships. Strong project or programme management skills Excellent organisational skills, and ability to juggle different projects/priorities and deliver high quality outcomes under pressure Desirable Experience of achieving tangible and acknowledged value in a similar position and scale of challenge and opportunity. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. Gothenburg (SWE) or Macclesfield (UK) or Gaithersburg (US) or Barcelona (ESP) or Mississauga (CAN) Salary – Competitive Salary And Company Benefits Apply Be empowered to be innovative and creative where difference is valued Join a place built on innovation and creativity. Where different views and perspectives are welcomed and valued. An environment that champions inclusion, and teams that reflect the diversity of the communities that we serve. Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients? At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives every single day. The Data Science & AI (DS&AI) team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we aim to: Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets Transform R&D processes Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients The Data Science Learning, Associate Director will join the Data Science Learning and Development team of DS&AI, which focuses on capability development for solid data science foundations across R&D, ensuring that all can benefit from a centralized approach to learning in this critical area; they will be an integral part of the team ensuring the long-term success of data science at AstraZeneca. The role holder will work alongside the Data Science Learning Senior Director to (i) develop and deliver an impactful Data Science learning program for AZ R&D, working in collaboration with Therapy Areas and expert functions, and (ii) tailor our educational offering to the evolving needs of R&D scientists, data scientists, and leaders, ensuring they have the necessary knowledge and skills to progress and impact the R&D pipeline. Main Duties And Responsibilities Work with the Data Science Learning Senior Director to deliver a complete education program of courses (including both self-study and instructor-led training) and experiential learning opportunities (including apprenticeships and mentoring) Develop training curricula and learning paths for R&D scientists, data scientists and leaders Work with external vendors and experts in the field to develop course content and oversee delivery of tailored training Support a network of R&D trainers (both internal and external) in curriculum planning, development and delivery, as appropriate for different courses, ensuring maximum impact and high-quality standards Monitor learning uptake across R&D and evaluate training quality through analysis of trainees’ feedback Promote learning offerings across data science communities and measure impact baselining and re-baselining to show improvement over time Develop deep knowledge of DS&AI groups and portfolio of work, and align with education and awareness opportunities Develop strong connections across R&D and capability functions including IT and ‘spoke’ data science teams to realize the objectives of Data Science Learning Work in collaboration with the Global Talent & Development team to effectively leverage software tools to deploy education materials Keep up with current trends and hot-topics, and evolve education offerings accordingly Essential Requirements BSc in a Life Science, Computer Science or equivalent experience Life-long-learner with experience of multiple modes of learning and awareness of MOOCs and data science educational offerings Experience with Degreed or other eLearning system Excellent communication skills and facilitation skills Desired Requirements Expertise in data science methods and application (e.g. data mining, visual analytics, machine learning) Demonstrated experience in teaching in a commercial or professional environment. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the place for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Waltham, MA: Our Waltham, Massachusetts facility develops life changing small-molecule research in North America, with innovative laboratories at the Gatehouse Park BioHub, just west of the city center. Our BioHub facility supports a bold new R&D initiative, which fosters life science discoveries and the exchange of ideas. Here, we play host to some of the most ground breaking technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. With a shuttle bus to and from Alewife station, the location provides you the ability to work in the heart of one of the world's most vibrant research centers. Our Waltham site offers a variety of amenities to help book productivity and help keep our employees happy and engaged. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you'll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams and the greater research community. Summary of the group: Pharmaceutical Sciences is a department within AstraZeneca Biopharmaceuticals R&D with a mission to transform molecules into investigational medicines, meeting the unmet needs of future patients. Advanced Drug Delivery is a department within Pharmaceutical Sciences. Our portfolio of projects spans from traditional small molecules, peptides, oligonucleotides to RNA-based therapeutics across AstraZeneca's therapy areas and our mission is to transform diverse modalities into investigational medicines. Main Duties & Responsibilities: We are looking for a highly motivated chemist with a strong foundation in the delivery sciences to join the dynamic Advanced Drug Delivery group, engaging in the new modality projects in AstraZeneca's pipeline. The main responsibilities for this role include: Designing and synthesizing lipids for lipid nano-particle based delivery platform with minimum supervision Analyzing and characterizing lipids and lipid nanoparticles with appropriate technologies; Generating, evaluating and reporting data clearly and reliably Acting as the delivery chemist/formulation subject matter expert on the delivery of nucleic acid therapeutics; Providing data interpretation and making recommendations to project teams and other stakeholders Collaborating with other Advanced Drug Delivery teams in Sweden & the UK Clearly communicating data at internal AstraZeneca meetings and occasionally at external meetings Education & Experience Requirements: Education: PhD degree in Polymer Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Medicinal Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences or related scientific fields Experience: 0+ years of post-graduation experience in a pharmaceutical and/or biotechnology environment Required Skills: Demonstrated ability in designing and optimizing synthetic strategies and approaches of lipids and/or polymers Proficiency with analytical and physicochemical characterization of novel materials (e.g. NMR, LC/MS, LC/CAD, particle sizer, various separation technologies) Knowledge of novel delivery technologies including but not limited to microspheres, lipid based formulation, nanoparticles Track record of scientific excellence in terms of scientific publications, patents, and/or conference presentations Excellent oral and written communication skills Knowledge of new modalities (e.g. oligonucleotides, RNA, DNA, peptides, proteins) Desired Skills Experience with new modalities (e.g. oligonucleotides, RNA, DNA, peptides, proteins) formulation Experience with super fluid chromatography (SFC) is a plus Experience with novel excipient chemistry and bio-conjugation Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Director/Associate Director/Principal Scientist/Associate Principal Scientist, Immune cells /Stem cell engineering Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the place for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Cell Culture and Fermentation Sciences Group is accountable for cell line development, process development, and process characterization activities associated with clinical and commercial manufacturing processes. This group assists in the development, scale up, and technical transfer of processes to different manufacturing sites and also supports manufacturing deviations and regulatory submissions as needed. Main Duties & Responsibilities: This position within Cell Culture and Fermentation Sciences group would involve developing processes suited for clinical and commercial manufacture of non-oncology cell therapy products based on immune cells from donors or those derived from pluripotent cell lines. The candidate will have expertise in immune cell biology, gene editing, pluripotent cells, or bioprocessing relevant to allogeneic therapies. The candidate should be well conversed in principles related to hypoimmunogenicity and kill switches as they related to development of allogeneic cellular products. The candidate is expected to design, optimize, characterize, and immune-cell/pluripotent cell culture processes. The candidate will be involved in developing a manufacturing ready cell culture platform that can be scaled up consistently across scales. The candidate will lead the evaluation/development of bioreactor platforms as well as different media for growing native or edited immune cells such as cytotoxic T cells or Treg cells. Finally, the work will involve understanding how different nutritional, mechanical, and hydrodynamic parameters may affect the cell fate of immune cells. The candidate should have sound knowledge of immune-cell/mammalian cell biology and genome engineering approaches and apply the relevant techniques as needed for intended applications. Experience working with pluripotent cells would be a significant plus. Equally important, the candidate should have demonstrated capability of leading a team and developing junior staff. The following is desired of the candidate Applies molecular biology/engineering principles to advance the immune cell platform to develop non-oncology cellular products Performs laboratory experiments using Cytotoxic T/Treg cells/ESCs/iPSCs through cross functional interactions to advance the pipeline and understand the fundamental mechanisms associated with T/stem cell differentiation, shear sensitivity, stress response, and scale-up of immune/stem cells Makes detailed observations, analyses data, and interprets results. Demonstrates scientific rigor in assessing own data and that of others. Utilizes forward-looking perspective to contribute to “go/no go” decisions. Is familiar with different analytical methods that are used to characterize different stages in T-cell/stem cell proliferation and differentiation. Is knowledgeable in either or all the of the following areas: T-cell bioprocessing, T-cell biology, stem cell bioprocessing, stem cell biology, genetic manipulation of T/stem cells, metabolism of T/stem cells, or/and physiology, bioprocessing, and metabolism of mammalian cells Strategic thinker, Evolving subject matter expert in T/stem cell field or mammalian cell physiology/bioprocessing/metabolism, Good publication record, Leads/Participates in various cross functional technology development teams. Authors and contributes to development reports, scientific publications, patents, and regulatory submissions. Is a good communicator, Effectively presents results at internal meetings and external scientific meetings. Work effectively and collegially as a team member/leader within a highly matrixed organizational structure, Develops junior staff A strong team player who can effectively perform or lead the technical transfer activities and manufacturing support for the clinical/commercial process Education & Experience Requirements: Degree in Chemical/Biochemical/Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology, Immunology, Biological Sciences or similar degree program. Bachelor's Degree and 17+ years of relevant experience Master's Degree and 15+ years of relevant experience PhD and 11+ years of relevant experience Required Skills: Strong background in T-cell/stem cell/mammalian cell bioprocessing/biology/metabolism, applies molecular biology/engineering principles to advance the T-cell/stem cell upstream platform Excellent teamwork/communication/leadership skills including proven technical writing skills, good publication record Desired Skills: Experience with T-cell/stem cell engineering or process development Expertise in one of key scientific areas such as T-cell/stem cell bioprocessing, T-cell/stem cell genomics, or T-cell/stem cell metabolism Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! jobTitle: Director, Biologics Translational PKPD Modeling & DMPK (Oncology)
jobDescription: Based in Gaithersburg Do you have expertise in Oncology, and a passion for PKPD modeling and DMPK science, applied to Cancer biology? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the lives of patients in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! We currently have an exciting director opportunity for someone who has a passion for PKPD modeling and DMPK science, applied to Cancer biology, ideally with experience of working with small molecule drug projects to join our team. About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. A place built on courage, curiosity and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take smart risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline and Oncology team. Oncology DMPK department The Oncology DMPK department provides drug metabolism & pharmacokinetic, as well as translational PKPD modeling & simulation support to our portfolio. Be part of fulfilling our ambition to be world leaders in Oncology. We are already the fastest growing team within AstraZeneca and across the industry, and there are countless new indications and targets in our game-changing pipeline. We deliver this value through launch excellence, commercial effectiveness and maximising the lifecycle. By leveraging our commercialised portfolio we are confident we can change the practice of medicine and redefine cancer treatment. We’re brave disruptors – entrepreneurial, courageous and pioneering in our approach. Here you have the opportunity to step up, take personal accountability and lead changes in our ever-evolving environment. What You’ll Do As a Director, Biologics Translational PKPD Modeling & DMPK (Oncology) you will have the opportunity to drive strategy and provide global leadership in PKPD science across our diverse portfolio, and act as role model, mentoring and guiding less experienced members of the team. Your day-to-day role is to provide projects with specialist modeling input into exploring the PK/PD/Efficacy in pre-clinical models, and using these models in order to iteratively build an understanding of the dose & schedule requirements for therapeutic intervention across different patient populations as a single agent and combined with other agents. Essential For The Role Representing Oncology DMPK and providing overall scientific leadership for cross functional and external collaborations involving DMPK. Exploring the effects on target and pathway to understand the requirements for efficacy and set a candidate drug target profile (CDTP). Predicting human dose and regimen together with providing input into exposure and pharmacodynamic (PD) biomarker based decision criteria for early clinical trials. Driving learning through back translation of early clinical exposure and PD data and providing prioritized future options for clinical testing. Leading and participating in Oncology strategic scientific initiatives and continuous improvement projects by providing expert M&S knowledge. Having a breadth of influence and impact across AstraZeneca DMPK and externally within their discipline. Identifying, championing and developing new ideas. Leading scientific discipline networks and acting as a focus for debate within the AstraZeneca scientific community. Advising on and participating in the development of Discovery or Development strategies in PKPD. Managing student and Post Doc programmes. Leading external collaborative projects with academic or cross-pharma pre-competitive groups. Providing disciplinary scientific leadership and presenting work through patents, publications and lectures. Minimum Requirements: PhD or equivalent degree in a discipline with a significant component of Modeling & Simulation, such as systems biology, quantitative pharmacology, pharmacometrics, chemical engineering, physics, pharmaceutical sciences or applied mathematics. Min. 10 years of industry experience in Modeling & Simulation, ideally in preclinical/translational setting with a focus on small molecules, or a MS degree with proven industry experience. Experience in a project-facing role within pharmaceutical R&D. Comprehensive understanding of DMPK and pharmacology/safety aspects of drug discovery and development with a strong publication record. Track record of supporting PK, PKPD and TKPD aspects of projects, with a delivery focus and ability to meet timelines to pre-specified quality and cost. Specialist in tools such as WinNonLin/Phoenix NLME, NonMem, Berkeley Madonna, MATLAB, and SimCYP. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills coupled with strong influence and leadership skills. Line leadership experience would be desirable About The Waltham Site Our Waltham, Massachusetts facility develops life changing small-molecule research in North America, with innovative laboratories at the Gatehouse Park Bio Hub, just west of the city center. Our BioHub facility, is a bold new R&D initiative, which fosters life science discoveries and the exchange of ideas. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. With a shuttle bus to and from Alewife station, the location provides you the ability to work in the heart of one of the world’s most vibrant research centers. Our Waltham site offers a variety of amenities to help book productivity and help keep our employees happy and engaged. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams and the greater research community. Competitive Remuneration And Benefits Apply We offer a competitive Total Reward program including a market driven base salary, bonus and long term incentive. We have a generous paid time off program and a comprehensive benefits package. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca, we 're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? If you are already imagining yourself joining our team, good, because we can’t wait to hear from you!

jobTitle: Director, Biologics Translational PKPD Modeling & DMPK (Oncology)
jobDescription: Based in Waltham US Do you have expertise in Oncology, and a passion for PKPD modeling and DMPK science, applied to Cancer biology? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the lives of patients in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! We currently have an exciting director opportunity for someone who has a passion for PKPD modeling and DMPK science, applied to Cancer biology, ideally with experience of working with small molecule drug projects to join our team. About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. A place built on courage, curiosity and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take smart risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline and Oncology team. Oncology DMPK department The Oncology DMPK department provides drug metabolism & pharmacokinetic, as well as translational PKPD modeling & simulation support to our portfolio. Be part of fulfilling our ambition to be world leaders in Oncology. We are already the fastest growing team within AstraZeneca and across the industry, and there are countless new indications and targets in our game-changing pipeline. We deliver this value through launch excellence, commercial effectiveness and maximising the lifecycle. By leveraging our commercialised portfolio we are confident we can change the practice of medicine and redefine cancer treatment. We’re brave disruptors – entrepreneurial, courageous and pioneering in our approach. Here you have the opportunity to step up, take personal accountability and lead changes in our ever-evolving environment. What You’ll Do As a Director, Biologics Translational PKPD Modeling & DMPK (Oncology) you will have the opportunity to drive strategy and provide global leadership in PKPD science across our diverse portfolio, and act as role model, mentoring and guiding less experienced members of the team. Your day-to-day role is to provide projects with specialist modeling input into exploring the PK/PD/Efficacy in pre-clinical models, and using these models in order to iteratively build an understanding of the dose & schedule requirements for therapeutic intervention across different patient populations as a single agent and combined with other agents. Essential For The Role Representing Oncology DMPK and providing overall scientific leadership for cross functional and external collaborations involving DMPK. Exploring the effects on target and pathway to understand the requirements for efficacy and set a candidate drug target profile (CDTP). Predicting human dose and regimen together with providing input into exposure and pharmacodynamic (PD) biomarker based decision criteria for early clinical trials. Driving learning through back translation of early clinical exposure and PD data and providing prioritized future options for clinical testing. Leading and participating in Oncology strategic scientific initiatives and continuous improvement projects by providing expert M&S knowledge. Having a breadth of influence and impact across AstraZeneca DMPK and externally within their discipline. Identifying, championing and developing new ideas. Leading scientific discipline networks and acting as a focus for debate within the AstraZeneca scientific community. Advising on and participating in the development of Discovery or Development strategies in PKPD. Managing student and Post Doc programmes. Leading external collaborative projects with academic or cross-pharma pre-competitive groups. Providing disciplinary scientific leadership and presenting work through patents, publications and lectures. Minimum Requirements: PhD or equivalent degree in a discipline with a significant component of Modeling & Simulation, such as systems biology, quantitative pharmacology, pharmacometrics, chemical engineering, physics, pharmaceutical sciences or applied mathematics. Min. 8 – 12 years’ experience in Modeling & Simulation, ideally in preclinical/translational setting with a focus on small molecules, or a MS degree with proven industry experience. Experience in a project-facing role within pharmaceutical R&D. Comprehensive understanding of DMPK and pharmacology/safety aspects of drug discovery and development with a strong publication record. Track record of supporting PK, PKPD and TKPD aspects of projects, with a delivery focus and ability to meet timelines to pre-specified quality and cost. Specialist in tools such as WinNonLin/Phoenix NLME, NonMem, Berkeley Madonna, MATLAB, and SimCYP. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills coupled with strong influence and leadership skills. Line leadership experience would be desirable About The Waltham Site Our Waltham, Massachusetts facility develops life changing small-molecule research in North America, with innovative laboratories at the Gatehouse Park Bio Hub, just west of the city center. Our BioHub facility, is a bold new R&D initiative, which fosters life science discoveries and the exchange of ideas. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. With a shuttle bus to and from Alewife station, the location provides you the ability to work in the heart of one of the world’s most vibrant research centers. Our Waltham site offers a variety of amenities to help book productivity and help keep our employees happy and engaged. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams and the greater research community. Competitive Remuneration And Benefits Apply We offer a competitive Total Reward program including a market driven base salary, bonus and long term incentive. We have a generous paid time off program and a comprehensive benefits package. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca, we 're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? If you are already imagining yourself joining our team, good, because we can’t wait to hear from you!

Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the place for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. We're proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives - and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. Working here also means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most ground breaking technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while growing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Biopharmaceutical Development group is a multi-disciplinary scientific function providing expertise in Process/Analytical/Formulation/Devices Development and Characterization with integrated Bioprocess Engineering, Clinical Manufacturing, and Supply Chain and Logistics operations. The group is also responsible for transferring the processes to different commercial sites in and outside the AstraZeneca organization. BPD group is present in multiple sites including Gaithersburg, MD and Cambridge UK. The Cell Culture and Fermentation Sciences Group is accountable for cell line development, process development, and process characterization. This group assists in the scale up and technical transfer of processes to different clinical and commercial sites and also supports manufacturing deviations and regulatory submissions as needed. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Provide scientific leadership and strategic thinking within and cross functions including developing/simplifying late-stage development process and strategy related to process characterization and global regulatory submission. Develop, optimize and characterize mammalian cell culture process and process technology including PAT. Develop and improve cell culture media and nutrient feed. Perform evaluation and due diligence for in-licensing, out-sourcing or collaboration opportunities. Develop and manage a group of scientists through direct supervision or as matrix leader. Lead functional/cross-functional project team. Author and review regulatory submission such as BLA/MAA and response to questions from health authority. Review and approve development reports. Support technology transfer to clinical and commercial manufacturing sites including CMO Education & Experience Requirements: Education: BS, MS, or PhD in Biochemical/Chemical Engineering or a related field. Experience: BS/MS and 15+ years of relevant experience or PhD and 10+ years of relevant experience Required Skills and Experiences: A scientific leader with a track record of consistent delivery in process development/characterization, and regulatory submission/approval. Demonstrated ability to influence scientific and business strategy/decision, perform due diligence, form/lead functional/cross-functional team, and manage/develop scientists at different levels. Experience with JMP or other statistical analysis, managing project related issue/investigation including engaging with internal/external experts, and making risk-balanced decision based on science and business considerations. Excellent teamwork and communication skills including authoring/reviewing of regulatory submissions. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering innovative methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more?
