jobTitle: Global Marketing Director – Chronic Kidney Disease
jobDescription: Global Marketing Director – Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Location: Cambridge, UK (preferred) | Gaithersburg, MD Are you an experienced Marketing Professional looking to be part of a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? If you’re passionate about what science can do to make a difference to patients' lives and ready to discover what you can do – join us. The BioPharmaceuticals Business Unit (BBU) creates and implements meaningful therapeutic area and product strategies that are focused on addressing the unmet needs of patients around the world. We are committed to changing the course of medicine and bringing innovative therapies to enhance the quality of life for our patients. The BBU integrates commercial, market access, medical, digital, and corporate functions to drive scientific development and commercial excellence in the core areas of respiratory, cardiovascular, renal and diabetes disease. As Global Marketing Director – Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), you’ll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. This role sits within our broader Biopharmaceutical Business Unit, which helps bridge science and commercial, integrating corporate, portfolio, therapy areas and product strategies, providing strategic direction from early-stage research through to commercialization. What You’ll Do The role is a key member of the Biopharmaceutical Commercial team and Global Brand Team (GBT), and collaborates closely with colleagues across Biopharmaceutical Commercial, Clinical Development, Medical Affairs and other partners. The role reports to the Head of Marketing for the product team. Main Duties and Responsibilities: Represent & Provide Commercial Input on various Global Product Team Development Workstreams Create & Lead Commercial Evaluation Plans to explore areas of interest: Market Landscape analysis, Insight Plan, Strategy Development, Forecast Development – in close cross-functional collaboration Deliver Commercial Business Cases to relevant approving bodies for LCM investments decisions Develop, Secure Funding and Deliver Pre-Launch Commercial Plans for invested/live LCM programs Create innovative market development programs in collaboration with broader Cardiovascular/Renal/Metabolic (CVRM) Initiatives Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Strong expertise in market analysis, deep market research insights mining, forecast analysis and business case development with scenario planning Detailed understanding of the development process and necessary commercial touchpoints Sufficient understanding of technical risks & implications for the commercial aspects to future brands Deep knowledge on market-shaping solutions using innovative & disruptive models Experience of developing compelling business cases especially focused on LCM assets (in-country / above-country) Experience of working with R&D, medical affairs, Pricing / Market access as a commercial lead in CFTs Experience of working with external customers including patients, prescribers, payers, providers and partners Preferred Qualifications MBA preferred Specialty medicines with complex ecosystems (patients, healthcare providers, systems, payer) Global/international experience Relevant Therapeutic Area experience Inline Brand Marketing Company experience (or external equivalent) Market development and expansion work (Pre-launch and/or Post-launch) Exposure to and a track record of effective management of decision-making bodies Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering innovative methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/AstraZeneca/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca/?hl=en

At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As the Global Medical Affairs Leader- Synagis (RSV), you’ll play a pivotal role in channelling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. In order to accomplish our goals and enable the best patient outcomes, we look for AZ medical network leaders to have five (5) core capabilities and act as role models to our AZ values. These capabilities include: Track record of building and maintaining a deep and continued connection to Medical Practice/healthcare delivery Collaborative/matrix management skills with a focus on leading diverse groups (e.g., cultural, geographical, functional) to achieve excellent results in shared goals. Well-developed communication and influencing skills with the ability to distil complexity down to what matters to our stakeholders. Strong financial/budget and project management skills. Demonstrated Business acumen We are seeking a candidate who has strong technical, scientific and medical knowledge of the brand to drive understanding of the medical strategy across the organisation and to lead medical activities for the brand including advisory boards and symposia to advance clinical practice. Reporting directly to the Global Medical Head RSV/Flu, you will be charged with delivering ambitious medical strategies and life-cycle management.. We are seeking candidates with significant experience with vaccines and/or infectious diseases and/or immunology and those who would thrive on swift and proactively engaging internal and external leaders. S/he/they is/are accountable for the development and execution of the integrated medical affairs plan, including TA Strategy, Evidence Plans, Medical Transformation Initiatives, business development, interaction with the science units, life cycle management, labelling, and externally sponsored research. You will cross functionally lead a team, that through the Global Product Team (GPT), will execute the medical strategy globally. The role entails leveraging high impact clinical evidence and medical materials as well as demonstrate world-class scientific engagement with external experts and other key customers. Responsibilities: Design and manage the implementation of the Medical Vaccines and Immunotherapeutic (V&I) product strategy globally and regionally Working with the Global Medical Head to create and develop the strategic direction, business/resource planning, and therapeutic strategy for Vaccines /infectious diseases Pro-active member of the V&I Medical LT, where you will assist with portfolio strategy and collaborate with other brand heads. Accountable for supporting effective launches, LCM and gathering customer insights, evidence gaps, publications plans, through the Global Medical Team (GMT). Cross-functional leadership and collaboration across all Medical functions (e.g. Strategy & Operations and Medical Evidence) and the Global Product Team (commercial, R&D, regulatory, biostatistics etc) Closely follows medical developments within Therapeutic area and disseminates new information to transform clinical trends and emerging data into new plans Liaises with the internal and external medical community, including collaboration efforts with a pharmaceutical partner. Delivers medical plan that drives successful launch of innovative and differentiated new medicines within the TA Accountable for engaging and cultivating relationships with leading global KEEs to gain: contribution/ participation in advisory boards, greater understanding of the therapeutic area and insights into unmet patient needs Represents AZ at scientific and medical forums, including medical education forums, scientific roundtables, congresses, and symposia Ensure team effectively Science Advisory boards, accurate medical promotional materials and communication prior to submission to (GMQA Global Medical Quality Assurance) for the final approval. Ensuring the alignment of the publication and medical evidence plans to the Medical Strategy and Medical plan Ensures effective management of V&I Medical budget for defined activities within the assigned target Essential for the role: Doctoral level degree (MD/PhD/PharmD) Strong expertise in vaccinology / immunology / infectious diseases/ Microbiology Experienced in global Medical Affairs or similar function and working cross-functionally across a large product team (Preferably with country level experience as well as above country) Strong technical/product knowledge (Infectious Diseases/Immunology/Microbiology) Strong demonstration of strategic and medical leadership prowess at therapeutic area and/or senior leader meetings Demonstrated track record in delivering new initiatives, capabilities and leading large scale impactful medical initiatives desired Demonstrated success in building and executing multi-year strategic roadmaps highly desired Experience leading teams with a track record of delivering results in a complex environment Strong working relationships with Global leaders in Respiratory medicine, including KEEs, professional societies, pharmaceutical companies Skills and Capabilities: The knowledge of drug / vaccine development regarding preclinical, pharmacokinetic, dose-response, and Phase 3 development is essential to provide quality assessment Proven ability to create bespoke strategy and mobilize an organization to execute Strong executive presence and ability to work collaboratively with global executive teams and leadership Experience of presenting to senior leadership; persuasive oral and written communication skills, including the ability to develop and deliver executive presentations Proven ability to collaborate with internal and external colleagues in various geographies, cultures, roles, and hierarchic levels – enterprise leadership mindset Understanding of the complex and evolving Medical Affairs space with insights about trends, opportunities, risks, and an understanding of external stakeholders (payers, patients, physicians) Ability to manage overall business and medical priorities while also being able to actively engage in more detailed execution discussions Ability to fluidly flex between high level strategy and detailed tactics as required Strong analytical mind-set and ability to quickly assess large amounts of information and distil into key messages and actions Integrity and high ethical standards Desirable for the role: Experience launching new products (within vaccines / Infectious Diseases/ Microbiology/ immunology / rheumatology / biologics / Genomics preferred) Experience advising on business development opportunities

These capabilities include: Track record of building and maintaining a deep and continued connection to Medical Practice/healthcare delivery Collaborative/matrix leadership skills with a focus on leading groups to achieve excellent results in shared goals. Well-developed communication and influencing skills with the ability to distil complexity down to what matters to our partners. Strong financial/budget and project management skills. Demonstrated Eye for business We are seeking a candidate who has strong technical, scientific and medical knowledge of the brand to drive understanding of the medical strategy across the organization and to lead activities for the brand including advisory boards and symposia to advance clinical practice. Reporting directly to the Global Medical Head RSV/Flu, you will be charged with delivering bold medical strategies and life-cycle management for our flu assets. We are seeking candidates with experience with vaccines and/or infectious diseases and/or immunology and those who would flourish with swift and proactively engaging internal and external leaders. They are accountable for the development and execution of the coordinated medical affairs plan, including TA Strategy, Evidence Plans, Medical Transformation Initiatives, business development, interaction with the science units, life cycle management, labeling, and externally sponsored research. You will cross functionally lead a team, that through the Global Product Team (GPT), will implement the medical strategy globally. The role entails using high impact clinical evidence and medical materials as well as demonstrate premier scientific engagement with external experts and other key customers. What you'll do: Craft and own the implementation of the Medical Vaccines and Immunotherapeutic (V&I) product strategy globally and regionally Working with the Global Medical Head to build and develop the strategic direction, business/resource planning, and therapeutic strategy for Vaccines /infectious diseases Pro-active member of the V&I Medical LT, where you will assist with portfolio strategy and collaborate with other brand heads. Accountable for supporting effective launches, LCM and gathering customer insights, evidence gaps, publications plans, through the Global Medical Team (GMT). Cross-functional leadership and collaboration across all Medical functions (e.g. Strategy & Operations and Medical Evidence) and the Global Product Team (commercial, R&D, regulatory, biostatistics etc) Closely follows medical developments within Therapeutic area and disseminates new information to transform clinical trends and emerging data into new plans Delivers medical plan that drives successful launch of innovative and differentiated new medicines within the TA Accountable for engaging and cultivating relationships with leading global KEEs to gain: contribution/ participation in advisory boards, greater understanding of the therapeutic area and insights into unmet patient needs Represents AZ at scientific and medical forums, including medical education forums, scientific roundtables, congresses, and symposia Ensure team effectively Science Advisory boards, accurate medical promotional materials and communication prior to submission to (GMQA Global Medical Quality Assurance) for the final approval. Ensuring the alignment of the publication and medical evidence plans to the Medical Strategy and Medical plan Ensures effective management of V&I Medical budget for defined activities within the assigned target Essential for the role; Doctoral level degree (MD/PhD/PharmD) Strong expertise in vaccinology / immunology / infectious diseases/ Microbiology Experienced in global Medical Affairs or similar function and working cross-functionally across a large product team (Preferably with country level experience as well as above country) Strong technical/product knowledge (Infectious Diseases/Immunology/Microbiology) Consistent track record in delivering new initiatives, capabilities and leading large scale impactful medical initiatives desired Proven success in building and carrying out multi-year strategic roadmaps highly desired Skills and Capabilities: The knowledge of drug / vaccine development regarding preclinical, pharmacokinetic, dose-response, and Phase 3 development is critical to provide quality assessment Strong executive presence and ability to work collaboratively with global teams and leadership Understanding of the sophisticated and evolving Medical Affairs space with insights about trends, opportunities, risks, and an understanding of partners. Ability to lead business and medical priorities while also being able to actively engage in more detailed execution discussions Desirable for the role: Experience launching new products (within vaccines / Infectious Diseases/ Microbiology/ immunology / rheumatology / biologics / Genomics preferred) Experience advising on business development opportunities Why AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. So, what’s next! Are you already envisioning yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. jobTitle: Global Medical Affairs Leader – Respiratory Inhaled
jobDescription: Title: Global Medical Affairs Leader – Respiratory Inhaled Location: Cambridge UK, Gothenburg SE, Gaithersburg US. At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. AstraZeneca is a science-led, global biopharmaceutical company, with a focused portfolio in 3 core therapeutic areas: oncology, cardiovascular, metabolic & kidney disease, and respiratory disease. We are committed to improving the health and lives of people across the globe, through our broad research and development platform, and a growing late-stage pipeline. Working in over 100 countries, we have strength in emerging markets, and our medicines are used by millions of patients and clinicians worldwide Mission & Objective Description Medical Biopharmaceuticals ensures the best patient outcomes by providing healthcare decision-makers around the world with the evidence and confidence they need on AstraZeneca (AZ) therapies and supports our internal stakeholders with medical insight and expertise. Medical Biopharmaceuticals provides medical leadership with market participation and connectivity while also impacting the life cycle planning and execution of all our products. Medical Biopharmaceuticals aims to lead AZ in achieving scientific leadership, being a great place to work, and keeping patients at the core of everything we do. In order to accomplish our goals and enable the best patient outcomes, we look for AZ medical network leaders to have five (5) core capabilities and act as role models to our AZ values. These capabilities include: Track record of building and maintaining a deep and continued connection to Medical Practice/healthcare delivery; a good understanding of the global primary care environment is a bonus for this role. Collaborative/matrix management skills with a focus on interacting with diverse groups (e.g., cultural, geographical, functional) to achieve excellent results in shared goals Well-developed communication and influencing skills with the ability to prioritise and distil complexity down to what matters to our internal and external stakeholders Strong financial/budget and project management skills Business acumen. Reporting directly to the Head of Symbicort & PT027, the Symbicort Medical Affairs Lead will be charged with delivering ambitious medical plans and projects for Symbicort and the anti-inflammatory reliever strategy, and also with delivering novel and essential confidence and evidence initiatives. The Symbicort Medical Affairs Lead will represent the global Medical Affairs team on the Global Medical Team (GMT) and execute the medical strategy globally through membership of the same GMT. Bi-directional communication is a must to execute successfully. The GMT is comprised of Medical Directors from the priority markets and relevant Global Medical Affairs functions. The role entails leveraging high impact clinical evidence and medical materials as well as demonstrate world-class scientific engagement with external experts and other key customers. The Symbicort Medical Affairs Lead requires strong technical, scientific and medical knowledge to drive understanding of the medical strategy across the organization, to lead all external medical activities for the brand (including but not limited to ad boards and symposia) to advance clinical practice with the benefit of the patient as end goal. The Symbicort Medical Affairs Lead needs to be able to design and execute randomized and real world clinical trials. Accountabilities/Responsibilities Manages, executes and streamlines the implementation of the Medical Biopharmaceuticals product strategy globally and regionally (iMAP), ensuring alignment of publication and medical evidence plans between Regions/markets, ensuring input from and output to the GMT. Pro-active member of the Global Medical Team (GMT) to ensure that global strategy is effectively communicated and executed at regional and country levels and that regional/country needs are appropriately accommodated in global deliverables. The Symbicort Medical Affairs Lead drives customer insights and market needs from all countries and feeds back to the Head of Symbicort and PT027 for input into the Global Product Team for review. Strong cross functional collaboration across all GMA functions (e.g. Global Medical Excellence, Medical Informatio, Publication and Medical Evidence) and the Global TA Team (commercial, R&D, regulatory, biostatistics etc) Support and input to medical advocacy plan that drives successful launch of innovative and differentiated new medicines within the TA and of novel strategies for existing brands. Responsible for the co-ordination of select Medical Affairs activities including Science Advisory board, the Science Story, etc., … Accountable for engaging and cultivating relationships with leading global KEEs. Represents AZ at scientific and medical forums, including medical education forums, scientific roundtables, congresses, and symposia Responsible for leading the initial development and ensuring the accuracy of medical promotional materials and communications prior to submission to GMQA (Global Medical Quality Assurance) for the final approval. Closely follows medical developments within Therapeutic area and disseminates new information to transform clinical trends and incorporates new and emerging data into new plans Follows up, reviews and prioritises the current literature in the field of asthma, including general publications, as well as Astra Zeneca and competitor papers and abstracts. Minimum Requirements – Education And Experience Manages other specific respiratory/medical projects as required Expertise in the relevant or related TA required (respiratory preferred) Experienced in an above market Medical Affairs environment and working cross-functionally across a large product team, with proven influencing skills at all levels Highly desired: Experience launching new products (within Respiratory TA preferred) Experience of healthcare systems in US, China, EU and other International markets Strong demonstration of strategic and medical leadership prowess at therapeutic area and/or senior leader meetings Demonstrated track record in delivering new initiatives, capabilities and leading large scale impactful medical initiatives desired Demonstrated success in building and executing multi-year strategic projects highly desired Ensure that country and regional medical TA leads deliver key medical objectives, by establishing strong working relationships Ability to manage an internal network of stakeholders, and provide medical guidance Strong track record in partnering with KEEs, professional societies and other pharmaceutical companies Skills And Capabilities Proven ability to create bespoke strategy and mobilise an organization to execute Ability to design and execute randomized and real-world clinical trials Creativity and aptitude to design disruptive ‘change programmes’ that advance clinical practice Strong ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, excellent team player within the global respiratory asthma inhaled team. Experience of presenting to senior leadership; persuasive oral and written communication skills, including the ability to develop and deliver executive presentations Proven ability to collaborate with internal and external colleagues in various geographies, cultures, roles, and hierarchic levels – enterprise leadership mindset Understanding of the complex and evolving Medical Affairs space with insights about trends, opportunities, risks, and an understanding of external stakeholders (payers, patients, physicians), forward looking and ability to incorporate constant change Ability to manage overall business and medical priorities while also being able to actively engage in more detailed execution discussions Ability to fluidly flex between high level strategy and detailed tactics as required Strong analytical mind-set and ability to quickly assess large amounts of informa

Do you have expertise in, and interest in for leading Medical Affairs teams in Oncology? Apply your experience to changing the way cancer is treated in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines. Help to advance our pipeline by applying expertise and accelerating our pathway to finding a cure. A dedicated Oncology unit, this is the place to build a world-class career. AstraZeneca’s vision in Oncology is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm with the bold ambition to eliminate cancer as a cause of death. We are proud to work on ground breaking science with one of the broadest and deepest Oncology pipelines in the business. We are seeking a Global Medical Affairs Leader (GMAL) supporting our Breast Cancer Franchise, to join us at one of our dynamic sites in either the greater DC Metro area in Gaithersburg MD, or Cambridge, UK! Reporting to the Head of Breast Cancer, the GMAL will play a key role in the development of medical strategy and execution of key deliverables to support the launch and lifecycle management globally for the Breast Cancer DDR program. This position will have specific ownership of key strategic elements of the medical plans, for complex, large/multiple indications or have full responsibility for the medical plan single indication. What You'll Do: Working on the development and delivery of key elements of the global medical tactical plan, the main tasks of the GMAL include: Work autonomously, managing multiple projects and tasks and parts of the brand budget. Engages across functions and markets at a peer level viewed as enablers for key senior stakeholders Work together with Senior GMALs to deliver evidence strategy including ESR strategy Partners with Sr GMAL to operationalize Expanded Access Program (EAP) strategy Serve as Strategic Lead for Advisory boards including developing a strategic plan for ad boards, shaping the agendas, and working collaboratively to ensure the right stakeholders are included in discussions Responsible for Key External Expert mapping activities and development of engagement plans with key internal stakeholders Develop an external education plan including delivery of AstraZeneca-led Symposia and other scientific exchange meeting Will manage and/or contribute to Global Medical Projects Ensures that all Medical and business activities are carried out in compliance with AZ standards, standard operating procedures and external regulations Minimum Qualifications: Minimum of Master’s degree in a scientific discipline or equivalent medical/scientific qualifications and/or significant industry and/or therapeutic experience. Minimum of 4 years’ experience in pharma/life sciences and/or medical experience (e.g. significant clinical/academic/medical affairs agency roles/organizations) Good communication and presentation skills in English Experience of multi-stakeholder management Ability to influence others without authority Strong project management skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams including development, marketing, and health outcomes. Good understanding of drug development and commercialization processes including understanding of outcomes research /payer access issues Proven ability to generate, analyze and interpret clinical trial and published data Preferred Qualifications Advanced Scientific degree preferred (PhD, PharmD) 3+ years in a Headquarters Medical Affairs role or Global Clinical R&D Oncology and Breast Cancer experience Country launch experience Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Apply today. AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We follow all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. We have an exciting opportunity available to join our Biopharmaceuticals Medical team (BPM) as a Global Medical Leader, CVRM. Our BioPharmaceuticals Medical team is a place to be at the forefront, we use our unique position as medical leaders across our enterprise and the healthcare ecosystem to shape the future of Healthcare. There’s so much opportunity here as we continue to grow – no better place to improve patients’ lives and develop with AstraZeneca. In order to accomplish our goals and enable the best patient outcomes, we look for AZ medical network leaders to have five (5) core capabilities and act as role models to our AZ values. These capabilities include: Track record of building and maintaining a deep and continued connection to Medical Practice/healthcare delivery Collaborative/matrix management skills with a focus on leading diverse groups (e.g., cultural, geographical, functional) to achieve excellent results in shared goals Well-developed communication and influencing skills with the ability to distil complexity down to what matters to our stakeholders Strong financial/budget and project management skills Business acumen. Reporting directly to the Global Medical Head, in this role, you will be charged with delivering ambitious medical strategies within our CVRM therapy area. In doing so, you will play an important role in defining the product strategy. You will execute the medical strategy globally through membership of the Global Medical Team, comprised of Medical Directors from the priority markets and relevant Global Medical Affairs functions. The role entails leveraging high impact evidence activities and medical materials as well as demonstrating world-class scientific engagement with external experts and other key customers. What You'll Do Design and manage the implementation of the Global Medical product strategy globally and regionally Work with the Medical Head to create and develop the strategic direction, business/resource planning, and team leadership on a global level for the product communicated and executed at regional and country levels and that regional/country needs are appropriately accommodated in global deliverables and drive customer insights and market needs from all countries into Global Product Team for review. Cross-functional collaboration with GMA functions (eg Global Medical Excellence & Medical Evidence) Closely follow medical developments within Therapeutic area and disseminates new information to transform clinical trends and emerging data into new plans Liaise with the internal and external medical community Deliver medical advocacy plan that drives successful launch of innovative and differentiated new medicines within the TA Support team leader at TA Global Product Team and Global Brand Team Accountable for engaging and cultivating relationships with leading global KEEs to gain: contribution/ participation in advisory boards, greater understanding of the therapeutic area and insights into unmet patient needs Represent AZ at scientific and medical forums, including medical education forums, scientific roundtables, congresses, and symposia Responsible for the co-ordination of Medical Affairs activities including Science Advisory boards Ensure the alignment of the publication and medical evidence plans to the Medical Strategy and Medical plan Responsible for leading the initial development and ensuring the accuracy of medical promotional materials and communications prior to submission to GMQA (Global Medical Quality Assurance) for the final approval. Delegate for Sr MALs/MALs as required Manage other specific cardio/renal/ metabolic medical projects as required Essential for the role: Doctoral level degree: MD/PhD/PharmD Expertise in a relevant or related therapy area Desirable: Industry/Global Medical Affairs experience Demonstrated success in building and executing multi-year strategic roadmaps At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.

Do you have expertise in, and passion for Medical Affairs in Oncology? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the role in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! Be part of fulfilling our ambition to be world leaders in Oncology. We are already the fastest growing team within AstraZeneca and across the industry, and there are countless new indications and targets in our game-changing pipeline. We deliver this value through launch excellence, commercial effectiveness and maximising the lifecycle. By leveraging our commercialised portfolio we are confident we can change the practice of medicine and redefine cancer treatment. Join our globally-renowned Oncology area, which is leading the rapid business growth of our enterprise and ever-evolving industry. It’s an exciting time to join as we work towards our big ambitions with entrepreneurial thinking and innovation. It’s up to us to find solutions and act fast to make them happen. Here we don’t just put the patient first – we put the patient and those affected by cancer at the very heart of everything we do. From families to caregivers, we make a positive difference for as many people as possible. Description: The Global MSL Excellence Director for Oncology is accountable for ensuring the strategic alignment of MSL activities and the development, delivery and reporting of prioritised MSL Excellence initiatives to strengthen MSL capabilities across AZ regions and affiliate organisations for the Oncology Business Unit. Working in collaboration with the OBU Medical Capabilities teams, Global Medical Affairs Leaders and Field Medical Leaders to provide strategic direction, implement programmes to build Oncology-specific MSL and MSL Leader capabilities, and shape the future field medical role in Oncology. Accountabilities/Responsibilities: Lead the Oncology Field Medical Team (FMLT) to ensure strategic alignment of field medical affairs activities for Oncology and oversee the strategy for MSLs through regular production of Field Medical Strategic Plans (FMSPs) and quarterly reporting of activity across business partners in OBU Understand the broader picture in the tumour area to evaluate company strategy and priorities in different disease areas and cocreate a tumour area plan Represent Oncology MSLs on disease area SWAT to drive excellence in evidence & confidence generation through the prioritised clinical trial programme (ECLIPSE) Monitor and report MSL activities and ensure alignment with agreed global Oncology key performance indicators (KPIs) and key quality indicators (KQIs) Partner with Oncology Medical Excellence teams to provide strategic alignment of field medical affairs activities Active contributor of the Oncology Global Medical Affairs Team (GMTs) working across teams to ensure GMT alignment of FMSP and field medical strategy Provide insights to the Global Medical Affairs Leader(s) for Oncology regarding the diverse needs of the Field to support strategic alignment of prioritised initiatives Act as the MSL subject matter expert to all AZ global initiatives where Oncology MSLs are implicated. Provide insight, guidance, influence and expertise that ensures global vision for MSL role is well understood Conduct ad-hoc analyses on projects and initiatives to proactively escalate issues, propose solutions and modify strategies Support the effective and efficient implementation of Global MSL Excellence initiatives that result in valued outcomes and maximum in-country impact Essential Requirements Advanced degree in scientific discipline (e.g., PhD, PharmD, MD), preferably with Oncology focus Experience managing and leading MSL and Medical Affairs teams >3 years managing programmes in a team environment Strong knowledge of medical strategy, clinical development, and medical science liaison, medical affairs areas Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment Desirable Requirements Experience in head office medical affairs roles MSL performance management and outcomes-based reporting Design of programmes that focus on managing, leading and coaching high performing individuals and teams Clear understanding of the compliance requirements and governing bodies for MSL programmes Results-driven with customer-service orientation Proven ability to influence without authority Strong collaboration skills Ability to identify the most efficient and effective way to implement new services Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? jobTitle: Global Oncology Associate Director, Lung Sales Training
jobDescription: At AstraZeneca we embrace the varied opportunities, in a globally connected team, to work on intellectually stimulating challenges and gain transferable skills. We’re invested in supporting your development with access to great tools, smart people to learn from, and the opportunity to experience multiple careers. And you’ll be rewarded for your progression and contribution to the business. The Associate Director, Global Oncology Training, Lung Cancer is responsible for the oversight, strategic direction, and leadership of the curriculum and assets to support Global market needs in the lung cancer space (EGFR and IO). The incumbent will collaborate closely with his/her counterparts across each Oncology Training and Development (OTD) function to ensure an alignment of business operations within the global space of each therapeutic area. The Associate Director is expected to develop a consistent service delivery level to the brand that is evident in all learning and development assets created. The incumbent will work with sales, marketing, clinical, and other cross-functional leaders to create training and development strategies and ensures alignment with business unit priorities to program objectives. This position is based on-site at our Gaithersburg, MD/ Metro Washington DC campus, headquarters for the US Oncology and the Oncology Business Unit. The Gaithersburg site offers various amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, a full-service cafeteria, state-of-the-art on-campus Daycare facility, and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based workspaces to suit a variety of working styles while strengthening collaboration between teams. Essential Responsibilities: Works directly with internal global stakeholders, including training managers, Global brand leads and US leads to understanding the current and future learning needs of the business Establishes strong cross-functional relationships across the product, marketing, and existing internal training teams to develop a scalable global training program that meets launch and life cycle management goals of key global customers Leads the identification, deployment, and promotion of the most effective and innovative practices across the department and globe; including launches Leads teams to evaluate program metrics as a means of determining training impact in areas for growth and success Supports team members to achieve a customer-focused and performance-driven culture that supports Innovation, simplification, measurement, and excellence in learning development and delivery Identifies best practices in early markets and cultivates an environment of best practice sharing for the benefit of later launch markets Creates synergies across the teams to create cost savings collaboration and to avoid duplication of efforts Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent Minimum of 5 years of a blend of pharmaceutical/biotech/oncology experience Minimum of 3 years of Oncology experience Minimum of 3 years of a blend of pharmaceutical sales, sales management, and/or training experience Demonstrated ability to effectively and concisely communicate (verbally and in writing) with members of the global commercial organization(s) where English is not first language Demonstrated ability to interface professionally with senior members of the global commercial organization Demonstrated competency in working with/collaborating with medical learning & development and science liaison teams Ability to understand brand strategy and related strategic imperatives and develop learning that clearly conveys and pulls-through that strategy at the field level Ability to effectively lead in a cross-functional and virtual team environment, providing direction and guidance to team members with varied and complementary responsibilities Preferred Requirements: Advanced degree in medical, pharmaceutical, or life sciences or a related field or equivalent Knowledge of instructional systems design preferred Experience working with/in global (ex-US) markets Next Steps -- Apply today! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

Location: Cambridge UK, Gaithersburg US, Gothenburg Sweden, Competitive Salary And Benefits Apply AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca we believe in the potential of our people and you’ll develop beyond what you thought possible. We make the most of your skills and passion by actively supporting you to see what you can achieve no matter where you start with us. The only one who can put limits on the scope of your career is you. With the right skills and passion we'll help you explore what AstraZeneca has to offer. About Projects & Portfolio Finance The Project Finance team is a dynamic team focused on supporting the Global Product Teams and senior governing bodies (Late-Stage Portfolio Committee (LSPC), Early-Stage Portfolio Committee (ESPC), and SET) with R&D project and portfolio decisions. A position in this team offers an individual an exceptional opportunity for direct exposure to senior management across the organisation, combined with exposure to business issues affecting the Group’s current performance and strategic initiatives. About this role: You will be part of a Global team of Finance Professionals who are flexibly deployed to provide financial advice, support and challenge to Early Global Product Teams (eGPTs). Working with multiple eGPTs, you will be accountable for the robust evaluation of projects by providing high quality financial input to product investment decisions and expert financial analysis of key risks and sensitivities. During project investment decisions you will guide AZ leaders on the financial impact of development plan decisions. This includes briefing key stakeholders at or in advance of Early-Stage Portfolio Committee (ESPC) investment decisions. Accountabilities/Responsibilities: As a member of the eGPTs, provide strategic financial advice, support and challenge to project strategy, plans and investment decisions. Provide proactive and innovative financial analysis and scenario modelling to support teams in assessing the cost and value impact of critical project decisions, including clinical trial design and cost Provide input to all governance body papers (e.g., Early-Stage Portfolio Committee), leading the preparation of the financial sections Ensure senior Finance leaders are appropriately briefed ahead of key decision points Deliver Post Deal Management Finance support for any external agreements in the brand area. This includes understanding and managing AZ financial rights and obligations, communicating this insight to relevant project/function management and to finance departments located in the regional hubs and other SET areas Work with the TA Finance Business Partner Lead to monitor the value of R&D spend and assess the impact of any key changes to project development assumptions and key deviations from plan Supporting the month close analysis and preparation of the quarterly forecast process with up-to-date asset valuations and forecasts Undertake ad hoc project work to assist in the improvement of Project Finance team working practices. Minimum Requirements – Education And Experience The role holder will be a qualified finance professional with a minimum of 4-5 years of proven track record in forecasting, financial modelling and/or decision analysis. Bachelor’s degree required. An accounting qualification is an advantage. Other Skills and Qualifications Biotechnology/pharmaceutical experience preferred Strong analytical skills Proactive analysis and ability to communicate a perspective on business results Solution driven and able to present multiple scenarios for a given task The interpersonal skills to work with senior stakeholders within and outside Finance Key Skills And Capabilities Related To This Role Analytical thinking - ability to collate & analyse data and identify key drivers of value Strong Excel financial modelling Financial evaluation techniques (projects, investments, etc.) Presentation skills / communicating financial recommendations in a way that is both impactful and easily understandable by a financial and non-financial audience Ability to interact and engage with senior managers in the business Strategic thinking and influencing - big picture view but eye for detail; Provision of independent challenge to influence decisions Focus on delivery – work well under pressure, meets tight deadlines Sets high personal standards, takes personal responsibility for delivering top class service and product Maintains high ethical standards and demonstrates high personal integrity Flexibility - to respond to fast changing business needs on short notice Teamwork - effective in leading / being a member of multi-disciplinary teams. Excellent interpersonal skills

jobTitle: Global Project Management Director – Late-stage Oncology
jobDescription: Cambridge, UK / Gaithersburg, US Competitive Salary And Benefits This is an exciting time of growth through innovation for AstraZeneca. With multiple indications and high-quality molecules at all stages of our innovative pipeline, we keep pushing forward, fusing cutting-edge science with the latest technology to achieve breakthroughs. Backed by investment, we are aiming to deliver 6 new molecular entities by 2025. Join the team dedicated to Oncology, with an ambition to eliminate cancer as a cause of death. It’s our big vision that unites and inspires us. The role As an Oncology Project Management Director in our Global Project & Portfolio Management organisation, you are accountable for leading and supporting cross-functional drug development teams in late-stage oncology drug development to achieve key strategic objectives and deliver Phase 3 development, NDA/MAA regulatory submission and commercial milestones. Partnering with the Global Product Lead and other Functional Leads, you are accountable for ensuring the team operates in a way that represents best practice within AstraZeneca. This is a highly visible, critical role in successfully delivering innovative medicines through the drug development process. What You’ll Do Cross-functional Delivery Drive efficient operation of late-stage oncology project teams including overall plans, priorities, budget and risk management Create a shared sense of purpose; inspire and energise others Coach project team and sub-teams towards successful issue resolution and decision making Strategic Alignment Provide program management leadership by providing input into the project strategy and vision, ensuring alignment of the project and operational deliverables Ensure appropriate linkages between project strategy and key internal processes (Therapy area strategy, prioritization, corporate scorecard) Governance and Investment Decisions Manages team towards effective governance decisions (e.g. Phase IDs, project revisions, etc) Provide guidance to the team and senior management / governance bodies that allows timely and informed decision making Leverage broad influential network and ensure engagement at all levels prior to key decisions Planning, Monitoring and Delivery Ensure that overall team deliverables, budgets, schedules, and performance standards are realistically set, governance approved and attained, and that the project effectively fulfils all business reporting requirements. Maintain plans of the highest data quality, accountable for all Project Management deliverables associated with project team(s) or sub-teams covered Entrepreneurship Lead by example in learning, innovation, cross-functional collaboration and conflict resolution; seek opportunities to change paradigm and removes barriers within and outside the team. Use business knowledge to drive cross-project learning, champion and embed better ways of working across the enterprise Your Experience You will have strong leadership skills coupled with a strategic mindset and a sharp focus on drug project delivery to succeed in this role. Our ideal candidate will have extensive drug development experience, working on and leading cross-functional oncology drug development teams. Essential Bachelor’s degree in a scientific or technical drug development subject Project management certification; PMP or equivalent Extensive experience leading cross-functional drug development related projects Previous experience in leading high performing, cross functional drug development teams Successful track record of delivering complex/ high business impact drug development projects within agreed time, quality and cost Excellent working knowledge of project management tools and processes Track record of effective senior stakeholder management, demonstrating strong ability to influence strategically Desirable In-depth knowledge of late stage (Phase 3, NDA/MAA submission and launch activities) drug development process Experience of oncology drug development Advanced degree in a scientific discipline and / or MBA This is the place to build a rewarding and meaningful career, with great exposure and opportunities at a global pharmaceutical company. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca, we 're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and fuel your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours Where can I find out more? Our Social Media: Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn - LinkedIn Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook - Facebook Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram - Instagr

At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As a Global Publications Lead in Cambridge, UK or Gaithersburg, MD, you’ll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. The Oncology Business Medical team is the ‘face’ of AstraZeneca to the healthcare community. OBU Medical team members leverage their scientific and clinical expertise to help healthcare professionals understand how to appropriately utilize AstraZeneca’s medicines. AstraZeneca’s vision in Oncology is to push the boundaries of science to change the practice of medicine, transform the lives of patients living with cancer, and to ultimately eliminate cancer as a cause of death. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. As well as other tumor types, these are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies. The Global Publications Leader (GPL), Oncology delivers the strategic publications plan for the oncology franchise, and leads a cross-matrix team of AstraZeneca. Due to the importance of this portfolio, you must be an experienced publications professional, ready for new challenges with creative and collaborative problem-solving skills. The prominence of this role will provide you with opportunities for significant interactions with senior and global stakeholder in the organization as well as key external stakeholders. This is not a remote role. An in office presence of 3 days per week is required. Accountabilities/Responsibilities: Leading the development and execution of the publication strategy and tactical plan for global clinical studies in humans from Phase I-IV, and non-clinical trial sources including health economics and outcomes research, epidemiology, real-world evidence (RWE), payer, and non-interventional studies, aligned with a specific medical strategies and objectives Heading the development of scientific, clinical and RWE planning data into timely publications for prescribers, payers, and patients through disease state and medicine insights and leading effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and external alliances Tracking existing publication plans to ensure alignment with evidence plans The day-to-day management of assigned publication plans, delivery of outputs, financial tracking and meeting activities, working closely with all members of the delivery team Developing a thorough understanding of internal and external stakeholders to further the leverage of clinical and RWE studies Manage external agency partners to ensure accuracy of publication plan and publication deliverables with respect to time, quality and cost, and ensuring correct compliance documentation is in place including budgetary responsibilities Minimum Requirements – Education And Experience Relevant University Degree (BS/BA) OR Advanced degree in a scientific or medical discipline (eg PharmD, PhD, MD) Poise in senior leader engagement Ability to prioritize, thrive and execute in high pressure situations Clear and effective communication skills Collaborative and consultative cross-matrix abilities The ability to appreciate and work within a large strategic framework, while maintaining strong attention to detail and compliance to global publications ethical standards and company publications policy and SOPs A blend of strategic agility and tactical execution skills Passion, ambition and a flair for strong team leadership across the organization Demonstrated performance, budget, and resource management skills in a global organization Ability to understand and adhere to good publication practices and relevant guidelines on and scientific data communication, such as ICMJE, GPP3, company policy and SOPs Skills And Capabilities Strong therapeutic knowledge in oncology Complete multiple projects with a common deadline Experience in collaboration within a medical affairs organization Broad understanding of drug development process Experience in medical communications gained through working in the pharmaceutical industry or a medical communications agency Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with external experts, investigators, journal editors and publishers and professional bodies Flexibility and adaptability to manage long-term activities in a constantly changing internal and external environment Working knowledge of Datavision publication management systems Certification as a Medical Publication Professional (CMPP) desired Together, as ambitious experts, we’re building the future and leading the next wave of transformation for our patients, business and Oncology. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

jobTitle: Global QC Lead - Process Analytical Technology
jobDescription: Are you ready for an opportunity to join AstraZeneca in a lead role with a focus on leading the deployment and integration of enhanced control strategies for continuous manufacturing? Are you seeking a leadership opportunity to push the boundaries of science, transforming our operation to the factory of the future which incorporates advanced analytical capabilities in process analytical technology (PAT) and predictive methods of analysis, and growing our science and technology capabilities? We are looking for a talented Global QC Lead - Process Analytical Technology (PAT), to strengthen our capabilities in the area of analytical science towards control strategies developed using an enhanced approach. If you believe that you have operations Quality and manufacturing knowledge based in science then join us in our Global Quality & Stability organization! This role will have global responsibilities and can be based at our site in Sweden or globally. Here at Global Quality & Stability, we work at the forefront of advanced technologies and digitalization with a focus on delivering high quality medicines to our patients leveraging our talented and diverse global team. We are always looking for creative and innovate ways to ensure we can consistently meet our patient’s needs. Our organization, The Global Quality & Stability group owns, the delivery of Global Quality Control Strategy to improve and sustain the Global QC operation with processes to enable efficient delivery of safe and effective medicines to patients. We proactively integrates quality into our supply chain advancing beyond our compliance license to operate. We are accountable for the following areas: Global Quality Control Global Stability Global Microbiology Global Materials Certification What You’ll Do This position will give you the opportunity to work in a dynamic and enthusiastic atmosphere, whilst leading in the deployment and application of process analytical technologies to enable enhanced control strategies in support of AstraZeneca’s product portfolio. In this role you will work closely with a team of colleagues in a multi-skilled environment to operationalize in our commercial production facilities ensuring appropriate quality management systems are in place to support using of PAT methods including model predictive controls, advanced process control, multi-variate data analytics, and predictive models. Continuous improvement will be at the core of everything you do, and you will support the PAT Strategy and advanced process control (including model predictive controls/APC/MVDA) to ensure that our organization is on the frontline of emerging technologies and tools, including continuous manufacturing & digital transformation. This position will give you the chance to lead and set clear direction for the organization in “cutting edge” areas , advising others at a high level, and being at the fore-front of external interactions. The role will deliver on the following objectives: Application of PAT to capitalize on product lifecycle management opportunities. Identification of manufacturing process monitoring step data and correlated to QC results, that can be used for regulatory submissions and business cases for change Product launch considerations with PAT from development through to regulatory submission Sustainability improvements through PAT applications Lead time improvements associated with PAT control and NPI launches Industry benchmarking and external advocacy position papers Serve as an expert/leader within Global Quality & Stability Organization, mentor colleagues in the area of enhanced control strategies and Process Analytical Technology (PAT), operationalizing our PAT Strategy transforming our business. Provide direction and advice on new science and technology within Quality Operations of enhanced control strategies with PAT, to take part in tech transfer of these advanced analytical methods. Continue to drive scientific excellence in the area of process analytical technology and advanced process control methodologies and technologies within the company. Provide leadership, coaching and mentorship to the QC Network other cross-functional colleagues. Contribute to regulatory documentation and post approval submissions, applying your understanding of quality and operational knowledge to requirements from medical authorities. Essential For The Role The Global QC Lead - PAT will implement new in-line, on-line and at-line real time or “near” real time analytical technology to support commercial manufacturing processes for a wide variety of molecules and modalities. Have a strong technical background in spectroscopy (Raman, FTIR, NIR, impedance), multivariate (chemometrics) modeling skills and/or process control for pharmaceutical API or Pharmaceutical processing and hands-on-experience and in-depth understanding of PAT concepts and its application to API or Pharmaceutical. Qualifications for this role include: Holds a minimum of Degree level in Pure or Applied Science (e.g., Biology, Chemistry, Pharmacy, Chemical Engineering) or other relevant scientific discipline and experience. A minimum of 10 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical / bio-pharmaceutical industry, including having direct site experience in Quality and GMP associated with the manufacture of Drug Product or Drug Substance. Sound knowledge and understanding of the principles and concepts of GMP, quality and compliance management, quality risk management and performance evaluation and control. Familiar with FTIR, NIR, Raman, particle size, UV and other measurement techniques that are suitable for PAT applications. Hands-on-experience and in-depth understanding of PAT concepts and its application to pharmaceutical development. Demonstrated experience with statistics, chemometrics, programming and data modeling packages such as Matlab, Unscrambler, Eigenvector PLS Toolbox, JMP etc. Desirable for the role Significant experience within the field of Process Analytical Technology (PAT), advanced process control and/or chemometrics , analytical sciences or similar discipline, ideally with specialism in an area relevant to application of PAT to support continuous manufacturing. Demonstrated leadership with direct/indirect management of highly skilled workforce is highly desirable. Demonstrated delivery of process analytical technology including advanced process control/MVDA, model predictive controls in support of pharmaceutical continuous processing. Well versed in ICH Q8, Q9, Q10, Q11 and Q13 guidance’s, Quality by Design principles, implementation of enhanced approaches for project/product specific control strategies. Experience in technology transfer and commercial manufacture using continuous processing. Experience in providing support for regulatory submissions (e.g. Investigational New Drug Applications, New Drug Applications). Why AstraZeneca? There are many opportunities to develop yourself and your career. From our diverse portfolio and teamwork to our cutting-edge innovations – it’s a place for lifelong learning. Ultimately, it’s more than a job. We know that our work impacts people with serious conditions, many of whom have no other alternatives. That’s what drives us – the potential to impact over one billion patients worldwide.
