AstraZeneca discovers and develops medicines in 4 core areas of Oncology, Respiratory and Immunology (R&I), and Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolic Disease (CVRM). Oncology Safety, a global department within the Clinical Pharmacology and Safety Sciences (CPSS) function, is looking for an experienced histology technician to join their teams to develop and advance our portfolio of innovative anti-cancer medicines in Oncology R&D. As an histology technician you will work at the forefront of experimental pathology and safety science, working in a multidisciplinary environment where you will help progress a rich and diverse pipeline which includes small molecules, cutting-edge mAb-based therapeutics, antibody conjugates, next generation cellular and viral therapies. Job Summary: We are seeking an outstanding scientist experienced in histology to join our CPSS Pathology team. The successful candidate will provide support to the safety assessment of toxicity, pharmacodynamic, and efficacy animal studies in an exciting collaborative team environment. Specific activities for this role include routine histology techniques (tissue processing, embedding, microtomy, and staining), immunohistochemistry, and advanced molecular techniques. Responsibilities: Activities include tissue trimming, dehydration, infiltration, embedding, microtomy, mounting and sectioning of paraffin tissue blocks, preparing high quality microscope slides for pathology assessment. Perform histochemical and immunohistochemical stains on a variety of preclinical study tissues using automated staining platforms (i.e. Ventana). Develop immunohistochemical protocols to investigate mechanisms of toxicity Prepare and maintain all necessary lab instruments and reagents, including stains, alcohols, and paraffins according to proper specifications. Maintain digital archive of stained slides by scanning and using Aperio eSlide Manager and digital laboratory notebook Perform image analysis using HALO imaging software in collaboration with pathologists and present data to project safety teams Requirements/ Qualifications: Minimum bachelor’s degree in biological sciences >1 year relevant histology experience Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining high-quality slide production Excellent communication skills, enthusiastic, self-motivating Ability to work and effectively communicate in a local and global team environment Why AstraZeneca? Would you like to apply your expertise in Immunology in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AZ, we’re proud to have an exceptional workplace culture that encourages innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives – and made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. AZ is a place where passionate people can immerse themselves in their work and make significant contributions to scientific excellence and medicines – does this describe a place where you would like to work? The B cell Hub group is at the heart of the Biologics Engineering department. We discover antibodies in support of all therapeutic areas. We are a science-led expert function of people with curious minds that supports the discovery and engineering of novel biomolecules. We are passionate about collaboration and developing groundbreaking technologies to create the next generation of biotherapeutics to improve patients’ lives. What you'll do: The Department of Antibody Discovery and Protein Engineering in Gaithersburg, MD is seeking a talented and highly motivated Scientist to enhance our monoclonal antibody discovery platform using flow cytometry. The successful candidate will operate the SH800 cell sorter and perform phenotyping studies and FACS of immune B cells for a variety of monoclonal antibody discovery programs. We are seeking a candidate with expertise in Immunology that is excited by translational research. The candidate will operate in collaboration with a diverse group of scientists to actively drive technological innovations. The selected individual will be a well-organized and highly productive scientist with expertise in flow cytometry and FACS that can design the flow cytometric experiments, operate the cell sorter efficiently, as well as interpret, analyze, and present the data. The selected candidate will participate in flow cytometry projects through assay development, validation, and execution in a timely manner. The main duties will include the separation of immune cells, the design and testing of multiparametric flow cytometry staining reagent panels, performing immunological assays, and maintaining the equipment. Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience: Essential Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Immunology or other related fields with 5-7 years of relevant experience in the industry (preferred) or academia or Master’s degree with 3-5 years of relevant experience in the industry (preferred) or academia The successful candidate should be an expert in flow cytometry and FACS The ideal candidate will also have experience in the isolation of human peripheral mononuclear cells, magnetic separation of immune cells, flow cytometry, and serological and immunological assays The ideal candidate will also have experience in monoclonal antibody and protein conjugation, fluorescent dye chemistry, immune cells isolation and separation, multiparametric flow cytometry, cell culture, immunophenotyping, and common immunological assays. The individual should have demonstrated experience in optimizing/troubleshooting new protocols with a problem-solving mindset and be adept at learning new platforms and skills. The individual should also be self-motivated, embrace new technologies, and have demonstrated an ability to work within teams. Preferred Requirements: Molecular biology skills (PCR, recombinant cloning, etc.,) would also be highly advantageous. Strong communication skills are highly desirable. Why AstraZeneca? AstraZeneca has an opportunity for a Scientist position within the Bioscience Metabolism group of the Early Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism department (eCVRM). What You'll Do: Administration of therapeutic modalities, including ASOs, to rodent models. Independently execute ex vivo analysis of blood/tissue samples including qPCR gene expression, Western blots, and ELISAs. Take part in all experimental work, including the design, analysis and interpretation of data from these experiments. Prepare and present scientific data to eCVRM in vivo group meetings (essential) and project team meetings. Work in a cross-functional project team with responsibility of making decisions and recommendations for program in vivo pharmacology plans. Develop an understanding of the scientific basis of the eCVRM project pipeline, to be able to successfully execute experiments needed to meet the requirements of the projects involved with. Contribute to eCVRM preclinical model work and/or development including areas of NASH, obesity, dyslipidemia, CV and diabetic kidney disease. Execution of metabolism in vivo assays including GTTs, ITTs, and measurement food intake. The successful candidate will be greatly involved with experimental work, including the design, execution and interpretation of preclinical experimental data. Additionally, the candidate will present results to the eCVRM group and project team meetings. The ability to work well in a team environment, and to interact with departments outside of eCVRM is essential for this position. Essential For The Role: MS Degree in a biological science field with 3+ years of relevant experience; OR BS and 5+ years of relevant experience. Highly proficient in working with rodent models of NASH, diabetes and obesity. Hands-on expertise in animal handling, dosing (SC, IV, PO and IM), and necropsy tissue collections. Experience in surgical procedures desirable. Experience in pharmaceutical industry desirable. Hands-on in vivo pharmacology experience, particularly in rodent models of diabetes, obesity and NASH. Expertise in working with anti-sense oligonucleotides would be a plus, and ex vivo lab techniques including tissue gene expression, ELISAs, western blot analysis etc. Desirable for the Role: Experience in surgical procedures desirable. Experience in pharmaceutical industry desirable.

Gaithersburg, MD AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious diseases. But we are more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, we are proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration through scientific research. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. About The Role You will work as a member of the Protein Sciences group in Gaithersburg, MD, where you will be responsible for planning and executing the purification of proteins to advance the AstraZeneca pipeline and to perform protein purification on a milligram scale for a wide variety of proteins including both drug targets and complex biopharmaceutical drugs such as bi-specific antibodies or fusion proteins. You will participate in solving protein purification problems such as aggregate removal, endotoxin removal, conjugation, untagged protein purification, and glycoform separation. You will coordinate closely with other groups to meet project timelines and company goals. You will also be analyzing and interpreting analytical data, and contributing to appropriate experimental plans. You will maintain accurate records of data and actively participate in laboratory organization. Given the scope of this dynamic role and the need to multitask, it is essential to be a fast learner, excellent communicator, well organized, innovative and able to work independently when designing and executing experiments as well as to manage and prioritize tasks. Furthermore, you should demonstrate enthusiasm, motivation, attention to detail and willingness to learn new technologies, flexibility and confidence. The job is highly complex, requiring a good understanding of an understanding of the biological and chemical properties of recombinant proteins and data analyses. Essential Requirements As a Scientist Bioscience, your skills and qualifications will ideally include: B.S./B.A. in biochemistry, chemical/biochemical engineering, or related field. Experienced with FPLC purification of proteins at multi-milligram scale, including affinity, ion-exchange, and size-exclusion chromatography. Experienced with SDS-PAGE and Western blotting. Ability to troubleshoot and collaboratively resolve complex problems under tight time constraints. Good oral and written communication skills. Great teammate and customer focused mentality. Desired Qualifications Experience with antibody structure, characterization and Fab cleavage methods. Experience solving challenging protein purification problems such as aggregate removal, endotoxin removal, conjugation, untagged protein purification, membrane protein purification, and glycoform separation. Experience with protein characterization by intact and peptide mass spectrometry. Experience with protein/protein complex size characterization by SEC-MALS. Experience with Octet or Biacore binding measurements. Experience with enzyme kinetics. Experience with transformation, culture, and expression of proteins in E. coli. Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Biopharmaceutical Development group is a multi-disciplinary scientific function providing expertise in Process/Analytical/Formulation/Devices Development and Characterization with integrated Bioprocess Engineering, Clinical Manufacturing, and Supply Chain and Logistics operations. The group is also responsible for transferring the processes to different commercial sites in and outside the AstraZeneca organization. BPD group is present in multiple sites including Gaithersburg, MD and Cambridge UK. The Purification Process Sciences Group is accountable for purification and conjugation process development of complex biopharmaceuticals including monoclonal antibodies, antibody-drug conjugates, vaccines and viral vectors. This group assists in the scale up and technical transfer of processes to different clinical and commercial sites and also supports manufacturing deviations and regulatory submissions as needed. Job Description The Scientist in this position is expected to have a thorough understanding of protein and viral vector purification techniques and principles including liquid chromatography, normal and cross flow filtration. The Scientist s expected to design, develop and execute protein and viral vector purification processes to meet early stage process development objectives and timelines. The candidate is expected to assist in the preparation of regulatory documents. Develop and characterize purification processes for the manufacture of complex biopharmaceuticals including monoclonal antibodies, vaccines and viral vectors Identify and evaluate new methods and technologies for purification process development Maintain accurate records of experimental data Present and discuss experimental results at group/project meetings Prepare and review process development reports Function with limited supervision and is expected to work independently on a day-to-day basis. Expectation for independence will increase with time and experience in the position. Education & Experience Requirements: Scientist: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Biochemistry, Biology, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering, or related field. MS and a minimum of 2 years of relevant purification process development experience, preferably in a biopharmaceutical industry setting OR BS and a minimum of 5+ years of relevant purification process development, preferably in a biopharmaceutical industry setting Required Skills: Basic knowledge of protein chemistry and purification Hands on experience performing protein chromatography using AKTA systems and software or similar Hands on experience performing filtrations, including depth, normal and tangential flow filtrations Hands-on experience with basic analytical techniques including SDS-PAGE, protein concentration measurements and HPLC Excellent teamwork, communication, and time management skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office (or related) programs Desired Skills: Experience with biopharmaceutical process development in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry Experience with monoclonal antibody and/or adeno associated virus purification process development Experience with high throughput process development strategies and liquid handling workstations Knowledge of design of experiment (DOE) Analysis of data using statistical analysis software such as JMP Why AstraZeneca? Summary of the group: This position in Early Stage Formulation Sciences is a laboratory-based position to develop technologies to support formulation and process development activities of therapeutic protein products from pre‐clinical through pivotal clinical trials. The position will involve developing and implementing innovative and modern techniques to characterize formulation and process resulting in appropriate stability profiles. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Develop formulation, process and analytical technologies for spray-dried and freeze-dried dosage form that impact the critical quality attributes of the product during early as well as late stage of formulation development. Understanding of spray-dried, freeze-dried and freeze-thaw formulation and process development is highly desired. Present data from formulation as well as technology development activities at internal and external meetings. Education & Experience Requirements: BS, MS or PhD in pharmaceutical sciences, biochemistry, biochemical/chemical engineering or related field. Scientist: Bachelors degree and 8+ years OR Masters degree 5+ years of experience in pharmaceutical industry/academia as appropriate (biotechnology area preferred). Senior Scientist: Bachelors degree and 10+ years OR Masters degree 8+ years OR PhD 0+ years of experience in pharmaceutical industry/academia as appropriate (biotechnology area preferred). Required Skills: Experience with protein/peptide formulation, spray-drying/freeze-drying process design and development Experience and understanding of routinely used analytical techniques (HPLC, UV‐vis spectroscopy, HIAC, MFI, DSC, Rheometer, CD, Fluorescence, FTIR) for formulation development. Strong interpersonal skills, along with outstanding verbal and written communication skills are essential The desire and ability to thrive in an interdisciplinary, fast‐paced team environment is an integral part of this position. Detail oriented, diligent, careful in observation and work Ability to mentor junior staff and peers across matrix teams Desired Skills: Experience with spray-dried and freeze‐dried formulation characterization and process development are a plus. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Bioassay, Biosafety and Impurities analytical group is accountable for developing state-of-the-art methods to evaluate product quality by measuring biological activity as well as detecting, characterizing, and quantifying product variants and process-related impurities. The group enables product understanding, manufacturing process development, formulation, drug product development and regulatory filings. This group is accountable for control systems, including specifications, comparability, and shelf-life strategies required by regulatory agencies and also performs technical transfer of methods to clinical quality control and commercial launch sites and technical support and lifecycle management post-launch. The candidate will be independent, self-motivated, and eager to tackle a broad range of responsibilities. This full-time position within the Bioassay, Biosafety and Impurities Department, within Biopharmaceutical Development, is located in Gaithersburg, Maryland. Main Duties & Responsibilities: The successful candidate will develop and deliver state of the art, robust, and fit-for-purpose biological assays to enable the progression of biotherapeutic products from research to commercialization. The candidate will employ an array of biological methods for assay development, and support a diverse pipeline of biotherapeutic modalities, including: monoclonal antibodies, antibody drug conjugates, bispecific antibodies, and inhaled biologics. Moreover, the candidate will represent bioassay development within various teams, collaborate cross-functionally, and will learn to support regulatory filings for INDs up to and including BLAs. Specific duties and responsibilities are as follows: Lead the development, optimization, qualification, and tech transfer of a variety of cell- and non-cell based bioassays. Assays enable product characterization and GMP release and stability testing for a wide range of biotherapeutic modalities. Identify, evaluate, and implement cutting-edge technologies to develop assays. Make detailed observations, analyze data, interpret results, and exercise appropriate technical discretion in the design, execution, and interpretation of experiments under minimal supervision. Document detailed experimental plans, reports, and summaries in a timely manner. Present summaries at group/project team meetings and at scientific conferences. Serve as technical lead for developed assays to support potency testing and biological characterization. Learn to represent bioassay development and control strategy at analytical and CMC team meetings, as well as interface cross-functionally between Research and Development departments. Author and review documents, including assay development reports, SOPs, assay transfer plans/reports, qualification plans/reports, CMC sections of regulatory filings, and scientific journal publications. Education & Experience Requirements Education: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Cellular or Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering, Biotechnology, or related field. Experience: Scientist: Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years or Master’s degree with 2+ years of related experience in industry or academia. Senior Scientist: Bachelor’s degree with 7+ years, Master’s degree with 5+ years, or PhD with 0+ years of relevant experience in industry or academia. Required Skills: The successful candidate will have in-depth understanding and hands-on experience with developing assays to measure various biological activities, including: ligand/receptor binding, alteration of intracellular signaling, induction of cell death, and/or Fc effector functions. The candidate should have extensive hands-on experience with 2 or more of the following assay types: ELISAs, immunoassays, HTRF, alphaLISA, reporter gene assays, cell death assays, cell proliferation assays. Independence with designing experiments, analyzing data, and interpreting results from these assays. Willing to work collaboratively and cross-functionally. Excellent organization skills, detailed-oriented, and strong written and oral communication skills. Desired Experience: Experience with authoring and reviewing laboratory procedures, experimental plans, and data analyses with keen attention to detail. Experience with CMC analytical and bioassay development activities, such as with tech transfer, method qualification, and CMC team representation, is a plus. GMP experience is a plus. AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. We are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. AstraZeneca has a multifaceted environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build talent. Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of multiple scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programs. The Translational Medicine (TM) function exists within Hematology R&D to ensure effective and strategic biomarker studies for Hematology & Oncology project teams. Closely interacting with the pre-clinical BioScience and Discovery, Early Clinical Development, and Precision Medicine & Biosamples diagnostics functions, the Hematology Translational Medicine team is the single point of accountability for delivery of robust, scientifically-driven biomarkers to all Hematology project teams, providing feasibility assessments, technical validation, centralized biomarker analysis capability for clinical samples, delivery of translational science research and early clinical phase engagement. Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities The Scientist, Translational Research will more specifically in this role: Design, execute and interpret studies for validation of new targets and therapeutic agents in oncology and hematology. Conduct hands-on laboratory research, evaluate potential drug targets, develop and validate novel assays, profile existing compounds and characterize new compounds in a variety of hematologic malignancies. Support preclinical research for early assets in collaboration with Bioscience and Discovery teams. Utilize literature reviews, protocols, networking, and prior laboratory experience to assist with experimental design, assay development, workflow optimization and troubleshooting. Plan and execute department goals with minimum guidance from direct manager. Maintain accurate and well-organized laboratory records, including worksheets, lab notebooks, inventories, and databases. Analyze experimental data, organize results, verify data integrity, perform statistical analysis, and visualize data using appropriate software. Write research papers, abstracts, technical reports, and SOPs. Effectively present and communicate research findings to internal and external collaborators, including upper management, regulatory agencies, and at research conferences. Perform all duties in compliance with internal SOPs and external regulations. Assist with general laboratory maintenance and housekeeping. May train graduate students, trainees, and other laboratory personnel. Qualifications: Doctorate degree in Biology, Immunology or related discipline, or Master’s degree with 1+ years of laboratory experience, or Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of relevant laboratory experience. Current knowledge of hematology, cancer biology, and drug discovery. Hands-on experience with cell culture, in-vitro cell-based assays, ELISA and flow cytometry. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work well in a diverse team. Attention to detail and adherence to high quality standards when performing research, analyzing results and communicating data. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools including Outlook, Word, Excel and Power Point. Working at AstraZeneca Here you’ll have the chance to create a substantial difference to patients’ lives! With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and crafting the patient ecosystem. Next Steps? Apply now! AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements. Gaithersburg or Wilmington, US Competitive Salary And Benefits The Search and Evaluation Associate Director, is a key role in Biopharmaceuticals Business Development R&D, AstraZeneca. The role holder supports global Business Development initiatives and has a direct impact on the scientific strategy and portfolio. The Search and Evaluation (S&E) group is responsible for driving search efforts of external innovation throughout the Biopharmaceuticals community. Also conducting technical due diligence activities that ensure an in-depth understanding of investment opportunities and provide effective decision-making tools for the organization. The role holder will have an impact on strategic development of Biopharmaceuticals ensuring that the portfolio is delivered and that the science, capabilities and portfolio are fit for future challenges and opportunities. The successful candidate will have a strong R&D scientific background, experience of drug discovery projects, and excellent communication skills. In addition, an ability to engage and collaborate across boundaries with an entrepreneurial attitude and delivery focus. Major Duties and Responsibilities: Reporting to the Global Head of S&E, he/she is responsible for Search and Evaluation of external in-licensing opportunities from academia, biotech’s and peer-pharma including early research projects, new modality platforms, clinical stage candidates and Life Cycle Management (LCM) opportunities Responsible for supporting and leading cross functional project teams and integrating input from various functional areas across the organization to create high quality, clear and concise confidential evaluation and due diligence reports of external assets and provide recommendations to senior governance bodies. Works constructively with key stakeholders and cross-functional teams including commercial to ensure effective communication, efficient decision-making for business cases, to support completion of transactions with BD teams in a timely manner Culture Create a dynamic, entrepreneurial and externally facing organization which enables an internally and externally collaborative culture with calculated risk taking. Collaborate closely with colleagues in Business Development, and across business to identify and exploit cross-business opportunities and embed best practice. Education: 5 years PhD or MD and post-doc or MBA experience Requirements and Qualifications: Strong scientific reputation from previous positions Ability to interact and communicate effectively Proven leadership abilities in pharma / biotech environments with demonstrable knowledge of pre-clinical and clinical R&D . Ability to think critically, creatively and to anticipate and solve problems Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, highly-matrixed work environment Experience in a BD environment and understanding of contractual and transactional matters an advantage Looking for individuals with good communication/interpersonal skills and who have had demonstrated an ability to work with a diverse cross-functional team Leadership and behaviours Fulfil leadership and behaviour criteria for roles on lower career ladders Excellent communicator who take responsibility for decisions made. Role model engagement and commitment. Understand the wider AstraZeneca business priorities Appreciate that scientific expertise needs to be balanced with business leadership Able to actively seek collaboration in a complex matrix structure Reporting line Reports to Global Head of Search and Evaluation, Biopharmaceuticals R&D, R&I, V&I Closing date: 4th December 2022. For informal enquires/questions please contact John Taylor. John.D.Taylor@astrazeneca.com

Senior Administrator - BioPharma R&D Gaithersburg At AstraZeneca, every one of our employees makes a difference to patient lives every day. Each and every one of us believes that science has the ability to change lives and that to deliver this takes many people with many skill sets. When we deliver a life-changing medicine, that success comes from the combined efforts of all of our people. About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. Are you a versatile and experienced senior administrative coordinator with strong project support experience seeking a challenging new adventure? This is an exciting opportunity to take on a challenging and varied role within our team. Your focus will be on providing high quality professional business support to senior leaders within our BioPharma R&D department. You’ll be encouraged and supported to think creatively in our dynamic environment. Here we are free from fear of failure, free to ask the right questions and make bold decisions. It takes resilience to embody our entrepreneurial spirit. For those who thrive on experimentation, you’ll get to work with knowns and unknowns. Exploring without limits. Part of a dynamic team, we’re empowered to make quick decisions. We can operate independently but know how to influence and work well with others. Typical Responsibilities: Diary management - Manage sophisticated calendars for our Early Respiratory and Immunology leadership team to schedule meetings, interviews, and special events; prioritize calendar conflicts. Provides specialist project based business support when required, eg. Co-ordination of consultancy contract requests, aassist with payment requests and serve as subject matter expert with Coupa and ePay Support Early R&I business support team with team events in Gaithersburg Handle multi-location domestic and international travel arrangements as well as live and virtual meetings/conferences Produce accurate, creative and timely materials using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Responds to more complex or escalated enquiries from other PA/administration staff Plans, organises, and schedules own workload through system maintenance so that all activities are completed accurately and on time Supporting onsite onboarding for eR&I Gaithersburg staff Create and maintain team distribution lists Support and contribute to creating a high performing business support team, facilitating good cross-team collaboration Essential Skills: Completed high school education 5+ years of experience in a senior administrative role supporting complex projects Diary management experience/calendar experience Strong knowledge of Microsoft office – outlook and PowerPoint Experience working in a fast-paced global environment balancing competing priorities Excellent organization skills and the ability to manage multiple projects or tasks simultaneously and efficiently, identifying high priority and urgent tasks for immediate action so that all activities are completed accurately and on time Desirable Skills: Pharmaceutical background Knowledge of systems such as SharePoint online, Concur, Coupa Ability to interact confidently with executives and employees at all levels Ability to prioritize time critical assignments Experience providing high quality, professional support service, working proactively and independently without day-to-day direction Ability to format documents for consistent, professional appearance and experience handling sensitive information in a confidential and discrete manner. Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability to meet changing business demands. Demonstrated proficiency with a variety of virtual meeting technologies, infor mation management software, and Microsoft products So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Cambridge- UK / Gothenburg – Sweden/ Wilmington – US Competitive Salary & Benefits Closing Date: Thursday 9th December Do you have expertise in, and passion to work as an AI Platform Engineer by joining the Enterprise AI Platforms and Operations Team? Would you like to apply your expertise in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven Biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. There are countless opportunities to develop and grow with AstraZeneca – working with top people to build a diverse career and learn what Commercial looks like at its best. A crucial step on the journey to being a future leader – it’s a fantastic opportunity if you’re up for the challenge. As a member of the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry (ABPI), all of our sales, marketing and communications activities are subject to the ABPI Code of Practice. If you’re encouraged by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do – join us! What You’ll Do As an AI Platform Engineer with an interest in building complex systems, you will be responsible for inventing how we use technology, machine learning, and data to enable the productivity of AstraZeneca. You will help build, deploy and develop our next generation of platforms and tools at scale. Collaborate with Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers from across the company to understand their challenges and work with them to build the platform that underpins their research Be a part of a hard-working agile team, continuously improving AstraZeneca’s Machine Learning development environments, platforms, and tooling Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g., distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU). Work closely and collaboratively with internal governance and compliance functions such as Cyber Security and Data Privacy to secure our estate without obstructing end-user productivity. Champion a “production first mindset” to ensure the necessary infrastructure and platforms are available to scale exploratory research to production. Liaise with other teams to enhance our technological stack, to enable the adoption of the latest advances in Data Processing and AI. Provide the vital AWS Services to support the deployment and monitoring of ML solutions in production Optimizing solutions for performance and scalability. Essential For The Role Significant experience with AWS cloud environments & services (e.g., SageMaker, Athena, S3, EC2, RDS, Glue, etc.) is essential. Demonstrable knowledge of building data science and machine learning environments to a production standard. Modern DevOps mindset, using best of breed DevOps toolchains, such as Docker, Git. Experience with infrastructure as code technology such as Ansible, Terraform and Cloud Formation Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g., distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU) Strong software coding skills, with proficiency in Python, however exceptional ability in any language will be recognized. Experience with SAFe agile principles and practices. Experience working with internal security standards and frameworks Desirable for the role Experience in implementing & maintaining GxP compliant life science systems, will be looked upon favourably Certification in appropriate areas will be viewed favourably. Experience building large scale data processing pipelines. e. g. Hadoop/Spark and SQL. Multi cloud experience (AWS/Azure/GCP) Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an outstanding Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and spark your high-reaching spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and partnership, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? jobTitle: Senior Automation Engineer–Analytical Sciences Physicochemical Development
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria, and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: The Physicochemical Development (PCD) group is accountable for the advancement of AstraZeneca’s biologics portfolio using industry-leading analytical technologies. The work performed in PCD group includes: 1) mature platform methodologies and analytical strategies to achieve analytical deliverables with consistency and efficiency; 2) advanced analytical capabilities to support diversified modalities innovation with a clear sense of purpose; 3) design, implement, and integrate robotics and automation in biologics laboratories supporting the biopharmaceutical development organization. Main Duties & Responsibilities: The Senior Automation Engineer position will support the R&D organization and will focus on the design, construction, and data management of robotics and high-throughput systems that will drive efficiency, inform decisions and enable discovery. The candidate must have automation experience, great organizational skills, related lab/instrument experience, excellent oral communication skills, good time management and outstanding multi-tasking abilities. Consistently build solutions that enable the integration of high-throughput, traditional bench-scale or manufacturing systems Lead scientific team efforts to establish world-class automation capabilities and co-develop an automation vision for the department Establishes working relationships and credibility outside the company Anticipates and resolves priority conflicts. Trains, mentors or supervises lower-level engineers or scientists. Education & Experience Requirements: BS, MS, or PhD in a relevant robotics and automation subject area (robotics, electronic engineering, mechanical engineering, computer engineering, etc.) accompanied by relevant work experience with bench science laboratory work. BS with 9+ years, MS with 7+ years or PhD with 1+ years of relevant experience Required Skills: Must have experience and skills in creating, modifying and troubleshooting laboratory robotics/automation scripts for 1 or more common liquid handling robotic automation platforms such as Hamilton/Venus (preferred) or Tecan/EVOware Application Specialty expertise of multiple laboratory automation instrument (TECAN, Hamilton, PerkinElmer, etc.) or high throughput analytics (plate readers, LabChip GX, Trinean, etc.) and demonstrated competency in enabling laboratory automation tools (Capper/decappers, plate seal/peel, tube labelers, automated barcode readers) is essential. Excellent time management, writing, presentation, and organizational skills, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced team-centered environment Demonstrated ability to Reskills as necessary to for evolving role Leads training and mentors others in areas of Application Specialty expertise Desired Skills: Hands-on experience automating and integrating R&D Bench science Demonstrated capabilities with a coding language or database management to maintain or create new tools is a plus Experience with establishing impactful collaborations in developing high throughput biologics analytical methods and automation solutions Demonstrated leadership promoting automation culture and technology innovation through, team participation, internal consulting and mentoring Certification training with 1 or more automation platforms (EVOware, Venus, Instinct, etc), 1 or more coding languages or computer aided design platforms a plus Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Check out our landing page for more information on our BPD group https://careers.astrazeneca.com/bpd Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

jobTitle: Senior Computational Biologist, Proteogenomics, Oncology Data Science
jobDescription: The Early Data Science Group delivers data-driven, actionable insights through the application of computational science to all areas of Astrazeneca’s Oncology portfolio. The group has substantial expertise and a renowned track record in data science and bioinformatics, undertaking both portfolio applied informatics research and the development of cutting edge capabilities. The Early Data Science team is growing to meet the strategic challenges pursued by AZ Oncology. We are looking for a talented and highly motivated Senior Scientist in Computational Biology with strong background in proteogenomics to join a team designing and applying cutting-edge computational analysis to drive novel therapeutics discovery, form clinical biomarker hypothesis, and advance our understanding of response and resistance mechanisms of novel therapeutics with a strong focus on AZ’s exciting and expanding proteogenomics research. You will have opportunities to forge close collaborations with oncology clinical proteomics lab, research and translational medicine teams, delivering state of art computational proteogenomics methods to enable novel hypothesis generation from preclinical and clinical proteogenomics data sets and will be working in an interdisciplinary environment. As a computational biologist, you will also have opportunities to contribute to the development of innovative methods for integrative analysis of multi-modal data employing advanced machine learning and AI technologies. To do this you will: Develop innovative analysis approaches for proteomic data from both global and targeted proteomics experiments Analyze proteogenomics data from both preclinical and clinical trial samples Work closely with our clinical proteomics lab to support novel proteomic techonology development and its application in clinical studies Be the domain expert of computational proteogenomics and proactively share knowledge and best practices with other data scientists Be an integral part of drug project to understand their scientific and technical challenges and proactively impact these using bioinformatics Use your familiarity with cancer biology/drug discovery to deliver actionable insights that impact development of the next generation of cancer medicines Work with our Research and Translational Medicine Leads to proactively influence the generation of data assets as part of a data generation strategy to evaluate novel hypothesis and drive target discovery Form effective collaborations with industry and academic partners, publish your work in high impact journals Essential For The Role PhD in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science or a related field Strong background and in-depth knowledge of mass-spectrometry based proteomics Expertise in the analysis of proteomics and/or post-translational modification proteomics data covering data QC, handling, processing & interpretation Experience in deriving causal inferences integrating genomics, proteomics and phosphoproteomics data Strong background in applying quantitative predictive and statistical analysis to drive scientific insights and form testable hypothesis Strong statistical analysis and programming skills in R and/or Python in a Unix environment making use of high-performance computing environments Good knowledge of cancer genetics and key algorithmic & statistical methods applicable to cancer genomics. Demonstrated experience in machine learning Highly developed communication skills that convey concise, biological stories from complex data. The ability to coordinate and pursue multiple simultaneous projects to tight deadlines Desirable for the roles Experience working with single-cell proteomics and/or spatial omics data Highly independent and experienced in a team based environment Well networked within external bioinformatics and oncology communities Strong external presentation and publication record

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist/ Associate Director Location: Barcelona ESP, Cambridge UK, Gothenburg, SE, Gaithersburg US, Mississauga CAN, Waltham US, Salary: Competitive & Excellent Benefits Package Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem. With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is forward-thinking. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society At AstraZeneca, we’re not afraid to do things differently. We’re building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening up new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. We believe in the potential of our people and you’ll develop beyond what you thought possible. We make the most of your skills and passion by actively supporting you to ensure realization of your potential. You’ll join an energized team and work on projects that offer a wide range of on-going learning and career development opportunities. To ensure that we can go after any molecular target with a therapeutic promise, AstraZeneca has invested in establishing a variety of therapeutic modalities that act via different mechanisms of action. We are now seeking a quick-learning Bioinformatics researcher with strong desire to enable the emerging area of gene editing and cell therapy in drug discovery and development. The successful candidate will have a rare opportunity to learn and contribute to drug development across disease areas and phases. The successful candidate will join us in the Imaging and Data Analytics department, within the Clinical pharmacology and Safety Sciences (CPSS) function at AstraZeneca. The candidate will partner with CPSS scientists and interact across the R&D therapeutic area units spanning multiple strategic global locations for enabling safe and efficacious therapeutic candidates. The candidate will use computational approaches to generate biological insights, enable new data science capabilities, and will drive many computational efforts focused on advancing molecular-level understanding of drug effects, thus accelerating the development of novel therapeutic drugs for patients in need. The position is a unique opportunity to gain experience in a variety of computational approaches and work with industry leaders, while publishing and contributing directly to the development of future drugs across many diseases. Responsibilities Build in silico capabilities to advance understanding of molecular mechanisms using multi modal omics approaches, to identify, measure and characterise on- and off target editing in the context of CRISPR-engineered cell and gene therapy products. Drive hypothesis generation by applying computational biology approaches, data integration, and biological knowledge Build and/or implement new computational biology capabilities to translate biological data into insights Collaborate with academic research groups and contribute to publications in peer-reviewed journals Help educate and train AstraZeneca colleagues in computational biology and related areas Identify and proactively help to enable new ways of gaining insights through biological data Requirements PhD in computational biosciences (e.g., computational biology, bioinformatics, genomics or computer science) Demonstrated experience in genomics, particularly in variant calling (detection of structural and single nucleotide variants). Excellent knowledge of large genomic datasets and tools to analyze such large genomic datasets Demonstrated expertise in R or Python, together with data visualization frameworks (eg, ggplot2, matplotlib or others) Use of basic statistics (e.g., parametric and non-parametric tests), basic data science (eg, dimensionality reduction) and good experimental design practices (e.g., batch effects, confounding factors) A keen interest in learning data science techniques, such as machine learning, for biological problems Teammate mentality and ability to explain complex topics to scientists from other subject areas Desirable: Skill-sets in additional computational biology domains such as sequence analysis, scRNA-seq, transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics are a plus. Good understanding of gene editing or cell therapy approaches Knowledge of molecular mechanisms of disease or human biomedicine Excellent ability to work on multiple projects at the same time Knowledge of drug discovery or pharmaceutical development Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering innovative methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Do you have expertise in, and passion for, Digital Accessibility? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? If so, AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About Astrazeneca AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. Background Digital products and services are becoming increasingly important for AstraZeneca, whether these are aimed at patients (e.g. an asthma inhaler connected to a mobile app to remind patients to take their medicines), doctors or colleagues (e.g. a web tool for scientists to visualize real-time data coming from a clinical trial). We are in the early stages of an accessibility journey aspiring to understand and uplift capabilities to meet all our users' needs. You will be working as part of a global UX team where the focus is on finding the best experiences to make a real difference in people's lives. Role Description We are looking for an energetic self-starter who is passionate about creating a digital world that all can participate in and who can work with the challenges that may arise during the early stages of accessibility maturity within a large organization. This role will be a healthy mix of independent and collaborative work covering end-to-end accessibility needs, working with various organizational roles, such as the business, technical and creative sides. This role will have to focus on providing guidance in plain language and training existing functions on the relevant accessibility skills. This role requires a mix of remote and in-person collaboration with at least three days in the office. Requirements (Technical) Extensive knowledge and experience in digital accessibility WCAG 2.1 and an understanding of usability principles that impact users with disabilities. Strong knowledge of national and international disability laws and regulations (US, Canada, UK, EU, China, Japan, etc.). The ability to focus on the needs and experiences of users while meeting the requirement of accessible user experience. Experience conducting wireframes/ designs audits and remediation before they are sent for development. Design formats may include Figma/ Adobe XD/ PDF/ JPG/ PPT/ etc. Experience conducting accessibility audits and remediation of websites for desktop/ mobile formats. Experience with accessible app development. Experience conducting accessibility audits and remediation for documents such as PPT and PDF. Experience running training to share knowledge, trends, and standard methodologies. Experience in accessible coding practices related to HTML5, CSS, ARIA (ability to inspect, read, manipulate, and explain to developers). Experience testing websites manually with various assistive tools such as screen readers, speech-to-text, etc. Understanding of “why” that is driving the requirements, and not just requirements themselves. An excellent presenter with the ability to explain in plain language accessibility issues and potential solutions, with appropriate rationale, in both written and spoken formats and in simple, non-technical language. Experience with UX design and interactive prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Axure, Adobe XD) is preferred. Experience working across a large organization with groups of various levels of accessibility awareness. The ability to conduct user research and usability testing as it relates to accessibility is a plus! Requirements (Soft Skills) A self-starter, not requiring hand-holding. Motivation to be a change agent. The energy and pro-activity to develop new business opportunities for yourself and the wider UX team. Strong and motivated self-starter, comfortable working alone, collaborating closely with designers, product managers, business analysts, technical developers, etc., and as part of a project team. Excellent influencing skills, including the ability to evangelize accessibility. Able to successfully juggle the competing demands of multiple concurrent projects, shifting priorities, and rapid change within a global corporate environment; solid project management skills Comfortable working in person and through MS teams. Education: Bachelor’s or associate degree in a relevant technology field (Computer Engineering, Science, HCI, design, etc.) or comparable job experience. 5+ years of experience interpreting, applying, and remediating WCAG UX and a11y standard processes Certifications: IAAP Certified Professional in Accessibility Core Competencies (CPACC) and/or IAAP Web Accessibility Specialist (WAS) a plus! WHY JOIN US? We’re a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There’s a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that’s unique to AstraZeneca – it allows us to dive deep into exploring new groundbreaking technology. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science. We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification. We’re not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent – we speak up, think creatively and share ideas. Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate, and an appreciation for high standards. It takes challenging the status quo to contribute in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact. Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors! SO, WHAT’S NEXT? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we’d love to hear from you! Click the link to apply and we’ll be in touch as soon as we can. WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE? An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. Background Digital products and services are becoming increasingly important for AstraZeneca, whether these are aimed at patients (e.g. an asthma inhaler connected to a mobile app to remind patients to take their medicines), doctors or colleagues (e.g. a web tool for scientists to visualize real-time data coming from a clinical trial). jobTitle: Senior Director, Bioconjugate Therapeutics, Biologics Engineering
jobDescription: Location: Gaithersburg, US At AstraZeneca we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe. As a part of our Biologics Engineering (BE) team in Gaithersburg, MD, you’ll play a pivotal role in channelling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most pioneering technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. The Senior Director, Bioconjugate Therapeutics will lead a multidisciplinary team playing a significant role in biologics drug discovery and new technology development in the area of antibody-drug conjugates and nanomedicines. The individual will be a member of the Biologics Engineering Team and will contribute to the overall strategy and direction of BE. Major responsibilities include: Lead technology development/protein engineering to improve tissue specific targeting and therapeutic index of ADCs, nanomedicines and radioimmunoconjugates. These include site-specific conjugation, linker engineering, novel warhead development, antibody design and optimization, and the utilization of antibody fragments, protein scaffolds, bispecifics and other formats. Interact and collaborate with leaders and teams across key therapeutic areas (Oncology, Respiratory/Immunology, Cardiovascular/Metabolic diseases) on pipeline delivery and new technology development. The initial focus is on Oncology, but will extend to multiple therapeutic areas in the near future. Work closely with Biopharmaceutical Development (BPD) to ensure new therapeutic molecules are compatible with CMC requirement. Partner with Business Development to pursue investments that further the BE strategy. Establish a network of external partners from academia and industry to strengthen capabilities and capacity in ADC, radioimmunoconjugates and nanomedicine area. Develop and manage operating budget. Provide growth, career development and carry out performance management for staff. Education/Experience Requirements: PhD in a relevant scientific area, such as antibody or protein engineering, protein biochemistry, biotechnology or similar field plus a minimum of 10 years of professional experience in biologics research. Required Skills: Recognized leader in scientific specialty as evidenced by publications, participation in international conference, membership on journal editorial boards, etc. They must be an excellent communicator and highly effective in interacting with key internal and external business partners. Ability to establish high level strategies for new drug technologies, and ability to apply new technologies to drug discovery. The candidate must be a standout colleague and builder, possess great coaching skills and have great organizational skills. The successful candidate must have a high degree of integrity and professionalism. Desired Skills: Knowledge in chemistry and cancer biology is a plus. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? A place built on courage, curiosity, and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take calculated risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and passionate about the possibilities, then we are keen to hear from you! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Next steps: Submit an application today, or connect with our Talent Acquisition Partner - Sam Hunter: https://www.linkedin.com/in/samhunter1/ or our Talent Scout, Ellen Willcox: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ellen-willcox-03a2b1/ for a confidential discussion to explore this opportunity further. We are looking forward to hearing from you! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a phenomenal fit, please share this posting with them

jobTitle: Senior Director, Biometrics Team Leader- Late Oncology Hematology
jobDescription: This position could be based out of Gaithersburg - MD; Waltham - MA; or Wilmington - DE. Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. Our Biometrics department drives design to generate data needed for quality decision making. Our goal is to drive excellence in delivery, improve decision making, while engaging and shaping the external environment by accessing and implementing innovative solutions. The extensive experience in the pharmaceutical industry to independently lead a biometrics team to deliver project and/or technical level activities related to design, delivery and interpretation, high level internal governance committees and/or regulatory submissions. Senior Director, Biometrics Team Leader- Late Oncology Hematology ensure Biometrics input and support for drug projects in a clinical development program across a business unit. The accountabilities for the Senior Director, Biometrics Team Leader are: To globally lead, manage and develop a group of statisticians. Ensures drug projects are successfully delivered by leading biometrics support and strategy. This includes Development Plans, Regulatory Strategy and Submissions, high level internal governance committees, Health Technology Assessment and Reimbursement/Payer and Commercial support as appropriate for the stage of the product. Provide leadership to staff on the product world-wide so that all work is carried out with regards to AZ standards and external regulations. Develop collaboration with external opinion leaders, consultants, and collaborative groups. Provide leadership and direct contribution to functional and/or cross-functional improvement projects/activities/ initiatives. Lead Biometrics resourcing to deliver projects and provide input on internal vs outsourcing delivery. Maintain understanding and awareness of, as well and investigate and implement, new methodologies, therapy area and drug development advancements. Represent AZ and Statistics to Health Authorities and Reimbursement/Payer Organizations or high level internal governance committees for specific projects/indications. Required Skills: Master’s degree with 10 plus years of experience, or PhD degree with 7 plus years of experience Preferred Skills: Advance degree in statistics, biostatistics, mathematics (containing a substantial statistical component) with experience in pharma/healthcare or other relevant area Track record of background in leading independently In depth knowledge of technical/regulatory requirements with experience in pharma/healthcare Exemplary technical skills Excellent communication skills and ability to build strong relationships Managerial experience Excellent collaboration required – needs the energy to work across global & functional boundaries both internally and externally Vision – keen awareness of R&D priorities in order to apply novel solutions to scientific problems Travel – willingness to travel domestically & internationally Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more?
