jobTitle: Senior Director Clinical Scientist – Haematology Early Oncology R&D
jobDescription: AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. We are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. AstraZeneca has a multifaceted environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build talent. Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of six scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programs The Global Development Scientist Director is an important part of the Clinical Project Team (CPT), and Global Study Team (GST) working harmoniously and cross functionally (in a matrix environment) with other CPT & GST members, Site Management & Monitoring (SMM), field-based liaisons, and site personnel. The Senior Global Development Scientist Director and counterpart Global Development Medical Director work collaboratively in the clinical aspects underpinning a product. This includes shared responsibility with Clinical Operations team members in the planning and execution, including recruitment and delivery of a clinical study. Accountabilities include clinical support for the development and implementation of early phase AstraZeneca sponsored clinical program strategies. As such, you will provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA). The Global Development Scientist Director may also provide expert input or lead functional process improvement initiatives and provide contributions to cross-asset or cross-indication area working groups depending on the level of experience. This position demands strong collaborative communication skills, including the ability to engage with and influence a diverse range of stakeholders both within and external to AstraZeneca. The individual will operate according to the highest ethical standards in compliance with internal SOPs, local regulations, laws and adhere to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and regulatory requirements. Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team. Work cross functionally within CPT to ensure the clinical strategy is translated into the development of the study concept document, study protocol and related documents; Establish key relationships internally with clinical project teams, and externally with regulatory bodies and external service providers. Provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA). Accountable for the relevance and accuracy of clinical science underpinning of clinical study based on detailed scientific review and consultation, for the clinical and scientific leadership and integrity of protocols and/or components of clinical plans and for the delivery of final protocol and its governance approval. Lead the development of the protocol and related documents and the development and delivery of the clinical study report to meet GCP, ICH and all AstraZeneca quality standards. Lead cross functional projects to ensure the successful passage of drugs through all phases of the drug development process, or contribute to one or more elements of such a project as a technical expert. Review and interpret medical data and clinical trial data and come up with conclusions Responsible for timely responses to investigational study sites for local ICF changes, protocol & EC/IRB questions/requests. Support the development of clinical components of regulatory and EC/IRB submission documents for instances where marketing approval is warranted. Prepare and provide input to clinical study reports (CSRs) and clinical portions of Regulatory Documents (e.g., IB, DSUR, PSUR, regulatory responses) Contribute to development and delivery of face to face or virtual investigator and supervise training Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team Participate or lead as needed the review and assessment of new opportunities and ESRs. Mentor less experienced Global Development Scientist Directors Minimum Qualifications: BS required, PhD in a scientific field, PharmD or MD is strongly preferred Significant Industry or Academic experience in drug development required with significant experience in malignant Haematology clinical trials strongly preferred. Sufficient technical knowledge (haemato-oncology background preferred) to be able to interact with confidence with internal and external partner Possesses sound foundational knowledge of FDA and other major country regulations and detailed knowledge of Good Clinical Practice other regulations governing clinical research. Possesses general knowledge of 1) medical monitoring 2) Regulatory approval process in relevant countries; 3) pharmaceutical industry/R&D operations; 4) marketing and commercial fundamentals. jobTitle: Senior Director Clinical Scientist – Haematology Early Oncology R&D
jobDescription: AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. We are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. AstraZeneca has a multifaceted environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build talent. Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of six scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programs The Global Development Scientist Director is an important part of the Clinical Project Team (CPT), and Global Study Team (GST) working harmoniously and cross functionally (in a matrix environment) with other CPT & GST members, Site Management & Monitoring (SMM), field-based liaisons, and site personnel. The Senior Global Development Scientist Director and counterpart Global Development Medical Director work collaboratively in the clinical aspects underpinning a product. This includes shared responsibility with Clinical Operations team members in the planning and execution, including recruitment and delivery of a clinical study. Accountabilities include clinical support for the development and implementation of early phase AstraZeneca sponsored clinical program strategies. As such, you will provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA). The Global Development Scientist Director may also provide expert input or lead functional process improvement initiatives and provide contributions to cross-asset or cross-indication area working groups depending on the level of experience. This position demands strong collaborative communication skills, including the ability to engage with and influence a diverse range of stakeholders both within and external to AstraZeneca. The individual will operate according to the highest ethical standards in compliance with internal SOPs, local regulations, laws and adhere to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and regulatory requirements. Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team. Work cross functionally within CPT to ensure the clinical strategy is translated into the development of the study concept document, study protocol and related documents; Establish key relationships internally with clinical project teams, and externally with regulatory bodies and external service providers. Provide scientific input into design & implementation of clinical trial(s), their delivery, clinical data review and data cleaning, interpretation of results, reporting successfully on time, and activities required for worldwide registration of the product (i.e. clinical input to NDA/BLA). Accountable for the relevance and accuracy of clinical science underpinning of clinical study based on detailed scientific review and consultation, for the clinical and scientific leadership and integrity of protocols and/or components of clinical plans and for the delivery of final protocol and its governance approval. Lead the development of the protocol and related documents and the development and delivery of the clinical study report to meet GCP, ICH and all AstraZeneca quality standards. Lead cross functional projects to ensure the successful passage of drugs through all phases of the drug development process, or contribute to one or more elements of such a project as a technical expert. Review and interpret medical data and clinical trial data and come up with conclusions Responsible for timely responses to investigational study sites for local ICF changes, protocol & EC/IRB questions/requests. Support the development of clinical components of regulatory and EC/IRB submission documents for instances where marketing approval is warranted. Prepare and provide input to clinical study reports (CSRs) and clinical portions of Regulatory Documents (e.g., IB, DSUR, PSUR, regulatory responses) Contribute to development and delivery of face to face or virtual investigator and supervise training Depending upon experience level, the role will mentor the development of less experienced members of the clinical team Participate or lead as needed the review and assessment of new opportunities and ESRs. Mentor less experienced Global Development Scientist Directors Minimum Qualifications: BS required, PhD in a scientific field, PharmD or MD is strongly preferred Significant Industry or Academic experience in drug development required with significant experience in malignant Haematology clinical trials strongly preferred. Sufficient technical knowledge (haemato-oncology background preferred) to be able to interact with confidence with internal and external partner Possesses sound foundational knowledge of FDA and other major country regulations and detailed knowledge of Good Clinical Practice other regulations governing clinical research. Possesses general knowledge of 1) medical monitoring 2) Regulatory approval process in relevant countries; 3) pharmaceutical industry/R&D operations; 4) marketing and commercial fundamentals. Drug Development/Clinical Development Planning: Demonstrates a consistent track record to both independently complete, and lead peers in completion in components of sophisticated plans, related documents, appropriate methodologies, measures, analytical plans and evaluation tools. Ability to drive/contribute to protocol design, writing and implementation Competitive Benefits & Salary Working at AstraZeneca Here you’ll have the chance to create a substantial difference to patients’ lives! jobTitle: Senior Director - Clinical Value and Outcomes
jobDescription: AstraZeneca (AZ) is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of medicines to treat patients with conditions in therapeutic areas that include: Oncology, Rare Diseases, Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism, and Respiratory & Immunology. About The Role The Clinical Value and Outcomes team at AstraZeneca is focused on delivering patient access and driving practice change initiatives throughout the US healthcare system. We serve as the medical scientific lead for population-based healthcare decision makers to facilitate scientific exchange on disease state management and the value of AstraZeneca products. We are looking for talented, energetic, diverse, influential, growth mindset individuals that are passionate about impact and change for patients. The Senior Director – Clinical Value and Outcomes has primary responsibility for leading a team of Clinical Account Directors for either a specific geographic region or group of national and regional accounts. This role also is responsible to serve as an internal ambassador for the team, and as such is an integral member of Core Medical Teams and develops close working relationships with cross functional partners (Global and US Medical, Payer Evidence, Market Access Strategy and Medical Information). This team leader is responsible for development and execution of the AstraZeneca clinical strategy across the BBU AZ portfolio for Geographically based Health Care systems, including Integrated Delivery Networks, Accountable Care Organizations, Provider Networks, Acute Care centers etc. Strong candidates will have an appreciation for the broad US Healthcare system, a perspective on how to navigate the system and a passion to drive change broadly with accounts, the team and AstraZeneca overall. What You'll Do Provide team leadership and foster strong team performance Recruit, develop, and retain a high performing Clinical Value and Outcomes team and work with the other Senior Directors and Field Leaders to establish a strong, collaborative team culture Ensure team performance objectives are established and achieved according to medical strategic priorities Develop and maintain a high level of collaboration and integration with functions such as Market Access, Medical Affairs, Training, Medical Information, and other functions as necessary Foster our culture of lifelong learning, accountability, self-direction, and recognition aligned to AstraZeneca values Serves as a role model fostering personal accountability and ownership of individual and team success Fosters environment in which direct reports are engaged, can be innovative, and share ideas freely Drive the creation and execution of medical account plans that are aligned to medical objectives to drive patient access and practice change Oversees the development of account medical plans and field engagement to ensure activities are address key outcomes and addresses evidence gaps across US Healthcare Key Decision makers Ensures Clinical Account Directors effectively create medical account plans and foster relationships with key decision makers Direct the approved scientific, medical, and healthcare economic data utilization to health care coverage, formulary and reimbursement decision makers Builds and helps team members to develop strong, networked relationships with clinical decision makers throughout priority accounts Oversees direct report compliance with all guidelines and policies Serve as strategic partner within the assigned therapeutic areas and effectively collaborates with internal stakeholders to shape future strategy Collaborate with cross-functional partners on the development of educational tools and resources communicated to customers to improve relevant therapeutic area understanding and access to AZ marketed and pipeline products Demonstrates on-going scientific and business expertise relevant to the AZ portfolio For aligned Therapeutic areas, responsible for developing and communicating quarterly updates of team activity, outcomes and insights to appropriate field and HQ Based teams (i.e., US and Global Brand Marketing teams, Core Medical teams, HEOR/Payer Evidence teams, and Market Access Strategy team) to inform future opportunities for resource development, market access strategy, and medical strategy. Essential For The Role Advanced Clinical/Science (e.g., MD, PharmD, PhD) degree. Applicants with a Scientific Degree (e.g. BS Pharm, Master of Science, BSN, NP, PA, etc.) with extensive experience (e.g. clinical, market access, industry) may be considered > 10 years experience in the pharmaceutical industry in medical affairs or clinical development or commensurate experience > 10 years experience in the managed care and/or Integrated Delivery Network setting or commensurate experience Demonstrated proficiency in managing and maintaining knowledge in multiple therapeutic areas and strategic initiatives including health outcomes, quality initiatives, consensus standards, evidence-based guidelines and health care policy In-depth knowledge of the biopharmaceutical industry and US managed markets, including various access and reimbursement models (Managed Care, Medicare Part B, Part D and Medicaid, etc.) Demonstrated expertise in health outcomes, health care policy, health technology assessment, and pharmacoeconomic principles Excellent analytical, written, and verbal communication and experience presenting critical medical, health economic data and business information to internal stakeholders and external decision makers Strong strategic-thinking skills; demonstrated ability to network and identify opportunities for medical engagement, set scientific engagement goals, and create and influence value propositions for innovative medicines and services Strong personal integrity, interpersonal skills, teamwork abilities and customer focus. Demonstrated ability to organize, adapt, prioritize, and work effectively in a matrixed organization and in an evolving/changing health care environment. Ability to travel approximately 50-60% time Desirable Pharm D or MD with additional training (residency or fellowship) or Master’s Degree (e.g., MBA, MHA or MPH) Experience in managing/leading teams and resources Experience developing and executing Medical Strategy Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours.

We are seeking an inquisitive, critical thinker to join AstraZeneca's Oncology Research & Development (R&D) Strategy team as a Senior Director, Competitive Intelligence. Are you looking for a chance to join a fast-moving, exciting team and help drive our pipeline strategy? If so, learn more about this opportunity! AstraZeneca is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company and our innovative medicines are used by millions of patients worldwide. This is the place to make an impact. Here we ensure everyone can reach their full potential, perform at their best and make a valued contribution to the enterprise. Within Oncology R&D, we are empowered to be bold, take calculated risks and use our intelligence and courage to always follow the science. This approach has enabled us to successfully deliver 7 new Oncology medicines in as many years. It is the breadth and strength of our innovative pipeline that offers both security and stability. And with the goal to deliver 6 new molecular entities by 2025, it’s up to each of us to keep pushing our industry-leading Oncology pipeline forward and build the future. The Competitive Intelligence and Analysis team sits at the heart of developing commercial and clinical strategy and has an impact on decision-making at the highest levels. In this role, join us as part of a high-achieving Strategy Team, bearing responsibility for ensuring the decisions we make with our pipeline assets best position us for return on investment and positive patient outcomes. As such, you will shape strategy and influence investment decisions by delivering analysis and insights to Senior Leadership and other key partners to ensure a full understanding of the constantly evolving oncology landscape. What You’ll Do Working with a team of specialists, you will own the delivery of competitive analysis, using knowledge of the therapy area and external resources to shape future-proofed therapy area (TA) strategies. You will drive in-depth analysis of clinical and commercial data, generating and communicating critical insights on key issues to provide transparency and respectful challenge to key decision makers. Given there is a range of partners, you will have an opportunity to influence strategy though your intellectual agility and communication skills, building a network of trusted relationships. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree At least 3 years of experience working with data, analysis and fact-based decision-making A critical, innovative thinker with a background in oncology, clinical / research or investment analysis Highly intellectual with excellent analytical skills and learning agility Experienced in leading cross-functional teams with ability to influence without authority A clear communicator with the ability to communicate complex issues simply Resourceful, motivated, decisive and proactive; able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-growing organization Preferred Qualifications Educated to PhD, MD or MBA level More than 4+ years of working experience with clinical data and analysis More than 2 years working in Oncology In-depth understanding of clinical data, clinical trial design or regulatory frameworks Why AstraZeneca: At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. jobTitle: Senior Director Corporate Affairs, Biopharmaceuticals Medical
jobDescription: Location: Gaithersburg, US or Cambridge, UK (Cambridge Preferred) Astra Zeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. As a high performing team, we are united and motivated by our shared purpose – to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. We come to work each day to make a difference – to patients, society, and our company. Summary: The Senior Director Corporate Affairs, Biopharmaceuticals Medical (BPM) is responsible for leading all communications activities on behalf of the BPM organisation within the Biopharmaceuticals Business Unit (BBU). AstraZeneca BPM has a rich heritage in delivering practice changing clinical evidence that has facilitated fundamental shifts in global guidelines for the treatments of chronic diseases, either through large-scale clinical trials or via real world data, as well as being a recognised industry leader in healthcare pathway redesign programmes, touching the lives of more than 10 million patients with chronic diseases every year. In order to extend its strategic leadership and external impact, both for Medical within AZ and for AstraZeneca as whole externally, BPM aims to significantly step up its communications capability and presence. To this end, the Director Communications for BPM will lead the development and implementation of a transformational global communications strategy, central to the whole Medical function’s ambition (Global and Medical in all of AZ’s marketing companies) to advance clinical practice and reduce the global burden of long-term conditions in the therapy areas where we focus, in line with the BBU’s Transforming Healthcare Delivery agenda and the AstraZeneca’s Growth Through Innovation strategy. The successful candidate will be a communications expert with a deep knowledge of how health systems work and how to engage HCP, patients and other stakeholders (policy makers, payers) with a view to advancing clinical practice and creating new opportunities for partnership. The role requires an ability translate BPM’s unique medical missions and practice-changing evidence into marketing communications and resources that showcase what we stand for as an organisation, creating a springboard for expansive partnerships, healthcare policy reform and practice change, at scale. The Senior Director Corporate Affairs report to the VP BioPharma Global Corporate Affairs and will be a member of both the BPM and BioPharma Corporate Affairs Leadership Teams, collaborating closely with colleagues across Medical, Global Corporate Affairs and other functions to ensure a coordinated and compliant approach to the strategy and its execution. Key responsibilities: Lead the design and execution of a global corporate affairs strategy for the BPM organisation. The strategy will include global external communications – positioning, materials and engagement strategies - to support partnerships with healthcare systems and healthcare professionals. In addition, the role is also required to drive internal communications and engagement on BPM’s ambitious agenda, both across the enterprise and within BPM itself. Includes co-creation and ongoing maintenance of plans/resources based on insights from global and marketing company (MC) teams that position AstraZeneca BioPharma as a partner of choice. The narrative articulates flagship AstraZeneca programmes and healthcare transformation capabilities. Multi-media materials include resources that effectively advance the BPM organisation’s role as partner of choice in collaborating with healthcare systems on initiatives/opportunities to improve care. Builds and implements a marketing/communications plan for BPM’s ‘Evidence Powerhouse’ pipeline – raising expectations and level of awareness regarding new clinical data and maximising the impact of high impact publications and oral presentations at major congresses. Sets and drives achievement of MC-level targets on use of communications strategies/resources in securing/advancing healthcare system partnership and tracking of success. Establishes any needed steering committees and relevant network of global/MC-contacts to oversee programme implementation. Develops and implements strategies for the flagship programmes that deliver BPM’s agenda as part of AstraZeneca’s broader BioPharma and strategic initiatives to transform healthcare. Ensures alignment of activities with BioPharma R&D GCA team to maximise impact and pull through to key medical and science audiences. Aligns with therapy area GCA teams to maximise synergies with flagship market shaping programmes. Drive external engagement for the BPM organisation through use of external events and communications through appropriate channels. Includes developing digital strategies/plans using AstraZeneca’s global corporate digital channels and paid-for/organic digital campaigns/content to meet agreed strategic goals. Also includes identifying and maximising external events including medical congresses. Secures MC participation/utilisation of global initiatives to achieve mutually agreed objectives. Initiate, cultivate and maintain external relationships with high-level influencers to protect, nurture and build the reputation of the busines; could include external experts, NGOs, advocacy groups, scientific societies, partners, peer company, health authority or government contacts. Provide input to the Global Medical strategy through external stakeholder insights (patient groups, government activity, trade associations, NGOs, policy developments) and strong networking with the Global Corporate Affairs organisation. Deliver/execute the internal communications plan to inform, engage, and motivate employees as the Global Medical organisation organises to achieve its transformative agenda. Applies understanding of change management communications and engagement strategies in delivering impactful internal initiatives and leadership communications. Establishes framework for and oversees key internal communications channels, enabling the organisation to effectively engage day to day. Lead and manage communications for the SVP of BPM, overseeing the development of presentations and talking points for external and internal engagements. Maintains strong network/contacts with agencies and contractors to support varying resource needs. Supports and oversees internal secondments/placements and contractors to support incremental flexible resource requirements within BioPharma Corporate Comms. Oversees quality and compliance of work. Develop and deliver approaches across the franchise for evaluating success of corporate affairs activities including KPIs, metrics, sentiment analysis, reputational research, return-on-investment evaluations, externally validated outcomes. Demonstrate enterprise leadership and role model value-aligned behaviour. Capabilities And Experience Experience in working with or for healthcare systems or healthcare system policy makers or funders/payers. Strong global pharmaceutical corporate and therapy area/product communications capability including technical skills across written/digital/multi-media communications. Proven ability to develop and deliver successful outcomes via multi-year, cross-functional programmes spanning multiple disciplines (eg communications, medical affairs, commercial). Proven ability to serve as an engaged, credible member of a high-performing leadership team, with a successful record of providing effective advice and thought partnership to senior leaders. Strong ability to translate new or evolving strategies into effective communications including via PowerPoint and digital strategies.. Expertise in building a shared vision, inspiring commitment and mobilising organisations around communications priorities/programmes. Able to lead initiatives in matrixed organisations with deployed (not dire

jobTitle: Senior Director/Director, Global Regulatory Affairs Early Respiratory & Immunology
jobDescription: Do you have strategic leadership skills and an in depth knowledge within Regulatory Affairs? Do you want to work on innovative projects of high importance for our early Respiratory and Immunology portfolio? At AstraZeneca, we aspire to be pioneers in science, leading in our disease areas and truly transform patient outcomes. By 2030 our bold ambition is to deliver 20 new medicines, industry leading growth and be carbon negative. This means our people are here to win and we will give you a breadth of opportunities to learn, to be curious and do cutting edge, unique work that has significant impact on science, medicines and patients. The Global Regulatory Affairs Therapeutic area team that you will belong to is a strategic function within the Respiratory & Immunology Development organisation.The Regulatory Affairs team leads the development and execution of regulatory strategies for global programmes across the entire lifecycle by proactively leveraging and applying the broad regulatory and scientific expertise, leadership skill and business acumen to identify and champion innovative and impactful regulatory pathways and drug development strategies to benefit patients. The role We now have a great opportunity for you to join our team within Respiratory and Immunology (R&I) in the roles as Senior Global Regulatory Affairs Director or Global Regulatory Affairs Director. These roles can be based at AstraZeneca’s dynamic R&D sites in Gaithersburg and Durham (US); Gothenburg (Sweden); Macclesfield (UK) or Barcelona (Spain). What You’ll Do The Global Regulatory Affairs Directors are accountable for leading the development and implementation of the global regulatory strategy for a project or a group of products of increasing complexity within the R&I portfolio. You will ensure that the strategy is designed to deliver rapid approval with advantageous labelling in keeping with the properties of the products and the needs identified by the business, markets and patients. These roles will have a focus on the Early Development (up to phase 2b), innovation, novel modalities and new transformative endpoints. As a Global Regulatory Affairs Director, you will have the ability to take on the Global Regulatory Lead (GRL) role for one or more products and to function in dual capacity by delivering the overarching global regulatory strategy as well as serve as a regional regulatory lead. Your main accountabilities/responsibilities: Work on cross-project initiatives of high importance for the early R&I portfolio Lead the development and implementation of innovative global strategies of increasing complexity to maximize the likelihood of regulatory success Accountable for the delivery of all regulatory milestones including assessment of the probability of regulatory success together with risk analysis and mitigation measures Serve as the single point of contact and GRL/Regional Lead on early Global Project Teams (eGPTs) Lead the Global Regulatory Sub-team (GRST) or as a Regional Lead with key contributing members from regional perspectives, international markets, Regulatory CMC as well as regulatory delivery & enablement Lead key cross-department or cross-functional projects on behalf of Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) when necessary Provide regulatory leadership as needed in product in-license/due diligence review, product divestment and product withdrawal Participate in skill-development, coaching, and performance feedback of other regulatory staff Capability and credibility in complex, business critical projects and ability to cope with ambiguity and manage senior key stakeholders. Do you have the essential qualifications for these roles? To be a successful in these roles, we believe that you have an advanced degree in a science related field and/or other appropriate knowledge/experience. More than 7 years’ experience or equivalent of regulatory drug development including working on early development projects is needed, and we believe that you have a broad background of experience working in pharmaceutical business and prior experience in several areas within regulatory affairs, e.g. Global, European, International, Marketing Company or experience at a health authority. We believe you are curious and eager to learn about novel modalities and what it would take to develop these into successful products from a regulatory perspective. To do this you have strategic leadership skills, a deep understanding of global regulatory science and overall drug/biologic development processes. Excellent oral and written communication skills are needed in these roles. Desirable Requirements: Experience and knowledge within the Respiratory or Immunology disease areas is an advantage, but not a formal requirement. Also, previous experience of working with strategies for novel development programs is preferred as well as previous experience in leading Major Health Authority interactions (e.g. FDA advisory committee meetings, Oral explanations, Scientific Advice, Pre-NDA/BLA, EOP2 meetings etc.). So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining us? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! If you have any questions regarding the role, please reach out Talent Acquisition Partner maria.elmberg1@astrazeneca.com We will review the applications continuously so please apply as soon as possible. Where can I find out more? AZ Gothenburg AZ Gaithersburg Respiratory & Immunology

jobTitle: Senior Director Marketing, US Brand Strategy - Hematology
jobDescription: At AstraZeneca, we play an instrumental role in driving launch and commercial effectiveness. We set the direction and lead the business – shaping the cancer care environment and empowering care teams to transform the patient experience. We turn our pipeline into reality for more patients, bringing novel and transformative medicine to market. Our pipeline is one of the deepest and broadest in the industry, with cutting-edge science and life-changing medicines to work on today and in the future. We share a collective sense of urgency - to defeat cancer and improve the lives of cancer patients. In addition to being one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies, AstraZeneca is proud to provide a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and cross-boundary collaboration. Within this environment, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives and are made to feel valued, energized, and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. North American Commercial is the 'face' of AstraZeneca to our many healthcare clients. They represent many of the most well recognized and respected products in the industry and build strong relationships with healthcare professionals. As Senior Director Marketing, US Brand Strategy - Hematology, you'll play a pivotal role in driving the ongoing success of the Hematology Franchise by ensuring hematology patients receive optimal therapy. We have the potential to help patients, not only in the near term with CLL and rrMCL, but across a large number of hematologic malignancies as our pipeline continues to mature. Main Duties/Responsibilities: The Sr Director, Brand Marketing will be responsible for building and leading an integrated strategy and implementation of marketing plans in hematology. This position will be integral to the global commercial strategy as well as implementing the US plan for continued commercial success. This position will report directly to the US Franchise Head and will work in close partnership with other members of the cross-functional team. This position is based on site at our Gaithersburg, MD campus, headquarters for the US Oncology and the Oncology Business Unit. The Gaithersburg site offers various amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, a full-service cafeteria, state-of-the-art on-campus Daycare facility, and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based workspaces to suit a variety of working styles while strengthening collaboration between teams. Essential Job Functions: Define and lead development of the hematology cancer strategy incorporating multiple indications. Partner with Global Marketing colleagues to assess gaps and strategic needs to ensure market leadership. Partner with Business Insights and Market Research Team to define success metrics and analyze performance on an ongoing basis. Manage P&L for hematology; assess investment priorities and synergies to maximize operating efficiencies across heme in collaboration with cross-functional partners Assess value of marketing programs based on anticipated ROI/value/impact and formulate recommendations for future plans based on learnings. Lead the vision for new asset and new indication preparation, develop the plan for market entry and ensure strategically aligned initiatives to drive the brand imperatives Overall lead the marketing team's efforts to develop and communicate field promotional strategy and assets and monitor field performance against KPIs. Responsible for managing multiple program budgets, timelines, processes, and procedures. Manage partner agency relationships, workflow, and related expense budgets. Lead and develop hematology marketing team to their full potential, to ensure talent growth and expertise Collaborate with other functional areas and lead the review process to ensure legal/regulatory compliance and medical accuracy of all marketing materials Minimum Qualifications: Minimum of Bachelor's Degree in relevant field 8+ years’ experience in US Pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry with experience in one or more of the following: market access, brand marketing, sales, pricing or market research/analytics, strategic planning Great oral and written communication skills, with ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex constructs Ability to manage multifaceted projects and collaborate in a highly matrix environment US Pharmaceutical product launch experience Demonstrated ability to lead a cross-functional team Preferred Qualifications: Prior in-line HCP marketing experience highly preferred Oncology experience required, specific tumor-type experience highly preferred Experience across multiple promotional channels (Personal, Non-Personal and Digital, Patient marketing) preferred MBA or another Advanced degree Experience in US marketing within Oncology Customer-facing Oncology Experience Current relevant experience in Hematology commercialization Previous experience leading an Oncology Marketing Team

location: Washington, Distrito de Columbia, Estados Unidos

jobTitle: Senior Director, of Portfolio Digital Health Strategy, Oncology
jobDescription: In 2016, we started our transformation journey in our research & development organisation, launching a new operating model to optimise our drug development activities, which is already achieving significant benefits, including simpler, streamlined ways of working and productivity improvements. Now we are further accelerating our transformation efforts to ensure we demonstrate the best in new technology and groundbreaking capabilities to keep us at the forefront of future drug development. Digital Health R&D is reimagining how we work to position AstraZeneca as an industry leader, making the development & delivery of new medicines easier. We’re doing this by harnessing the latest innovations enabled by digital, data & analytics and working with our people to craft and build the technology and working practices. AstraZeneca’s Research & Development digital organisation develops digital solutions to support our development and commercial drug portfolios. These digital solutions encompass connected drug delivery devices, monitoring devices and sensors coupled with medical device software to: Improve clinical development, through optimising data collection and improving communications between AZ, HCP and patients Provide enriched data sets to support regulatory submissions, and differentiated labelling Optimise real world medication use by patients and deliver digital interventions to improve clinical outcomes As part of the program the team will provide digital solutions across all AZ clinical trials and develop and implement AZ’s Digital Health strategy. This role will lead the newly formed Portfolio Management team which will be a central Digital Health Oncology point of contact for Global Product Teams (GPTs), responsible for attending GPTs and DRCs and representing the whole of Digital Health and its solutions. This team will drive coordination with other DH teams (e.g. Recruitment, Merlin) supporting programs and studies. In close collaboration with partners across Digital Health and within the Oncology Leadership teams, you will develop digital strategies to support development of new products and ensure execution of the strategy in collaboration with the Implementation team members. You will be a key member of the Digital Health Oncology Leadership team, ensuring digital strategies are aligned across therapy areas to define and execute enterprise level investments. In this new role you will: Work closely with key partners across the enterprise including Oncology Digital Health (COA, Science, Data Science and Implementation), IT, Oncology R&D and expert functions to build program and study level Digital Health strategies. Optimising strategies for study design/patient recruitment/data collection/analysis. Develop the Oncology Digital Strategy and provide feedback on specific technology needs to the digital capability leads driving the digital clinical platform Develop an operating model enabling each GPT to have a Digital Health representative that covers all of DH Drive the development of an industry leading R&D Digital organisation The newly formed Portfolio Management team will be responsible for attending GPTs and DRCs and representing the whole of Digital Health and its solutions. The creation of this team should provide a central point of contact for GPTs to interact with and discuss their needs. To provide key collaborators (GPT/DRC) with a single point of contact for Digital Health. This team will drive coordination with other DH teams (e.g. Recruitment, Merlin) supporting programs and studies. Ensure effective and visible risk, opportunity and issues management at strategic, tactical and operational levels Recruit, develop and lead a team, ensuring a constructive balance between challenge and mentorship. Use your networks to be able to understand and influence key aspects such as the global regulatory and competitive environments and apply learning to AZ programs, reporting performance vs the critical metrics set within the organisation Deliver governance approved business cases with in tolerance, on time, cost and quality working with functional management as required to resolve issues. Ensure your team develops their scientific and technical knowledge in order to bring ground-breaking digital opportunities to the group and to the R&D Oncology leadership team. Grow and maintain internal and external collaborations in the Oncology R&D unit and commercial organisation, key markets, external leaders and our patients to ensure prioritised needs are met in everything we do. Attend DRC as the Digital Health Oncology representative/reviewer Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor Honours Degree in scientific field, higher degree desirable At least 7 years of relevant experience in pharmaceutical industry with solid understanding of Drug Development Processes, and experience of developing oncology products. Ability to lead and influence strategically and persuade thoughtfully, to acquire desired outcomes while maintaining effective, positive, interpersonal relationships. Experience in Digital Health with solid understanding of Healthcare Ability to work collaboratively in a cross functional setting with internal as well as external partners Strong influencing and senior stakeholder management skills Ability to challenge the status quo, take ownership and holds self and others accountable Well-developed interpersonal skills, able to create transparency from ambiguity Line management experience, with evidence of staff development Shown delivery track record Transformational Leadership of functional and cross functional team Persuasive verbal and written communication skills Passion for Customers, representing the needs of multiple customers in decision making Desired Qualifications: Advance degree Strong Scientific and Medical understanding of the Oncology Therapy Area Device, software development and / or clinical project management Comprehensive understanding of dynamics affecting the pharmaceutical industry and needs for transformation Ability to work globally including international travel Well-developed Project management skills, including handling vendors, budgets, timelines and risks Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life-changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big, and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. AstraZeneca’s vision in Oncology is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm, with the aim of bringing six new cancer medicines to patients between 2013 and 2020. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung, and hematological cancers. As well as other tumor types, these are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates,, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies. Role Description The Senior Director Omnichannel Strategy & Operations will be responsible for leading a team that will drive the vision, roadmap, planning, orchestration, execution, and measurement of personalized cross-channel HCP journeys via a consistent scalable approach for the US Oncology Business Unit. Accountable for Omnichannel strategy & Operations the Sr Director will shape a seamless customer experience that leverages personalized real-time insights that coordinate a journey across personal and non-personal channels. Focusing on Customer, Content, and Channel (with data and technology as enablers); areas of focus will include key Omnichannel functions including Omnichannel Strategy, Channel Excellence & Media, Omni Customer Segmentation, Marketing Journey, Personalized Content selection, Action Sequencing, Next Best Channel/Action and CRM (capability & integration). The Sr Director and their team will also key enabling functions that include: Data Strategy, Advanced Analytics, AI teams, and Field operations for both measurement and additional insight (and actions). The Sr Director will also work closely with brand teams, global teams, franchise heads, compliance, procurement, and other leaders across the organization. The Sr Director (and team) will also primarily work with Media agencies while partnering with brands/indications in shaping their Omnichannel strategy & tactics. Our ambition is to inculcate Omnichannel engagement into our daily business as a standard way of working that values optimal engagement approaches (across key channels including effective integration with in-person channel) with our customers across their (customers) preferred channels. This position will report to the Head of the Business Excellence Team and is based at our Gaithersburg, MD campus, headquarters for our US Oncology and other Specialty Care businesses. The Senior Director will lead a team of 11 with additional support from Vendors and cross-functional partners. Key Accountabilities Omnichannel Marketing Lead the implementation of the US OBU omnichannel marketing strategy as related to people, creation/refinement of omnichannel processes and technology (leveraging of platforms needed for seamless customer experiences) Partner with AZ Brand & Functional Teams to understand brand/functional strategy, opportunities and challenges in order to effectively design omnichannel strategies that will maximize impact. Deliver Media & Channel Excellence partnering with Brands, AOR(s) and finance to shape efficiency, effectiveness and velocity relating to the investment impact of our brands. Work with SME and agency partners to review and evaluate our strategic digital marketing solutions Implement and deliver a strategic US Oncology Omnichannel Roadmap shaping and influencing the vision and inculcation of omnichannel capabilities across brands/functions within the business unit. Shape and socialize omnichannel OKR, effectiveness measures and performance. Effectively embed the needed omnichannel resources (OMLs) within US OBU brands/tumor teams for full omnichannel engagement with customers Develop a holistic CRM strategy (beyond the CRM ‘tool’) that supports customer-centricity, localization/personalization and increased internal cross-channel coordination for optimized HCP engagement Drive innovation via exploring new tools and technologies to differentiate, deliver, measure & support our omnichannel marketing efforts shaping an effective customer experience. Work with SME, Commercial IT and agency partners to review and evaluate innovative digital solutions Partner with Data Management, Advanced Analytics and Data Science teams to move forward in truly leveraging data, analytics and AI thus enhancing precision engagement Deliver Omnichannel Analytics and performance measures for Omnichannel campaigns. Will partner with the Oncology Data team for data management and structures needed to deliver Omnichannel OKR attainment. Will also partner with Insights & Analytics for ROI and other advanced analytics. Shape Omnichannel training materials in order to successfully accelerate the uptake of omnichannel vision, context and capabilities of marketing team members (including new hires/transfers etc) Responsible for the CRM strategy, roadmap and delivery as we implement innovative and differentiated CRM capabilities that blend across internal/external and personal/non-personal promotion (supporting the ambitions listed above). Qualifications Minimum of bachelor’s degree in relevant field 10+ years of experience in pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry with experience in one or more of the following: digital marketing, consumer marketing, brand/product marketing, strategic planning, business planning, sales or sales operations 5+ years of experience leading a capability or function in the areas above Oncology or specialty care experience preferred Skills Highly accountable with the ability to lead and motivate a team Self-motivated with experience shaping a vision, strategy and operational plans Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) balancing executive, marketing and technical acumen Thorough experience simplifying the complex in order to gain organizational/leadership buy-in while also having the ability to be hands-on and lead from the front (per topic/task) Proven track record of managing complex cross-functional, matrixed teams Strong organization skills and the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects Proven experience in execution – ability to bring strategy and analysis to a tactical level and get projects started and drive to completion Demonstrated ability to lead and influence with and without authority Comfort operating in a highly regulated environment and industry High ethical standards and personal integrity Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? jobTitle: Senior Director, Oncology Commercial Data Science & AI
jobDescription: Make a greater impact on lives through a digitally-enabled enterprise We are working towards our aspiration of shaping the future of Pharma. Backed by investment at every step, we harness the latest technology, data and innovative ways of working to introduce new approaches that put Digital at AstraZeneca’s heart. Be part of a chapter that’s still being written. Trusted and empowered to change the way things are done, with the tools and support to get you there. Here we are free to unleash our curiosity and turn thinking into reality. Where smart risks and quick decisions come together to power disruption and innovation. Role and Responsibilities: Senior Director, OBU Commercial Data Science & AI is a key leader in the Commercial Data Science & AI team whose mission is to take a patient-centric, data-driven approach to personalize and transform healthcare delivery to the millions of patients along with a multi-disciplinary team of physicians who care for them. This responsibility involves working closely with cross-functional Science, Medical, and Business leaders to identify, prioritize, and develop DS & AI Products and solutions across AZ Bio Oncology Commercial Business Unit (OBU) The scope of this role is Global, serving all the markets where AstraZeneca’s life-changing medicines are approved to help patients live longer and realize AZ’s bold ambition of eliminating Cancer as a cause of death. Typical Accountabilities Work with the US OBU Commercial Franchise heads & other business heads to prioritize Business use cases/questions for the Global DS&AI team Hire Product managers, Analytics translators for each of the priority tumor areas to be product owners and lead DS&AI product development Identifying & procuring, and governing key data sets needed for Analytics and DS&AI solutions Recruiting and mentoring Analytics/ Business translators & Data Science team Scouting, Identifying cutting-edge innovation in Data Science, AI and ML (Start-ups and Industry/Academic experts). Working with Start-ups and partners to integrate “Best in Class” technology for a given use case & Leading the development of new capabilities to add to AZ’s Commercial Data Science & AI platform Deep understanding of AZ’s priority disease areas, treatment guidelines across all Cancer types Deep understanding of real-world data sets like Claims, EMR, etc. Deep understanding of AZ internal sales, marketing data & scientific content Own and lead Data Science & AI products per Cancer tumor type. Product features include Data enrichments & Development of ML Models & Classifiers for deeper understanding of the patient journey Development of Predictive ML models around patient disease progression, Adverse events, and other outcomes Own and lead development of ML models using unstructured notes, Scientific, Clinical documents, and Research publications Own and lead development of Personalized ML models around the dissemination of Scientific, Medical content and messages across personal and non-personal channels These products include the application of specialized approaches in classification, regression, clustering, NLP, image analysis, deep learning, knowledge graphs, and/or other advanced techniques. Here we are free to unleash our curiosity and turn thinking into reality. Where smart risks and quick decisions come together to power disruption and innovation. jobTitle: Senior Director, Oncology Innovation Data Science Strategy
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for furthering research and treatment possibilities in Oncology in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we lead our industry in our development of a strong and varied pipeline. This means our people are here to win. We give you a breadth of opportunities to be curious and do groundbreaking, unique work that has big impact on science and medicine. We are seeking an experienced data science strategy leader who is passionate about innovation in Oncology to join AstraZeneca’s Oncology R&D Strategy group. AstraZeneca has grown to be a leader in Oncology by building a world-class Oncology R&D unit with strong foundations across multiple scientific platforms and clinical domains. We aim to expand our leadership by leveraging external innovation and building strong scientific networks across emerging technologies that will impact Oncology. The Senior Director, Oncology Innovation Data Science Strategy will be instrumental in mapping and managing a strategic path for AZ to understand the world of oncology innovation through the latest data science techniques and approaches. We strive to create a dynamic, digital representation of the landscape of oncology innovation, including information about drug discovery, diagnostic technologies, digital tools, algorithmic products, and beyond. Your role will be to work with cross-functional partners to create a data solution that reveals and monitors this innovation landscape, while also generating hypotheses and insights for how AZ can engage strategically with the external community of oncology innovators. You will work closely with a team of data scientists and data engineers within AZ’s broader Oncology Data Science organization to deliver a product encompassing a fit-for-purpose platform, suite of algorithms, and data assets. Beyond the delivery of this product, you will play a key leadership role alongside other Oncology Strategy Team members to identify business needs that can be solved through data science and deliver insights on the evolving innovation strategy. What Will You Work On Creating and managing a sustainable data science product that maps and dynamically analyzes the landscape of Oncology innovation in order to generate useful insights for R&D Partner with oncology strategy leads to identify key business problems, communicate insights generated from data analysis, and develop tangible action plans Develop effective relationships with business and clinical units to ensure utilization and value of the information resources developed by the data science team in multiple projects. Work closely with data scientists and engineers to develop all aspects of the sustainable data science product, including data assets/pipelines, AI/ML algorithms, platform, maintenance, etc. Communicate effectively and with demonstrable expertise across a range of data science techniques and approaches such as classification, regression, clustering, NLP, image analysis, knowledge graphs and new technologies. Identification of data sources to solve the business problems and generate internal data assets where applicable Oversee the research, development, and validation predictive models and computational methods to guide and influence relevant decision-making outcomes Collaborates across the AstraZeneca Data and AI community to develop best practices and cross functional opportunities that drive value Oversight of partnerships with multiple third parties, academic or outsourced partners to shape and drive project outcomes and knowledge building across the organization Share knowledge with others on the team; continue to adapt or develop new methods and learn new software packages as available in the literature and recent publications. Education and experience: Advanced degree with at least 5 years of experience in an analytical role, OR Bachelor’s degree and 7-12 years related experience. Additional Qualifications: Advanced quantitative degree (Computational biology, Informatics, Business analytics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field) preferred. Strong data science or advanced analytics reputation with ability to manage complex problems requiring advanced quantitative solutions A strong background of building successful internal/external partnership and collaborative relationships, demonstrating cultural sensitivity and awareness. Demonstrated ability to lead and influence experienced professionals. Ability to think critically, creatively and to anticipate and solve problems. Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, highly-matrixed work environment. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees stay happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

jobTitle: Senior Director, Oncology Nurse Education & Marketing
jobDescription: Come and join our journey at AstraZeneca to become the leader in Oncology. Our pipeline is one of the deepest and broadest in the industry, with countless new indications and targets. It’s an exciting opportunity to get our medicines to market, work with cutting-edge science, and be involved in the next big thing. The Oncology therapy area at AstraZeneca is unparalleled. We have created and strategically acquired one of the most promising oncology pipelines in the industry. You will be among inspiring oncology industry leaders who will keep you engaged and empower you to be the best. We seek out opportunities to do varied meaningful work which means we won't just follow the same course of action time and again if we can see potential in a different way of creating life-changing medicine. Role Description The Senior Director, Nurse Education (NE) & Marketing will be responsible for developing our Nurse Education Marketing strategy and leading its execution across all of our US Oncology therapeutic areas. The Director, Nurse Education & Marketing collaborate appropriately with cross-functional leadership and leads the NE marketing team and nurse educator field teams to educate HCPs to support the treatment of patients and the safe and effective use of AZ products with clinically relevant, evidence-based, fit for purpose nursing practice and clinical education. : Key Accountabilities Direct the creation and execution of the US nurse education strategy and tactics to support HCP/nurse education and management before, during, and after therapy Define strategy to meet program objectives. Cross-functionally establish success metrics and ensure team clarity and accountability in meeting and/or exceeding stated objectives/metrics Lead a team of marketers for Oncology Nurse Education across disease areas and franchises. Serve as a role model for living AZ values who diligently and consistently upholds our ethical standards and compliance expectations. Represent the Oncology Nurse Educator team to Franchise Leadership Team and champion opportunities for Oncology Nurse Educators to contribute towards PM&NE vision in achieving AstraZeneca Leadership Support engagement with nursing medicine professional societies to understand the broader Oncology landscape; assess, identify and act on opportunities and challenges through partnerships Strategically implement unbranded speaker programs and KOL round tables at the national level as necessary to achieve objectives Manage and lead team to coordinate activities and marketing educational efforts during product launches and measure impact through appropriate non-sales qualitative and quantitative measures of performance Coach and develop team ( marketing, and field directors) to maximize their contribution and growth potential Manage budget and promote effective utilization of resources Requires approximately 40% domestic and international travel Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree Required (BSN, BS, BA, Life Science) 7+ years pharmaceutical industry experience leading teams working in diverse disease areas Experience developing and coaching team to establish their own unique identity, skill-set, and expertise Strong clinical acumen Experience leading the development of Annual Marketing Plan, Launch Plan, Cross Brand initiatives Experience negotiating and establishing clear ways of working with Brand and Cross-functional teams Experience leading leadership reviews, critical thinking, and delivering unique insights/perspectives Strategic thinker, leader, trusted manager, team player, and a good communicator Preferred Background: Masters’ degree or higher in Nursing, Business, Life Sciences, Medical, or Pharmacy (RN, MSN, NP, MBA, Ph. D., MD, or PharmD) Ability to lead and influence through change; make decisions in ambiguity Ability to engage, motivate and lead cross-functional teams; strong teamwork and collaboration skills Launch experience of Oncology diagnostics, anatomical or molecular diagnostic products, and/or therapeutic marketing Strong leadership attributes to set direction, generate commitment, balance short and long-term needs, constructively resolve issues Proven demonstration of effective cross-functional project team leadership Relevant experience with broader US oncology market landscape and stakeholders (healthcare ecosystem, patient advocacy groups, professional societies, payers, etc.) Next Steps – Apply today! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. jobTitle: Senior Director or Patient Recruitment - TA Focus
jobDescription: About Astrazeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. Business area The Digital Health R&D Recruitment team enables better patient and healthcare professional experiences by delivering customer centric digital solutions for clinical trials and real-world healthcare. The focus of this role is to work with Therapy Area (TA) leaders in the oncology, cardiovascular, respiratory and vaccine areas to understand patient recruitment needs and develop appropriate solutions. The holder of this role will manage a team of Implementation Leads to configure Innovative Recruitment solutions and services for specific study needs. They will also partner closely with AZ clinical development, operational and IT functions to ensure broader business needs and constraints are met. The role holder will also work as a member of the R&D Digital Patient Recruitment Leadership team to ensure digital strategies are aligned across therapy areas and define enterprise level investments and external partnerships. What you will do : Work closely with Therapy Area and Development Operations Leaders to develop a Digital Recruitment Strategy. This will include channels such as patient engagement, data platforms and patient facing apps. The strategy will incorporate the broad needs of the therapy area, more specific needs of individual Global Product Teams and detailed needs of individual studies. Deliver the operational implementation plan for the TA Digital Recruitment Strategy, working closely with Digital Health Implementation leads to configure specific platform needs. Develop leading and lagging performance measures to assess and communicate clearly and accurately progress against plan. Be an active member of the R&D Digital Health Recruitment leadership team developing an industry leading R&D Digital organization Ensure effective and transparent risk, opportunity and issues management at strategic, tactical and operational levels Develop and lead a team, ensuring a constructive balance between challenge and mentorship. Ensure individual development of scientific and technical knowledge to bring innovative recruitment technologies to the Therapy Area. Deliver governance approved business cases within tolerance, on time, cost and quality working with functional management as required to resolve issues. Grow and maintain internal and external relationships, connecting the needs of key customers including TA, patients, health care providers and technology partners Essential Requirements : Bachelor degree in a scientific or technology based subject area Relevant experience in the pharmaceutical industry A solid understanding of the drug development processes and the impact technology can have on these processes Experience in Digital Health with an understanding of healthcare Ability to lead and influence strategically and persuade thoughtfully, to obtain desired outcomes while maintaining effective, positive, organizational relationships Ability to challenge the status quo, take ownership and holds self and others accountable Experience leading a development team and working in a global environment Passion for Patients and Customers, representing the needs of multiple customers in decision making Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Competitive Salary and Benefits
