jobTitle: Senior Director, Patient Safety Scientist, V&I
jobDescription: JOB TITLE: SENIOR DIRECTOR, PS SCIENTIST, V&I Location: Onsite with Flexibility in Gaithersburg MD, Waltham MA, Gothenburg SW, Barcelona SP, Warsaw PO or Central Cambridge UK About Astrazeneca At AstraZeneca, our values-based culture contributes to a desirable working environment, a purposeful mission of putting patients first who benefit from following the science, doing the right thing and a confident entrepreneurial spirit. We are looking for people who have expertise and passion for PS. Would you like to apply your expertise to provide scientific and clinical strategic leadership in a company that espouses these values and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! Job Capsule Description The SD PS Scientist V&I is a global role ensuring oversight of Safety Physician and SSaMT input to programs and delivery. This role provides the strategic medical/scientific leadership for assigned programs and the expertise to ensure quality results for PV. The SD PS V&I recruits and leads a global team of PV physicians and or scientists and leads strategic change projects across PS Therapeutic Areas. If this sounds exciting to you, read on and apply as we can't wait to hear from you! Typical Accountabilities Recruits and leads a team of safety scientists and staff; provides strategic leadership for assigned TA programs. Additionally, will lead strategic change initiatives across global PS Develops objectives for PS in TA area of responsibility, and ensures these are aligned to broader AstraZeneca goals and objectives. Development and retention of quality talent. Ensures that own work and work of team is aligned with Good Clinical and Pharmacovigilance Practice, Safety Health and Environment (SHE) standards and all other relevant internal and external regulatory standards. Ensure oversight of SSaMT input to programs and delivery of outputs. Maintains a high degree of understanding and awareness of scientific developments which could potentially impact PS and the broader AZ organization, and shares this with team members as appropriate. Closely follows medical developments within assigned areas and disseminates new information within PS to transform trends and emerging data into new plans. Serve as SME for PV regulations and leads PS TA in regulatory agency inspections. Sharing effective & efficient practices across Global PS teams (Therapeutic Areas, QPPV, Risk Management, Operations and International) Lead PS activities into PV Agreements and serves as Lead for Managing Alliance Partners for assigned products Provide expertise assuring best quality and results in: PV strategy, Safety Management, Vendor/Partner Management, and Periodic Reports including PBRERs, DSURs, etc. Partner with other parts of Global PS to implement changes in PV legislative landscape to prepare appropriate resources and abilities to address the future Lead or support complex and pioneering projects to improve processes within PS or develop and introduce new technologies and approaches at the national, regional or global level Ensure full implementation of all PS, TA and broader AZ enterprise global strategic change programs Builds networks within Global PS and external partners to learn about new developments, leverage opportunities and share efficient and effective practices (eg Benchmarking and Industry forums) Expected to Deputize for PS TA lead and actively participate in PS TA Leadership Team Essential EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Master’s degree or above or equivalent qualification in relevant scientific field Experience leading a scientific team Extensive proven experience in pharmaceutical or biotech industries within Pharmacovigilance field Knowledge of relevant legislation and developments within industry Experience in either writing risk management plans and assessing risk mitigation activities or in translating preclinical safety experience to FIM trials Experience in leading sophisticated strategic projects (Drug and non-drug) Demonstrated capability to influence key partners within and outside of company Proficient in English language in both written and verbal communications Proven skills at providing strategic contributions into strategic decision making Desirable Excellent reputation within the business and industry Extensive knowledge of the latest technical and regulatory expectations EMPLOYER OF CHOICE At AstraZeneca we are dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and ignite your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society because AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We offer an industry wide generous Total Reward program including a market driven base salary, bonus and long term incentive. We also provide a generous paid time off program and a benefits package to include medical, dental, vision care, 401K among other offerings. AstraZeneca aligns with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.

At AstraZeneca, we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s outstanding skills with those of people from all over the globe. Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility builds life-changing medicines for people around the world. The modern, vibrant scientific campus employs more than 3000 guides in our field, and it is only a short drive from Washington, DC. It is filled with groundbreaking technology. Our labs spaces were built to facilitate collaboration, interaction and cross functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and encouraged at work. We offer everything from bean bag rooms for creative brain storming, game rooms and Zen garden to treadmill stations and regular campus happy hours. The Gaithersburg site offer a variety of amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. Join AstraZeneca and help us deliver life-changing medicines! Be among our employees who continue to make us an innovation-driven company that stands firmly among the leaders in BioPharmaceuticals. What you’ll do: Lea a Quality function or high-level project and develops strategic and operational plans to ensure successful delivery. Defines innovative solutions within the most complex and ambiguous areas of the business. Leads other managers and provides strategic direction for the organization through a comprehensive understanding of global issues. Responsibilities: Leads Quality oversight of the Cell Therapy (CT) portfolio Establishes phase-appropriate CT Quality requirements based on current and evolving regulation to ensure patient safety and License to Operate with consideration of future commercial manufacturing Develop innovative strategies with a sense of urgency to enable potentially life-saving medicines to reach patients Contributes to the multidisciplinary team responsible to develop and manufacture novel CT products Develop and maintain the Quality System to enable manufacture and commercialization of the CT portfolio Participates in investigations, assessments, and evaluations of quality records such as deviations, CAPAs, and change controls, as necessary Manages, develops and leads a team of Quality professionals Supports the planning process to drive continuous improvements and changes of the Quality System to ensure on-going effectiveness, efficiency and sustainability Assess the implications of AZ strategies to develop recommendations that support CT Quality aspirations Monitors the evolving CT regulatory landscape to position AZ for success and ensure a sustainable CT quality management system that meets all regulatory requirements in the respective markets Leads and develops the thinking on new or emerging Quality opportunities in the external regulatory environment Partners with senior leaders across AZ to identify and remove blockers to ensure delivery of an integrated approach to CT Quality across the business Qualifications 15+ years applicable experience with B.S. degree in Science, Engineering, Pharmacy or related technical field 12+ years applicable with M.S. degree in Science, Engineering, Pharmacy or related technical field 5+ years direct autologous CT experience 5+ years management experience 3+ years CT Quality experience including clinical lot release Knowledgeable about the science and manufacturing of autologous and allogenic CT products Extensive working knowledge of international CT GxP regulatory frameworks, regulations and guidance Desirable: PhD in Science, Engineering, Pharmacy or related technical field Demonstrated track record in leadership of change management in a positive and non-disruptive manner to the company’s values Experience with CT IND and MA submissions Experience with CT regulatory inspections Experience engaging with global regulatory bodies Allogenic CT and gene editing experience Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being bold - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, groundbreaking innovative methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Next Steps – Apply today! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be an outstanding fit, please share this posting with them.

jobTitle: Senior Director, Scientific Communications and Engagement Lead – Oncology R&D
jobDescription: AstraZeneca, we are committed to advancing the science of oncology to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of our scientific platforms, we help address unmet clinical needs in a range of cancers. We are motivated by a dedication to scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. Position Summary This leadership role will work across Oncology R&D (ORD), to define the overall approach, roadmap, and implementation plans for scientific communications and engagement activities for the Functions. The selected lead will also manage the learning & development and resource allocation of the individuals deployed to support these efforts. The lead also be Joint Chair of the Comms Network working to ensure close collaboration with the ORD Global Corporate Affairs (GCA) team. Location flexible: Can be based in Gaithersburg, Waltham, New York City (US) or Cambridge or Macclesfield (UK) or Mississauga (CN) Typical Accountabilities: Define the overall approach, roadmap and plan for scientific communication and engagement for the Oncology R&D (ORD) Functions Lead the team in the identification, development and delivery of impactful science content and engagement activities relevant to the functions for internal audiences, and key presentations for leaders within the ORD teams in close collaboration with GCA colleagues Manage a team of 15+ individuals with a focus on learning and development, knowledge sharing, prioritization of activities and resource allocation of the team who will be embedded business partners to ORD Functions Establish measures of success and implement relevant evaluation tools for all communications and engagement activities Work with BPOs and ORD LT members to understand requirements and ensure that teams are getting the service and support they need within agreed Service Level Agreements Work with the ORD Global Corporate Affairs (GCA) team (with a dotted reporting line to GCA ORD Comms Lead) to ensure alignment between the teams Co-Chair the ORD Comms Network with Global Corporate Affairs Coordinate cross-functional change programmes in partnership with Global Corporate Affairs Support one of the ORD functions or groups. Basic Qualifications: BS/BA and 8+ years of relevant healthcare product communications experience. Prior experience in a strategic communications or engagement role Excellent written and verbal communication skills Previous line management experience of matrix teams Ability to clearly articulate complex scientific information into effective and compelling communication that is appropriate for the level of audience Strong influencing, networking and team working skills A proven track record of delivering tasks in a timely manner Experience in the development and implementation of timely and impactful internal communications/ awareness programs that contribute to employee engagement and brand awareness Desirable requirements: Resource planning and management for teams Establishing Service Level Agreements with stakeholders and performance vs agrees levels. Experience in the development of messaging frameworks and providing communications support and coaching to Leadership with regard to communicating TA scientific messages Communications Agency experience AstraZeneca is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company and our innovative medicines are used by millions of patients worldwide. This is the place to make an impact. Here we ensure everyone can reach their full potential, perform at their best and make a valued contribution to the enterprise. Within Oncology R&D, we are empowered to be bold, take calculated risks and use our intelligence and courage to always follow the science. This approach has enabled us to successfully deliver 7 new Oncology medicines in as many years. It is the breadth and strength of our innovative pipeline that offers both security and stability. And with the goal to deliver 6 new molecular entities by 2025, it’s up to each of us to keep pushing our industry-leading Oncology pipeline forward and build the future. Do you want to be part of fulfilling our ambition to be world leaders in Oncology? We are already the fastest growing team within AstraZeneca and across the industry, and there are countless new indications and targets in our groundbreaking pipeline. A place built on courage, curiosity and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take inquisitive risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline. So, what’s next? If you are inspired by the possibilities, don't hesitate in submitting an application today! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

jobTitle: Senior Director Search and Evaluation, Business Development Licensing & Strategy, Cardiovascular Renal and Metabolism
jobDescription: Do you have a scientific or late stage clinical development background combined with an entrepreneurial attitude and business know-how? Would you like to apply your strategic mindset in a global company that push the boundaries of science with potential to impact million patients’ lives around the globe? Join us to develop the ground-breaking medicines of the future for Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolic diseases! At AstraZeneca, we work without barriers between functions at the cutting-edge of science. We thrive in a place where the brightest and most curious minds seamlessly come together in our inclusive environment. That’s why we love it – this is the place to make a greater impact! As a Senior Director Search and Evaluation you will join the Search and Evaluation Department within Business Development Licensing & Strategy with focus on Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism (CVRM) diseases. This is a key role where you will work in an international setting to impact strategic development of the CVRM therapy area. The Search and Evaluation group is responsible for driving search efforts of external innovation throughout the CVRM community and conducting technical due diligence activities that ensure an in-depth understanding of investment opportunities and provide effective decision-making tools for the organization. The role reports to Global Head of Search and Evaluation (Head of S&E), Biopharmaceuticals R&D, CVRM and can be placed at our dynamic R&D sites in Gothenburg Sweden or Gaithersburg, US. The role will be at Director or Senior Director level depending on your previous experience. What You’ll Do The Senior Director Search and Evaluation is a key role where the role holder supports global business development initiatives and has a direct impact on the scientific strategy and portfolio within CVRM. You will have a major impact on strategic development of the CVRM therapy area, ensuring that the portfolio is delivered and that the science, capabilities and portfolio are fit for future challenges and opportunities. Responsibilities include: Identifying and evaluating external in-licensing opportunities from academia, biotech’s and peer-pharma including early research projects, new modality platforms for CVRM, early and late clinical stage candidates and Life Cycle Management opportunities Leading evaluation and supporting the Head of S&E in technical due diligence of external assets with a senior cross functional team and will provide clear recommendations for decision making. Integrating input from various functional areas across the organization to create high quality, clear and concise cross functional development plans and evaluation reports of external assets to the Head of S&E. Work closely with the Head of S&E and key Therapy Area stakeholders as well as cross-functional teams including commercial, deal finance and transactions to ensure effective communication, efficient decision-making for business cases and to help support completion of transactions with business development teams in a timely manner Representing the Business Development strategy at partnering meetings to identify and triage external assets and opportunities related to CVRM. Identifying and evaluation of key academic collaborations and technical platform capabilities that can enhance the scientific credibility and portfolio of CVRM. Track breakthrough innovation, ongoing clinical trials and market trends of existing external CVRM opportunities using competitive intelligence tools to identify opportunities, threats and risks in a timely manner. Contribute to create a dynamic, entrepreneurial and externally facing organization which enables an internally and externally collaborative culture with calculated risk taking. Essential For The Role The successful candidate has a strong scientific and/or clinical R&D background combined with business and strategic acumen and the ability to engage and collaborate across boundaries with an entrepreneurial attitude and delivery focus. With your excellent interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills you have the ability to operate effectively across boundaries in a fast-paced, global matrix research environment to influence both internal and external stakeholders. You role model engagement and commitment, are able to drive business performance and take responsibility for decisions made. It is essential to understand the wider AstraZeneca business priorities and appreciate that scientific expertise needs to be balanced with business leadership. 10 years MD or PhD or MBA experience. Strong scientific reputation in drug discovery and/or clinical development Basic understanding of deal making Proven leadership abilities in a R & D environment A strong understanding of late stage clinical development experience (preferentially in CVRM), demonstrating cultural sensitivity and awareness. Extensive experience in pharmaceutical R&D, demonstrating international experience in multiple cultures and R & D environments. Ability to think critically, creatively and to anticipate and solve problems So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining us? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! For more information, please contact Ratan Bhat at +46705628727 or Ratan.Bhat@astrazeneca.com. Welcome with your application no later than December 15th, 2022. Please apply as soon as possible since we are continuously screening candidates. Where can I find out more? CVRM at AstraZeneca: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our-therapy-areas/cardiovascular-renal-and-metabolism.html AstraZeneca in Gothenburg: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our-science/gothenburg.html Life in Gothenburg: https://www.astrazeneca.se/om-oss/verksamheten-i-sverige/goteborg/relocate-to-gothenburg.html Life at AstraZeneca : https://careers.astrazeneca.com/inclusion-diversity Why AstraZeneca? AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical company proud to provide a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and cross-boundary collaboration. Within this environment employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives, and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. There’s no better place to see what science can do.

jobTitle: Senior Director & Team Leader – Global Regulatory Affairs, Late R&I
jobDescription: Job Description Summary Provides strategic regulatory leadership to the development, commercialization and life cycle management of the assigned product(s) in product/franchise teams. Applies knowledge of current local and global Regulatory trends to identify future regulatory requirements and strategies. Influences Regulatory authorities through regular contacts to improve Regulatory outcomes. Responsible for skill development, performance management, resource allocation at the project or franchise level. Do you have expertise in, and a passion for Regulatory Affairs? Would you like to apply your expertise in designing unique regulatory strategies and applying innovative methods to impact the development of new medicines for the treatment of Respiratory and Immunology diseases? Do you also have a desire to find efficiencies in submission processes to enable medicines to patients faster and have a vision for submissions of the future? Then this position might be the one for you! We continue to expand our regulatory teams at AstraZeneca’s dynamic R&D sites in Gaithersburg and Durham (US), Gothenburg (Sweden) and Cambridge (UK). This role seeks a Regulatory Affairs professional with extensive experience in providing strategic and operational regulatory leadership to the development, commercialization and life cycle management of assigned products and will harness that knowledge to interrogate ongoing programs with an emphasis on incorporating innovative strategies to accelerate medicines to patients. This role is also seeking an individual able to operate above brand, to identify end-to-end acceleration opportunities and identify key opportunities for continuous improvement, striving to be the industry leader in submission excellence. To be considered for the Senior Regulatory Affairs Director role, candidates should be recognized as an expert in Regulatory Affairs and have a proven track record of driving unique regulatory strategies, innovation, and accelerating and transforming key processes. Main Duties And Responsibilities As a Regulatory Affairs professional within AstraZeneca, you will play a key role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. In Regulatory Affairs, our teams influence the development of our innovative pipeline, define the regulatory strategy for our therapeutic assets, and engage with Health Authorities to effectively inform our development programs. In this role, you will support teams in transforming exciting science into valued new medicines for patients around the world, applying innovation and best principles to accelerate the development program. This individual must have strong leadership skills and the ability to influence project teams as well as senior leaders on their innovative recommendations for a program. They must also apply their innovation prowess to our regulatory process, primarily around submission compilation and execution, in designing ways to become the industry leader in regulatory filings. Key relationships include other Late R&I GRLs to partner with in assessing ideas as well as cross- Regulatory Therapy Area interactions to establish and maintain consistency in submission processes. Other cross-functional relationships are a must (i.e. Clinical Operations, Clinical Development, Statistics) to collaborate on innovative ideas for a project or find efficiencies in our processes. Requirements In combination with your regulatory expertise, successful candidates will demonstrate competencies of strategic thinking, strategic influencing, innovation, initiative, leadership and excellent oral and written communication skills. It is important that you embrace the concepts of novel regulatory tools and technology as well as a culture of sharing experiences with others so that the medicines that we develop will benefit from latest approaches in regulatory science. You are comfortable speaking the regulatory voice at all levels of the organization. Bachelor’s Degree in Life Science or related discipline, advanced degree (PharmD, PhD, MBA) a plus. Extensive knowledge of global regulatory affairs within one or more therapeutic areas in early and late development. Prior experience in respiratory or immunology medicines preferred Proven track record of regulatory drug development including successful leadership of at least one major global regulatory filing campaign through to product approval/launch.. Current or prior people leadership experience preferred Demonstrable ability to think strategically and critically and evaluate risks to regulatory activities. Ability to work strategically within a complex, business critical and high-profile development program. Ability to develop and impart innovative ideas on the drug development process Ability to critique, identify areas for improvement, and implement efficiencies in submission processes. Ability to lead initiatives with cross-functional teams, working with change management to track progress and provide routine updates to management. At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. We will review the applications continuously so please apply as soon as possible.

Key relationships include other Late R&I GRLs to partner with in assessing ideas as well as cross- Regulatory Therapy Area interactions to establish and maintain consistency in submission processes. Other cross-functional relationships are a must (i.e. Clinical Operations, Clinical Development, Statistics) to collaborate on innovative ideas for a project or find efficiencies in our processes. Requirements In combination with your regulatory expertise, successful candidates will demonstrate competencies of critical thinking, strategic influencing, innovation, initiative, leadership and excellent oral and written communication skills. It is important that you embrace the concepts of novel regulatory tools and technology as well as a culture of sharing experiences with others so that the medicines that we develop will benefit from latest approaches in regulatory science. You are comfortable speaking the regulatory voice at all levels of the organization. Bachelor’s Degree in Life Science or related field, advanced degree (PharmD, PhD, MBA) a plus. Extensive knowledge of global regulatory affairs within one or more therapeutic areas in early and late development. Prior experience in respiratory or immunology medicines preferred Proven track record of regulatory drug development including successful leadership of at least one major global regulatory filing campaign through to product approval/launch.. Current or prior people leadership experience preferred Demonstrable ability to think strategically and critically and evaluate risks to regulatory activities. Ability to work strategically within a complex, business critical and high-profile development program. Ability to develop and impart innovative ideas on the drug development process Ability to critique, identify areas for improvement, and implement efficiencies in submission processes. Ability to lead initiatives with cross-functional teams, working with change management to track progress and provide routine updates to management. jobTitle: Senior Director & Team Leader – Global Regulatory Affairs, Late R&I
jobDescription: Do you have expertise in, and a passion for Regulatory Affairs? Would you like to apply your expertise in designing unique regulatory strategies and applying innovative methods to impact the development of new medicines for the treatment of Respiratory and Immunology diseases? Do you also have a desire to find efficiencies in submission processes to enable medicines to patients faster and have a vision for submissions of the future? Then this position might be the one for you! We continue to expand our regulatory teams at AstraZeneca’s dynamic R&D sites in Macclesfield (UK), Gaithersburg and Durham (US), Gothenburg (Sweden) or Barcelona (Spain). This role seeks a Regulatory Affairs professional with extensive experience in providing strategic and operational regulatory leadership to the development, commercialization and life cycle management of assigned products and will harness that knowledge to interrogate ongoing programs with an emphasis on incorporating innovative strategies to accelerate medicines to patients. This role is also seeking an individual able to operate above brand, to identify end-to-end acceleration opportunities and identify key opportunities for continuous improvement, striving to be the industry leader in submission excellence. To be considered for the Senior Regulatory Affairs Director role, candidates should be recognized as an expert in Regulatory Affairs and have a proven track record of driving unique regulatory strategies, innovation, and accelerating and transforming key processes. Main Duties And Responsibilities As a Regulatory Affairs professional within AstraZeneca, you will play a key role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. In Regulatory Affairs, our teams influence the development of our innovative pipeline, define the regulatory strategy for our therapeutic assets, and engage with Health Authorities to effectively inform our development programs. In this role, you will support teams in transforming exciting science into valued new medicines for patients around the world, applying innovation and best principles to accelerate the development program. This individual must have strong leadership skills and the ability to influence project teams as well as senior leaders on their innovative recommendations for a program. Extensive knowledge of global regulatory affairs within one or more therapeutic areas in early and late development. Prior experience in respiratory or immunology medicines preferred Proven track record of regulatory drug development including successful leadership of at least one major global regulatory filing campaign through to product approval/launch.. Current or prior people leadership experience preferred Demonstrable ability to think strategically and critically and evaluate risks to regulatory activities. Ability to work strategically within a complex, business critical and high-profile development program. jobTitle: Senior Director, Transformation Leader R&D (Clinical Innovation)
jobDescription: Digital health, is the convergence of healthcare with technology, data and analytics with the aim to transform the healthcare industry and improve human health. At AstraZeneca, we’ve been working hard to make this a reality, we have accumulated years of experience enabling us to embed digital health at scale in our business and lead with our digital patient solutions. Our goal is to improve experience and outcomes for patients. AstraZeneca has Digital Health as one of top strategic priorities for the company, details on digital health strategy can be found here. The Transformation leader role in R&D for Clinical will focus on helping x-functional R&D teams globally with digital, data and analytics to achieve study designs and execution plans that can achieve accelerated timelines, reduce cost, improve patient experience and reduce carbon emissions. Through reducing manual work load and complexity we will enable teams to focus on the science vs the process steps and manual work required to get to governance. Typical Accountabilities: Lead the cross functional teams supporting transformation programs in Clinical Innovation Lead the strategy and vision for the products in this area, in collaboration with the senior leaders across all therapeutic areas in AstraZeneca, Development Operations and cross functional teams involved in clinical development Identify and solve both strategic issues and provide recommendations at digital health leadership level across R&D. Lead the cross-functional delivery teams, across multiple agile teams and set clear strategic direction by clarifying priorities and rational. Responsible for stimulating conceptual thinking and creativity across the team and challenging the status quo for continuous improvement. You will need a deep understanding of business needs and users’ needs within a pharma R&D process to transform ways of working and achieve required outcomes. Deliver high-quality, hypothesis tested, business requirements, functional specifications, business processes, and system rules. Deliver effective prioritization regarding the cross portfolio backlog items in order to deliver maximum outcome with minimum input in line with business prioritizes. Review, analyze and evaluate business systems/processes and user-needs while serving as the key link between digital and IT development teams. Lead the risk management framework and report risks to advise senior collaborators on areas for attention and solutions. Influence key senior partners and provide clear & concise advice including recommendations to aid good decision-making. Provide coaching & mentoring for colleagues and assist with their personal development. Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or above in a relevant field. Strong knowledge of pharma development processes. Experience leader of cross functional global teams. Demonstrated leadership in developing strategy and vision within a large organization and delivery of outcomes. Shown experience of Agile software development as a Head of Product with clear outcomes on product delivery of outcomes and agility. Proven skills and experience in defining a clear scope and roadmap to develop sophisticated solutions Validated skills and experience leading and controlling sophisticated projects (with strong business and IT components) and activities in a multicultural context Diligence – attention to detail and ability to run a large program of concurrent activities Confirmed experience in applying a business-driven user-centric approach to product feature discovery and delivery. Clear value delivery and quality on previous products. Experience working in a large global organization where collaborators and project team members are geographically dispersed and handled through a matrix organization. Outstanding communication, presentation, facilitation, storytelling, consulting and leadership skills and ability to interact with senior leaders Excellent interpersonal and time leadership skills Experience of defining the business strategies and influencing the key collaborators of the vision for the business area Experience defining strategies and approaches to AI/ML model monitoring, maintenance and management This role can be located at our Cambridge, UK; Gothenburg, Sweden; Gaithersburg, MD; New York, NY, or Waltham, MA site If this sounds like the type of organization where you would like to grow your career and make a real difference to patients then we would like to hear from you; apply today! Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the group: AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious diseases. But we're more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, we're proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration through scientific research. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. The Sr Engineer will lead or make strong technical contributions within cross functional combination product development teams and/or to complex technical development and problem-solving projects. This role will be responsible for successful completion of design, development and commercialization deliverables and ensuring that device design, component selection, manufacturability and testing specifications and methods meet product needs. To be successful the candidate must effectively interface with staff and leaders in Device Development, Quality, Regulatory Affairs, Drug Development, Process Engineering and across other areas of Biologics Product Development and Astra Zeneca. Strong communication skills are required including succinct and effective presentation of technical and non-technical materials during meetings with company Senior Management / Leaders, health authorities, audits and other internal and external stakeholders. This role will lead technical development with external development and commercialization partners and component suppliers and problem-solving activities using state of the art tools and techniques such as DMAIC, DFFS, DOE, Monte Carlo Simulation, Probabilistic Design, etc. Development and commercialization must be conducted in compliance with applicable processes / procedures, standards and regulations including Design controls, Risk management, Human factors engineering, FDA QSR, ISO13485, etc. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Lead or be a strong technical contributor to a cross functional team in the selection, development, scale up and/or commercialization of drug delivery devices for the AZ pipeline Be a senior scientific contributor to complex problem solving and technical development Contribute to departmental combination product development capability by applying and maintaining a high level of knowledge and expertise Influence and educate cross-functional stakeholders and leaders on device development and commercialization best practices Establish a close working relationship with and provide effective oversight of suppliers and manage technical aspects of external collaborations Drive a Quality mindset and ensure that work is performed in accordance with appropriate quality requirements and compliance standards (e.g. risk management, Design Controls, ISO standards etc.) Contribute to regulatory filings and health authority responses Develop and implement best practices / business processes Education & Experience Requirements: Education: Engineering or technical degree or equivalent. BS required, MS or PhD preferred. Experience: Sr Engineer: BS and a minimum of 6 years of experience in technical roles within combination product development or MS and a minimum of 4 years of experience or a PhD and some relevant experience preferred Required Skills: Excellent leadership skills to lead a cross functional team and ensure success of the project. A track record of working effectively within a matrix organization with a highly cross-functional and collaborative environment is required. Excellent communication skills are required. Familiarity with industry standards and practices applicable to device and/or combination product development is required. Desired Skills: Experience in working with external development and commercialization partners and suppliers is highly desirable. Experience working on injection devices such as prefilled syringes, autoinjectors, on-body delivery systems/large volume injectors, or other delivery devices such as infusion pumps, insulin pumps, infusion systems, etc. is highly desirable Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe. Our Frederick Manufacturing Center (FMC) is one of 30 production facilities in 18 countries that creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This biologics manufacturing facility makes a direct contribution to treating people with cancer, respiratory and autoimmune conditions across the globe. It’s challenging but highly rewarding work, involves more than 675 talented people throughout the manufacturing lifecycle and supporting office functions. We work hard to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, and we take time to have fun and celebrate our accomplishments. From catered site festivities to competitive events, community outreach activities, environmental and wellness showcases and team-building events, we take time to recognize our achievements. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. We are committed to continuous learning and offer ongoing skill building and training for our staff and encourage additional secondary schooling with tuition reimbursement of 100% up to $10,000 each year. The FMC is also an award-winning employer and has been recognized as a ‘Top 50’ Business in Frederick and awarded Frederick County’s ‘Best Place to Work’ distinction in 2015 and 2019. Come join our award-wining team and support the manufacture of life-changing medicines for patients across the world. Everything we do is to make people’s lives better. To us it’s personal, as we invent, make, deliver and support. Taking our cutting-edge innovations from our science labs to patients. Fueled by our aspiration to deliver accelerated growth for our company and to make people’s lives better, there’s never been a more exciting time to shape the next phase of Operations’ evolution and growth. We explore, willing to support new ideas, go above and beyond to find better solutions, every day. This is a place for the resilient – hungry for new challenges and diverse opportunities. The driven – willing to learn, take personal accountability and step out of their comfort zone. To build a collective legacy of doing good for people, the environment and society. Why Join Operations? Here we turn molecules to medicines, bringing our Research & Development pipeline to life through a rigorous process of development, manufacturing, testing and delivery. In our fast-paced, growing environment, embrace an exciting opportunity to build a long-term, varied career. With a huge variety of global opportunities and learning from other teams this is the place to embrace lifelong learning and build capabilities, setting your own direction and pace. If you have the passion and the drive to accelerate growth and make people’s lives better – then this is the place for you. As a Senior Reliability Engineer in Frederick, MD, you’ll play a pivotal role in channelling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. It offers one of the most exciting, fast paced, challenging, and rewarding work environments in the world of operations, supply chain and manufacturing. Description: The Reliability Engineer will effectively coordinate and execute continuous reliability improvement of equipment and utilities at the site. The primary role of the RE is to improve asset reliability through the elimination of repetitive failures, technical support of the facilities and maintenance functions, and effectively managing the Asset Life Cycle process. Main Responsibilities Create and maintain frequent (monthly) review of site maintenance metrics to assess maintenance effectiveness and efficiency together with site Facilities and Engineering functions. Drive enhancement based on KPI’s and develop adequate measures for continuous improvement. investigate equipment failures by utilizing RCA tools such as 5-Why and Why-Tree templates and drive corrective actions. Attend extensive off-site training on use of PdM equipment and how to analyze results. Training curriculum and providers will be ISO recognized or equivalent training will be approved or provided by above-site Reliability Engineering. Train and mentor maintenance and reliability technicians on precision maintenance fundamentals. Perform precision alignment of belts and shafts utilizing precision alignment tools, while educating and training maintenance teammates on alignment techniques Manage and optimize preventive and predictive maintenance programs including systematically defining, developing, monitoring, and refining the process. Manage and optimize the Asset Life Cycle Management process in alignment with above-site processes and procedures. Present information to management as it relates to reliability initiatives. Maintain the integrity and security of an array of sensitive and technical tools. Communicate effectively with management to adequately address findings in a timely manner. Demonstrate ability to understand and perform simple frequency analysis. (Identify frequencies of known components and harmonics) Training and certification (as appropriate) in the operation of thermographic (infra-red) cameras and equipment, vibration analysis equipment, and ultrasonic equipment preferred. Demonstrated ability to visually identify electrical and mechanical components as they relate to pharmaceutical manufacturing. Hands-on approach to reliability engineering and troubleshooting Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering or related discipline. ANSI accredited Vibration Analysis and Infrared certification preferred Understanding of relational database structures (SQL) and computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) 5+ yrs of industry experience 5+ yrs reliability engineering experience in manufacturing environment preferred Why AstraZeneca? Do you have an expertise and passion for developing IT Strategies and Enterprise Architecture? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines? If so, AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious diseases. But we are more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. We are dedicated to being a Great Place to Work that empowers its staff to push the boundaries of science and spark your entrepreneurial spirit. There is no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients, and society while committing to lifelong learning, growth, and development. About our IT Architecture Team The R&D IT Architecture team comprises 35+ Architects. Within that, our dedicated 5 Enterprise Architects focus on the IT Strategy, Capability Roadmaps, and Enterprise Architecture covering all of R&D. As an integral part of our business, R&D is revamping its AI (Artificial Intelligence), Data, and Digital Transformations as part of AZ2025 IT Strategy. The Research space meets the demands of our growing business with strategic IT transformations in Target Discovery, ELN (Electronic Lab Notebook) & LIMs (Lab Information Management) (Lab Information Management), Sample Management, and AI & Analytics. As Architects, we connect the dots across the business to improve the agility and functionality of our processes to accelerate AstraZeneca to the next level. There is so much potential to influence and motivate change, and it is an exciting challenge if you are up for it. As champions of our Technology ecosystem, we make sure the rest of the business experiences the true benefits of our systems. Uniting diverse areas and simplifying the way we work, encouraging growth mindsets and behaviors along the way – our reach goes beyond technology. It starts with a comprehensive view, connecting emerging trends with business ambitions and applying emotional intelligence to understand how we can guide the right way to work and behave. Across the enterprise and each technology domain we come together to find leading solutions that will provide the platform for AstraZeneca's success. Change agents, we are always proactively hunting for new insights and problem-solving to identify better ways of doing things. Motivated by the opportunities to learn and grow, we move fast and drive forward. Lay the foundations for future technological and people-driven success across AstraZeneca. ABOUT THE ROLE? The Enterprise Architect will be responsible for developing the Research value chain related IT strategies and roadmaps, work on key transformations in this space and guide solution delivery aligned to our over-arching business and IT strategies. You will assess and review the work of both Enterprise and Solution architecture and build a balance between immediate and strategic needs. You will be involved in IT long-term planning typically over the 1-5 year horizon and accountable for the development of Reference Architectures, Architecture standards, IT Strategy & Roadmaps (1-5 years) and review of blueprints for IT in the Research space. You will jointly with capability teams develop business cases underpinned by architecture. Understanding implications of architecture requirements to 'As-Is' architectures and define/update 'To-Be' architectures applying AZ architecture guiding principles. The Enterprise Architect will also support solution development efforts originating from portfolios, participate in and/or lead IT initiatives, domain groups and provide active guidance for better planning and decision making. Accountabilities: Responsible for the IT Strategy & Capability Roadmaps development within the Research value chain area. Developing Reference IT Architectures for Research value chain area. Develop relationship with Strategic Vendors – Aligning their roadmaps to AstraZeneca's transformation journey. Participate in Architecture Assessments & Reviews either as Lead Reviewing Architect or as a domain specialist in the review team. Contribute to the development of the Architecture Capability within IT, by detailing and sharing knowledge and standard methodologies with peer Architects Maintain a view of the current and future state architecture within a defined architecture focus area. Work on key strategic transformation projects and drive the IT Strategy & architectures for these projects. Lead and/or provide active participation in Enterprise domain teams and working groups applicable to domain accountability. Essential requirements: Experience within a Pharma company, ideally within the R&D space. Experience producing application strategies/road maps for a global enterprise in their focused architecture domain Experience with rationalization, consolidation, and integration across business domains Experience with large Justification phase work - product evaluation, business case formulation Experience developing and influencing business strategies with multi-functional team impact. Experience developing and leading innovative solutions Validated experience of leading change and challenging approaches/ideas Experience developing and managing relationships with third party suppliers Experience working within and developing policies, procedures, and guidelines within a secure, quality, and compliance environment Educational requirements: Bachelor's Degree Preferred High School Diploma Required WHY JOIN US? We are a network of ambitious self-starters contributing to something far more significant. There is a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that is unique to AstraZeneca – it allows us to dive deep into exploring new leading-edge technology. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science. We optimize and revolutionize AstraZeneca by maximizing efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification. We are not afraid to take ownership and run with it. We are a place to be open and transparent – we speak up, think creatively, and share ideas. Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. AstraZeneca has a constant drive to innovate and an appreciation for high standards. It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because, put simply, we make a significant impact. Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors! SO, WHAT'S NEXT? Do you see yourself being a long-standing member of the IT team? If so, we would love to hear from you! Click the link to apply, and we will be in touch as soon as possible. WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en We present a competitive and comprehensive salary & benefits package at the offer process. Date Posted: 12-Sep-2022 Closing Date: 20-Nov-2022 AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements. AstraZeneca requires all US employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 but will consider requests for reasonable accommodations as required by a

The main purpose of this role is to support/assist the delivery of the Global Clinical R&D portfolio and clinical projects. The delivery of clinical projects should be to agreed productivity, within agreed budget and to inspection ready quality standards. The Senior Finance Analyst will be accountable to provide SMM United States (US SMM) with systems and finance support to meeting monthly reporting timelines and to plan, control and follow-up on business information (e.g. CTMS, ACCORD) in compliance with AZ Procedural Documents, international guidelines such as ICH-GCP, and relevant local regulations. The Senior Finance Analyst will support all clinical projects in US SMM providing access to business & finance information and liaising with Americas Regional Finance Manager and MC Finance Department as applicable to US SMM. A Senior Finance Analyst with longer tenure and experience may support additional responsibilities which include additional tasks associated with Local Study Associate Directors. Typical Accountabilities: Provides a high level of application and information system expertise to the business to maximise reliability, productivity, speed, quality and cost containment. Support and implement strategy for efficient and effective use of all clinical systems (CTMS, Accord, and COUPA) in United States including access management, end user support, compliance reporting, conduct training and testing as needed. Ensure financial processes and practices are understood and adhered to within the department. Fulfil accountabilities of SOX compliance as needed. Manage and maintain monthly ACCORD and Finance Month End processes. Ensure global and local financial systems are utilised correctly through training of users and review of processes and data. Provide support to Local Study Associate Directors (LSAD) to ensure SOWs and purchase orders are aligned with financial guidelines. Partner with local and global IS finance partners to ensure that clinical payment system and functions are in place to meet tax and financial requirements. Assist in the continuous improvement of US SMM in terms of compliance and key performance indicators. This includes reviewing performance and resource data to be able to deliver status reports. Implement and analyse quality metrics in relation to study process objectives with a specific focus on analysis of financial data and resource usage and management. Management and analysis of monthly ACCORD figures and analysis of clinical trial spend and reporting. Global representation/participation and local representation/participation on systems and financial projects. Conduct activities and interactions consistent with Company values and in compliance with the Code of Conduct and supporting Policies relevant to your role. Complete all required training on the AZ Code of Conduct and supporting Policies on time. Report potential issues of non-compliance. Follows quality issue processes by escalating systematic or serious quality issues, data privacy breaches, CSP or ICH-GCP compliance issues to Local Management and/or Clinical Quality Associate Director (CQAD) as required. Prepares for and collaborates with the activities associated with audits and regulatory inspections in liaison with LSAD and CQAD. Ensures compliance with AstraZeneca’s Code of Ethics, company policies and procedures relating to people, finance, technology, security, and SHE (Safety, Health and Environment). Ensures compliance with local, national and regional legislation, as applicable. Education, Qualifications, Skills & Experience Essential: College diploma/university degree in computer science or business-related discipline. Sound knowledge of financial reporting and document management. Ability to develop advanced computer skills to increase efficiency in day-to-day tasks. Ability to train others on systems processes. Display excellent organization and time management skills, excellent attention to detail, and ability to multi-task in a high-volume environment with shifting priorities. Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Team oriented and flexible; ability to respond quickly to shifting demands and opportunities. Desirable: Ability to work in an environment of remote collaborators. 2-3 years of experience in a clinical trial environment. Sound knowledge or clinical process and good clinical practice. Manages change with a positive approach for self, team, and the business. Sees change as an opportunity to improve performance and add value to the business. Ability to look for and champion more efficient and effective methods/processes of delivering quality clinical trials with reduced budget and in less time. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrates ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with conflicting deadlines. Ability to work in a diverse work environment. Ability to understand the impact of technology on projects and to use and develop computer skills while making appropriate use of systems/software in an e-enabled environment.

jobTitle: Senior Global Medical Affairs Leader, Respiratory Inhaled
jobDescription: AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. 2022 is an extraordinary time to be in Medical Affairs – the opportunity to improve the speed and quality of care for millions of people with long-term conditions around the world, to support healthcare systems to address health inequalities and variations in care, and to be the driving force behind AstraZeneca’s business strategy and development of a rich portfolio of innovative medicines, is remarkable. BioPharmaceuticals Medical (BPM) at AstraZeneca is at the forefront of the industry but there remains significant headroom to grow – there is no better place to improve patients’ lives and to develop your career as a Medically-orientated business leader than at AstraZeneca. Typical Accountabilities: Design and manage the implementation of the global medical product strategy globally and regionally Work with the Medical Head to create and develop the strategic direction, business/resource planning, and team leadership on a global level Be a proactive member of the Global Medical Team (GMT) to ensure global strategy is effectively communicated and executed at regional and country levels and that regional/country needs are appropriately accommodated in global deliverables and drive customer insights and market needs from all countries into Global Product Team for review Collaborate cross-functionally with GMA functions (eg Global Medical Excellence & Medical Evidence) Closely follow medical developments and competitive landscape within Therapeutic area and disseminate new information to transform clinical trends and emerging data into strategy Be an active contributor to the cross functional congress planning team Provide input, as needed, into labelling (USPI, SmPc) and core data sheet discussions Liaise with the internal and external medical community Deliver medical advocacy plan that drives successful launch of innovative and differentiated new medicines or indications within the therapy area Support team leader at TA Global Product Team and Global Brand Team Accountable for engaging and cultivating relationships with leading global KEEs to gain: contribution/ participation in advisory boards, greater understanding of the therapeutic area and insights into unmet patient needs Represents AZ at scientific and medical forums, including medical education forums, scientific roundtables, congresses, and symposia Responsible for the co-ordination of Medical Affairs activities including developing content for Science Advisory boards Ensuring the alignment of the publication and medical evidence plans to the Medical Strategy and Medical plan Delegate for the Medical Head as required Manages other specific respiratory/medical projects as required Responsibility for managing particular areas of the budget Provide medical strategic and scientific input into assessment of investigator initiated studies as a member of the GREG Be an active member of team(s) for assets in development while providing medical strategic input Minimum Requirements: Doctoral level degree: MD/PhD/PharmD 5 years of pharmaceutical experience Scientific expertise in the respiratory area Demonstration of strategic and medical leadership prowess Personal experience in the design and conduct of interventional and/or observational studies is ideal, but not mandatory Experience supporting an indication, promotional claim and scientific exchange including input into clinical development plan and TPP Track record of building and maintaining a deep and continued connection to Medical Practice/healthcare delivery Collaborative/matrix management skills with a focus on leading diverse groups (e.g., cultural, geographical, functional) to achieve excellent results in shared goals Well-developed communication and influencing skills with the ability to distil complexity down to what matters to our stakeholders Strong financial/budget and project management skills/business acumen Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. So, what’s next! Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. AstraZeneca has taken critical steps to protecting colleagues, loved ones, and patients from COVID-19 and its variants.Accordingly, AstraZeneca requires all US employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment.AstraZeneca will consider requests for reasonable accommodations as required by applicable law.

jobTitle: Senior Group Director, Late Vaccines and Immune Therapies
jobDescription: Opportunity: Senior Group Director, Late Vaccines and Immune Therapies Locations: Cambridge (UK), Gothenburg (Sweden), Warsaw (Poland), Gaithersburg (US), Durham (US) Salary: Competitive, with excellent benefits In this anticipated role as a Vaccines and Immune Therapies (V&I) Senior Group Director, you will have responsibility for line managing scientists and physicians, including performance management and professional development activities. The Senior Group Director is accountable to the Executive Group Director of V&I for maximizing efficient utilization of their group's scientists and physicians and to deliver the agreed V&I objectives. You will lead your team by example displaying AZ values and helping shape an inclusive culture of growth and development. You will participate in drug program activities as agreed with the Executive Director or VP of V&I. You may also have accountability for additional non-program project work in support of optimizing Clinical Development within the organization. Your key role is to achieve these aims by efficiently resourcing program(s) and providing strategic and operational leadership within V&I, supported by the Executive Director or VP of V&I. Typical Accountabilities Provide strategic and operational leadership to assigned scientists and physicians. Ensure consistent practices, compliance with internal SOPs, local regulations and laws, talent development, leadership development, best practice sharing, mentoring programs, coaching, training, and medical education in collaboration with the Executive Group Director V&I and across Biopharmaceuticals. Line management responsibility for scientists and physicians: Deliver performance management Guide professional development Ensure expectations for success are clearly understood and agreed Ensure individuals are rewarded and recognized appropriately for success Actively manage poor performance Efficiently utilize resources and capabilities within their group in alignment with agreed Late R&I resource deployment principles. Responsible for working with Late R&I capacity management team to ensure that program resource allocations and requests are accurately reflected in capacity management systems. May work with capacity management team to modify resource algorithms as business need evolves. Recruitment and retention of internal and external talent to support capabilities. Collaborate with peers to ensure consistency of approach and implementation of best practices in capability development, including on-boarding processes for new hires. Ensure pipeline of successors to Global Clinical Program Leader, Global Development Scientist/Medical Director, and Senior Group Director roles. Essential Medical and scientific background with MD, Ph.D., PharmD degree or equivalent Relevant experience in line management and/or leading a team Broad clinical and research background and a comprehensive understanding of medical aspects of drug development Experience in pharmaceutical drug development Generally, at least 3-5 years of pharmaceutical company experience is required although in exceptional cases, other relevant experience may be substituted Desirable Infectious diseases experience e.g. COVID, RSV &/or Influenza Working knowledge of performance management, capacity management, budget management, and employment legislation Specific experience in late stage pharmaceutical drug development So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining us? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Please apply, uploading your CV by Monday the 7th of November 2022 As we review applications on an ongoing basis, we reserve the right to close the advert at any point. Where you can find out more: Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en For more information please contact: andrew.joss@astrazeneca.com Additional Information Our Company Values & Behaviors underpin everything we do so please take a moment to familiarize yourself with them. You may also want to check out our new R&D Video showing how we turn Science into Medicines. Covid-19 Resources More information about our sites: Cambridge, UK Gothenburg, Sweden Gaithersburg, US Warsaw, Poland

Chennai, (India)Cambridge, UK; Macclesfield, UK; Gaithersburg, MD, USA; Gothenburg, Sweden Do you have expertise in, and passion for Information Architecture within the context of Pharmaceutical R&D? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Enterprise Data & AI services in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About Astrazeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. About Enterprise Data & Ai Services (ed&ais) We lead AstraZeneca’s transformation, fusing our digital and data capabilities with backing from the business to make it happen. By partnering across the business, we’re leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make improved decisions and help the business to reach the right outcomes, quicker. We challenge, innovate and break away from the norm to find bold new ways of approaching the everyday. A place to realise the true impact data and digital can make. Enterprise Data & AI Services (ED&AIS) is a new central IT function accountable for enterprise strategy and standards in Data and AI engineering, enabling services, information data architecture as well as the delivery of data provisioning services and AI product delivery for the enterprise. The organization works closely with Data & AI delivery teams across Business Technology Groups (BTGs) and data governance teams from LoB Data offices, supporting the build of AstraZeneca Data Mesh products and analytical solutions. It identifies enabling, horizontal services required across the estate and ensures effective easy to use services such as Cataloguing, Privacy, Master Data Management, Unification, Profiling, Data Quality, Engineering Orchestration, AI Ops, Model Registries etc It ensures, through Information Architecture, that the resultant data products are FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) by design enabling effective re-use. It supports functional data provision and data product delivery to LoB / BTG teams to functional and global standards and policies ensuring compliant and secure data assets (working with LoB Data Offices). It leads the delivery of advanced AI products in NLP, Computer Vision, Recommendation Engines and Predictive Modelling, supporting BTG/LoB teams in tech solution selection, product build and the run of business critical AI solutions It leads the strategy of and innovation in Data & AI technology for the enterprise, working closely with Enterprise Architecture and Tech Innovation teams JOB ROLE The Information Architect will play a leading role in ensuring that AstraZeneca architects and builds solutions that deliver FAIR data products enabling both digital and data/AI. Focusing initially on our regulatory domain, which is the business group involved in managing all AstraZeneca regulatory submissions and interactions, you will lead activities to define the information architecture for the domain, including data models, master data strategies, metadata strategies and the connection with the R&D data office to ensure that data is appropriately defined and governed. You will have a responsibility to deliver the efficient design of data and information architectures to support business objectives. A key component of delivery will be to ensure that AstraZeneca data is Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR) across our systems, ready for either direct use by consumers or AI machines. You will also partner with other functions, such as engineering, business data governance and data analysis as well as Enterprise architecture functions to deliver business value. This involves an end to end platform comprising of integrated data services (ingest, catalogue, unify, privacy, access etc) enabling teams to self-serve in the preparation of new, and consumption of existing, data assets in line with R&D data standards, polices and operating procedures (governed by the Data Office and Information Architecture). Lastly, as a member of an Enterprise Information Architecture Practice, you will also support the delivery of the D&A portfolio through the provision of coordinated Information Architecture services and design. You will be a key part of the Information Architecture Review Board, ensuring that all Information Architectures are reviewed and are aligned and where required represent IA in business data governance forums. Skills And Capabilities Needed Essential for the role The role holder will possess a blend of information architecture and analysis skills, together with experience in overseeing implementation within engineered solutions. Experience of enterprise data modelling, ideally in the context of pharma R&D. Experience of designing master data solutions and strategies, ideally within the context of Pharma R&D. Experience in the use of metadata standards Bachelor’s Degree in related field Desirable for the role Understanding of FAIR data management principles Experience of running a data architecture governance function Strong R&D domain knowledge, ideally practised within Regulatory, Clinical or Patient Safety domains. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
