jobTitle: Senior Scientist, ADC Programs, Early Oncology Discovery
jobDescription: At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re passionate about the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we believe we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. AstraZeneca’s vision in Oncology is to push the boundaries of science to change the practice of medicine, transform the lives of patients living with cancer, and to ultimately eliminate cancer as a cause of death. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. We are seeking a highly motivated and independent Senior Scientist with a proven track record of scientific excellence in cancer biology to join our antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) portfolio team within the Early Oncology Discovery group in Gaithersburg, MD USA. As a Senior Scientist, you will be a key member of a team focused on bringing new ADC projects into the portfolio and advancing them through all stages of pre-clinical development. You will have a direct impact on the drug discovery process, a hands-on contributor in the lab. You will bring your theoretical and practical expertise to support pipeline projects, establishing program priorities and working with a cross-functional team to deliver pre-clinical datasets to support pipeline progression. You will present program updates at internal meetings. As part of the team, you will also make intellectual contributions to programs across the ADC Portfolio. Main Duties and Responsibilities You will serve as Oncology biology support one or more pipeline programs, working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure the timely generation and dissemination of critical program data to enable milestone progression decisions. Working with the project team, you will help set program strategy, and as biology lead you will be responsible for the delivery of key pre-clinical data that support a strong biological rationale for program progression. Working in the laboratory, you will develop, design, conduct, troubleshoot, and analyze in vitro experiments to assess the function of our ADCs and dissect the mechanism of action of these novel cancer therapeutics. As a highly organized, self-motivated individual with a strong background in cancer biology, you will stay up to date with relevant technical and intellectual scientific expertise in tumor biology and cancer modelling, particularly as it relates to antibody drug conjugates, and have a genuine passion for this field of research. Essential Requirements PhD Degree with 3+ years of experience, Master's Degree with 5+ years of experience Strong knowledge of cell biology, molecular biology, and/or biochemistry in the context of cancer biology, with a strong desire for continued learning. Works independently to design and conduct key experiments to support program progression. Experience with molecular- and cell-based methodologies such as cytotoxicity assays, flow cytometry, fluorescent and live cell microscopy, ELISA, qPCR, western blotting. AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, with our portfolio, our pipeline, and our people, we strive to redefine cancer care with our ambition to provide cures for cancer in every form. Our broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally in lung, breast, gastrointestinal, GU and hematological cancers. We follow the science to deliver life-changing treatments and increase the potential to save the lives of people around the world. If you are passionate about science and data-driven decision making, explore the possibility of joining us as senior scientist, AI & NLP specialist to shape our oncology portfolio trials via optimal use of clinical information. The position sits within Oncology Information Practice department a part of the Oncology Biometrics organization. As part of a diverse global team, you will support the drug development process by providing scientific information (literature, data analytics, digital visualizations) for early-stage drug development. We also deliver information and data supporting the Oncology drug projects portfolio decisions via strategic information initiatives, applying knowledge of external environment and trends for internal information needs. This role can be based in Gaithersburg (US), Wilmington (US), Macclesfield (UK) or Cambridge (UK). About the Role: We are looking for a AI & NLP specialist to tackle some of the most challenging problems in natural language processing and large-scale text mining applications. The AI Science Specialist will apply sophisticated quantitative expertise in advanced mathematical subject areas to develop data science solutions. The role will work to demonstrate foundational and innovative techniques to manipulate, and process structured and unstructured data, in combination with business domain knowledge, to develop and apply advanced modelling algorithms (e.g. classification, regression, clustering, NLP, graph theory and more) to generate business and scientific insights. The role will work within defined project scope and solutions aligned to established governance frameworks and policies. You will help build intelligent applications powered by knowledge graphs, embeddings and machine learning. You will be part of data scientists, machine learning and information scientists teams, creating and using tools that will advance the standard of healthcare improving the lives of millions of patients across the globe. Your work will advance our ontologies and natural language understanding tooling to assemble vast quantities of biological, medical, and clinical knowledge. The ideal candidate should possess a blend of theoretical and practical skills in applying NLP and machine learning in a scientific environment. What you'll do: Develop, implement and support modelling solutions designed to drive the interrogation of datasets for insights in scientific and business application areas within defined project scope. This includes integrating data from multiple different sources and modalities and includes the application of specialized approaches in classification, regression, clustering, NLP, graph theory and/or other techniques. Translates unstructured, business problems into the appropriate data problem, model and analytical solutions Researching and developing predictive models and computational methods to guide decision-making within project parameters and established approaches. May present or publish findings for conferences and in peer reviewed journals. Builds effective relationships with established range of partners to ensure utilization and value of information resources and services. Clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated uncertainties and limitations within agreed frameworks Provides data science support to cross-functional projects in order to implement defined solutions that drive value to AstraZeneca Develop, implement and maintain required tools and algorithms in a manner which meets regulatory and evidential requirements within the defined project scope Develop, maintain and apply ongoing knowledge and awareness in trends, standard methodology and new developments in analytics and data science Implement working practices to ensure that data science work is delivered to robust quality standards and aligned to defined governance frameworks and policies Essential Requirements: Bachelors degree with a minimum of 3 years’ experience or Masters degree with minimum of 2 years’ experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Computational Linguistic, Engineering, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computational Sciences, or a related quantitative subject area Experience in modern data science approaches, including unsupervised and supervised classification and regression algorithms such as k-means clustering, support vector machines, random forests, neural networks and deep learning. Demonstrated knowledge in advanced statistical modelling, or broader aspects of applied mathematics such as dynamical systems or optimization. Understanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling and applications Demonstrated experience in NLP (2+ years) Strong coding skills in Python Experience in solving NLP problems, such as Search, NER, language generation, classification using the latest SOTA deep learning models and frameworks (hugginface, bert, pytorch, spacy) Working knowledge of cloud environment (AWS preferred) Ability to explain sophisticated methods and techniques to a non-technical audience Desirable for the role: PhD Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Computational Linguistic, Engineering, Physics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative subject area. Comfortable working in high performing computing or cloud environment Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills Deep technical skills in knowledge representation, reasoning, knowledge graphs. The position will take a role in developing and implementing bioanalytical strategies for advancing our drug pipeline. Responsibilities Develop, optimize and execute cell based and molecular based assays Execute multi-parameter flow cytometry assay, reporter cell assays; ELISA, multiplexed cytokine readouts (e.g., Luminex); and qRT-PCR/ddPCR. Analyze data for PK, PD, and distribution studies and contribute to data driven decisions and strategies to understand drug efficacy, safety, and mechanism of action. Interface and work collaboratively with CRO and testing lab partners Qualifications & Experience Ph.D. in Immunology, Cellular Biology, or related discipline with 2-3 years of relevant experience, or M.S. degree with 6+ years of relevant experience. Prior experience in developing bioanalytical assays in the ligand binding or cell based format. Highly motivated, willingness to acquire new skills, and ability to work with minimal supervision. Must have strong scientific knowledge and preferably a familiarity with analytical development work. Familiarity with cGLPs and relevant regulatory guidance documents is preferred

This position will also be responsible for performing some routine administrative duties necessary to keep laboratory areas operational, safe, and compliant, such as logbook review, chemical inventory accuracy, general laboratory upkeep and ordering. Other duties as assigned. This is an individual contributor position. Ensure results are accurate and completed on time, within project timelines Interpersonal Communication: This position needs to lead meetings and provide feedback to internal and external colleagues Minimum Qualifications: M.S. or B.S (or equivalent) in biological sciences, physical sciences, or similar fields Minimum Proven Experience: - M.S.: 1 year; B.S.: 2 years Bioassay expert with experience in the biotechnology or pharmaceutical sectors Experience in method development, D.O.E studies, qualification/validation, and analytical technology transfer of reporter gene and binding potency methods/bioassays Expertise in culture and cell line maintenance activities using aseptic technique Extensive theoretical and cross-functional expertise in the context of company objectives to independently address complex problems Good working knowledge of other related fields Proficient in the Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, SoftMax Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Lean practices in an Operations environment a plus Why AstraZeneca? AstraZeneca is a global, science-driven biopharmaceutical company. We are dedicated to discovering, developing, and delivering innovative, meaningful medicines and healthcare solutions that enrich the lives of patients. The vision of AstraZeneca Oncology is to redefine cancer, redefine our solutions to cancer, and restore patients' lives. Within Hematology R&D, we are committed to advancing the science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of six scientific platforms (Immuno-Oncology, Tumor Drivers and Resistance, DNA Damage Response, Antibody-drug Conjugates, Cell Therapy and Epigenetics) to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of hematological cancers, we are motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. This unit has responsibility for the value chain from discovery through to late-stage development, enabling rapid acceleration of promising early-stage assets and life-cycle management programs. The Early Data Science Bioinformatics Oncology team works with our oncology drug project teams throughout the research and early development pipeline, from new target discovery to translational medicine and clinical trials. Our global group aligns its activities to AstraZeneca’s areas of focus in Oncology: tumour drivers & resistance, DNA damage response, immuno-oncology, epigenetics, cell therapies and antibody-drug conjugates. We deliver data-driven, practical insights through the application of computational science to all areas of Oncology portfolio. The group has substantial expertise and a renowned track record in bioinformatics and data science, undertaking both portfolio applied informatics research and the development of innovative capabilities. To meet the growing portfolio in Hematology and the challenges of pre-clinical and clinical big data generation initiatives including DNA sequencing, single-cell and bulk expression, epigenetics, proteomics and CRISPR, we are looking for a new member to our bioinformatics team who is hardworking, motivated and has a strong background and experience in haematological cancers, cancer genetics and epigenetics. Be an integral part of Hematological drug projects to understand their scientific and technical challenges and proactively impact these using bioinformatics. Apply data and knowledge analytics to deliver insights driving discovery and development of the next generation of cancer medicines. Develop and perform innovative computational analyses of multi-modal data from clinical and preclinical samples in AZ’s targeted assets. Discover new insights from sophisticated biological data via innovative analysis or visualization. Work with internal groups, collaborators, and external companies to influence generation of data assets and analytical methods. Build internal analytical capabilities to enable peers and bench scientists to explore and understand complex data. Contribute to the field of oncology via presentations at conferences and publications in high impact journals. Minimum requirements: Relevant PhD (or equivalent graduate degree and 1 plus years of experience), combining: technical expertise in either bioinformatics, computational biology, biostatistics, mathematical modelling, data science or knowledge engineering. Working experience and/or deep understanding of the haematological cancers, cell death mechanisms and epigenetics. R and/or Python programming and visualization expertise, experience with Unix environment and high-performance computing environments, AWS. Skilled in communicating sophisticated data to a non-expert. Enthusiasm and persistence in the application of analytical methods to complex biological problems. Capable of efficiently leading multiple simultaneous projects. Working effectively within cross-disciplinary science teams. Experience contributing to the research community through publication, conferences, and code sharing. Desirable requirements: Working experience with machine learning, artificial-intelligence, Bayesian analytics or other non-traditional approaches to model biological data Strong publication record. Strong established network within external bioinformatics and oncology communities.

jobTitle: Senior Scientist, Clinical Pharmacology In Neuroscience & Vaccines & Immune Therapies
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Within the Clinical Pharmacology and Safety Sciences function, we have a state-of-the-art quantitative clinical pharmacology group with a diverse and uniquely skilled team of clinical pharmacometricians and clinical pharmacology scientists. Cambridge and Gaithersburg are key research and development locations for our Vaccines and Immune Therapies & Neuroscience area. What you'll do: You will work closely with clinical pharmacometricians, physicians and other scientists, and apply your expertise and leadership skills to contribute to the strategy of the clinical program and the design and interpretation of clinical studies. You will influence key decisions in early and late phases of clinical development. In collaboration with clinical pharmacometricians, you will represent Clinical Pharmacology and Quantitative Pharmacology in cross-functional project teams, and take ownership for developing the clinical pharmacology strategy. The work includes integration of relevant data, such as dose information, pharmacokinetics, biomarkers and clinical endpoints within and across studies, compounds and development stages. You will take part in finding opportunities to apply model informed drug development to accelerate and inform decision making. You will communicate your findings within and outside of AstraZeneca and publish in peer reviewed journals. jobTitle: Senior Scientist, Clinical Proteomics, Translational Medicine
jobDescription: Gaithersburg, MD About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. A place built on courage, curiosity and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take smart risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline and Oncology team. Make a meaningful impact that brings real benefits to society. By applying your knowledge of data, you will help to redefine our industry and ultimately save lives. Work with experts who share a common goal: to accelerate the potential of medicines and the science of tomorrow. Sr. Scientist, Clinical Proteomics, Translational Medicine Do you have expertise in, and passion for, targeted mass spectrometry and clinical proteomics? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the clinical development of oncology drugs with innovative biomarkers in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca’s Clinical Proteomics team, Gaithersburg, MD, might be the place for you! Translational Medicine at AstraZeneca Translational Medicine supports programs in all phases of development and focuses on making measurements on human samples to understand why, and identify which, patients benefit from particular treatments, what doses and schedules of treatments to use and the mechanisms underlying the development of resistance to treatment. In oncology studies, Translational Medicine are responsible for the biomarker strategy and implementation which includes all genomic and proteomic exploratory analyses of global clinical trial samples and prospective testing for trial recruitment where required. Join the team dedicated to Oncology, with an ambition to eliminate cancer as a cause of death. It’s our big vision that unites and inspires us. With multiple indications and high-quality molecules at all stages of our innovative pipeline, we keep pushing forward. Fusing cutting-edge science with the latest technology to achieve breakthroughs. Backed by investment, we are aiming to deliver 6 new molecular entities by 2025. We are empowered to be bold, take calculated risks and use our intelligence and courage to always follow the science. This approach has enabled us to successfully deliver 7 new Oncology medicines in as many years. We are focused on identifying and treating patients earlier, where there is greater curative potential. With the greatest number of early stage cancer trials in the industry, we are getting closer to finding cures every day. What You’ll Do AstraZeneca is seeking a scientist to support Translational Medicine efforts in Oncology as a member of the Clinical Proteomics team located in Gaithersburg, MD. The scientist should have experience in mass spectrometry-based proteomics, and will carry out translational studies involving biomarker quantitation from clinical samples (e.g., tumor biopsies) to accelerate clinical development of AZ’s oncology drugs. This position requires an individual with outstanding technical skills and scientific experience as well as excellent communication and collaborative skills. The individual must thrive working in a fast-paced clinical and product development organization to translate fundamental insights using proteomics into targeted therapeutics and biomarker hypotheses that can be tested in clinical trials. The successful candidate is expected to drive the publication of proteomics data in top-tier scientific journals. Develop, validate and implement targeted MS-based proteomics technologies for clinical biomarker studies. Process clinical samples (e.g., FFPE tissue, frozen tissue, plasma) for translational and clinical studies according to SOPs. Responsible for developing assays to generate high-quality PRM data for clinical studies, and collaborate with bioinformatics teams to demonstrate clinical utilities of protein biomarkers. Operate state-of-the-art LC-MS instruments, and ensure high-quality data generation by applying strict QC and routine maintenance. Stay current with the latest technologies to improve the protocols. Analyze data, summarize results, and present key results at functional reviews and project reviews. Essential For The Role PhD in bioanalytical chemistry or related field with 0-5 years post-doctoral experience in mass spectrometry-based proteomics. Candidates with M.S. in bioanalytical chemistry or related field with 4-10 years of post-graduate experience in mass spectrometry-based proteomics will be considered. In-depth understanding of various quantitation technologies including PRM and DIA, and their clinical applications. Experience in targeted proteomics and PRM/SRM assay development for oncology biomarkers. Strong theoretical understanding of protein biochemistry and practical knowledge of bottom-up proteomics. Experience in processing human tissue samples for proteomics analysis. Solid understanding of separation chemistry for protein/peptide analysis with experience of nano-flow HPLC. Extensive experience in instrumentation, trouble shooting, QC, standardization for proteomics workflow and pipeline development. Coding skills (R, Python) for data analysis, and ability to use/evaluate open-source software packages for processing mass spectrometry data. Experience in working independently and collaboratively in a matrixed environment with some experience in project management. Strong written and oral communication skills. jobTitle: Senior Scientist - Drug Substance Global Technical Operations Specialist
jobDescription: Imagine applying your statistical analysis and/or modeling experience in a company that follows science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines. AstraZeneca and the Senior Scientist - Drug Substance Global Technical Operations Specialist position would be an excellent fit for you! At AstraZeneca, we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s outstanding skills with those of people from all over the globe. Our Frederick Manufacturing Center (FMC) is one of 30 production facilities in 18 countries that creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This biologics manufacturing facility makes a direct contribution to treating people with cancer, respiratory and autoimmune conditions across the globe. It’s challenging but highly rewarding work, involves more than 675 talented people throughout the manufacturing lifecycle and supporting office functions. We work hard to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, and we take time to have fun and celebrate our accomplishments. From catered site festivities to competitive events, community outreach activities, environmental and wellness showcases and team-building events, we take time to recognize our achievements. The Senior Scientist plays a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. This position is responsible for Drug Substance related lab experiments within Global Technical Operations in support of global commercial operations and technology transfer activities. This is a lab-based position. What you will do: You will be responsible for conducting or participating in technically fast paced projects within your specific area or field, including the following: Accountable for planning and executing Design of Experiments for multiple projects that are complex and technically challenging for global Drug Substance operations. Manage authoring, review and approval of all technical documents, protocols, SOPs, reports, and the coordination of all lab work necessary to complete commitments on time. Responsible for supporting qualification activities for secondary supplier sites and raw materials and performing data analysis using statistics and multi-variant analysis Supports commercial production and technology transfer of manufacturing processes to commercial facility. Initiates, implements, plans, directs, and executes investigations to resolve deviations, understand process trends, and/or improve process performance. Responsible for writing sections of regulatory documents and representing operations during regulatory inspections as required Minimum Qualifications: Degree in an engineering or scientific field with biopharmaceutical Manufacturing Science and Technology/ late phase development PhD 0-2 years experience OR a Master 3+ years OR a BS 5+ years experience. Previous experience with statistical analysis and/or modeling: JMP, Minitab, SIMCA, and/or Discoverant Knowledge of GMP manufacturing principles and documentation Ability to apply critical thinking to solve problems and work independently Strong interpersonal and communication skills Preferred Qualifications: Drug Substance Commercial and Technology Transfer experience preferred Project management and lean methodology knowledge preferred Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, groundbreaking cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested - Come and join our journey. Next Steps – Apply today So What's Next Are you already imagining yourself joining our team - Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Location: Waltham, MA What Is Happening At AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca, we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the utmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe. We turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being ambitious, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. About AstraZeneca In Waltham, MA The Waltham R&D site focuses on our small-molecule oncology research in North America, and is situated within a biopharma cluster of research institutions, medical centers, pharmaceutical companies and startups. The Boston region is consistently ranked #1 globally for research, investment, talent recruitment and lab space. The campus, also known as the Boston BioHub, is one of the largest and most dynamic life-science research hubs in the region. It is home to more than 800 scientists working in nine different pharmaceutical and biotech companies. The site is also home to the AstraZeneca Incubator, a program that helps emerging companies advance novel and innovative healthcare solutions to meet the needs of patients. Plenty of free parking, with charging stations now available for electric vehicles, and shuttle service to local transportation hubs. This Opportunity Recent years have seen rapid advances in the field of Antibody Drug Conjugates (ADCs). Building on the success of Enhertu, AstraZeneca is determined to become a world leader in this key area of oncology. To succeed in this vision, AstraZeneca is seeking experienced chemists for our Tumor Targeted Delivery chemistry group. Based at AstraZeneca's Waltham laboratories in Massachusetts. You will be an integral part of the medicinal chemistry group working on the rational design of the payloads linkers and conjugation technology for the next generation of ADCs. Typical Accountabilities Multi-step synthesis of linker and drug components for ADCs Works in a team on the rational design of drug-linkers and conjugation technology for our next generation of ADCs. Provides experienced technical input to expand the role of ADCs beyond classical cytotoxic payloads Assists in the implementation of new methodology and technology related to own area of expertise, including training of staff May develop proposals to improve ADC designs or provide expert technical direction and problem solving into drug, science and technology projects Works across regions and skill groups within and outside of own function Impacts on the Therapeutic Area globally by advising others including senior management on project related issues such as design, progress, priorities and resourcing as well as on future strategies Maintains up-to-date knowledge of technical advances in broad area of expertise to potentially benefit or science and therapeutics Communicates scientific and technological developments within assigned area to colleagues at AstraZeneca, with the purpose of increasing general level of competence and industry awareness Ensures work is performed in accordance with appropriate Safety, Health & Environment (SHE), quality and compliance standards, e.g. Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) Essential Requirements Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience PhD in Chemistry Significant experience in a wide range of organic synthetic reactions Theoretical knowledge and long term experience of relevant techniques and technologies Understanding of the process of successful drug discovery/drug development Desirable Experience Understanding of patent and IP strategies Why AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca, any opportunity can be the start of something big. jobTitle: Senior Scientist/Engineer, Process Engineer for Drug Products
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary of the Group: We are seeking a Scientist/Engineer to join the Process Engineering and Packaging team (PEP). The PEP function develops Drug Product (DP) clinical and commercial fill/finish processes, device/combination product assembly processes, and packaging for biopharmaceutical products in the AstraZeneca Biologics portfolio. The Scientist/Engineer is a DP PEP lead in the CMC supporting projects and technologies, performing process development and tech transfer activities, and driving innovation and capability build. This position requires effective collaborative interactions with project team members, internal/external manufacturing sites and suppliers. Prior experience working with pharmaceutical and manufacturing process development are essential. This individual must be able to work effectively in a matrix environment and be able to influence internally and externally. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Process Design and Development: Develop manufacturing processes, specify requirements of manufacturing equipment and support equipment design and build, perform process risk assessments such as FMEA, design characterization and engineering studies, develop control strategies, author protocols, technical reports and regulatory filing sections. Provide technical rigor in design for manufacturing, experimental design, data analysis, and technical writing. Develop pilot laboratory fill-finish process for vial filling and lyophilization. The candidate will work on cross-functional teams to ensure equipment/process capability for process development studies on multiple pipeline projects. Process Characterization: Conduct experiments in development laboratories or manufacturing sites to characterize processes in support of clinical and commercial tech transfers. These studies will be conducted to establish design space of fill-finish unit operations and set the manufacturing control strategy. Regulatory writing responsibilities include supporting clinical and commercial filings. Carry out ongoing academic, regulatory and vendor literature review, maintain cutting edge technical knowledge, and communicate findings to team. Tech Transfer: Lead late-stage and commercial technical transfer of fill-finish processes to CMOs and internal manufacturing facilities for biopharmaceutical drug products. Support engineering and clinical fills at manufacturing sites. Provide on-site support of fills, provide support to investigations. Ensure correct implementation of control strategies for the drug product into manufacturing records. Design and oversee validation activities for the drug product manufacturing processes. Manage timelines and activities internally, communicate goals and oversee successful delivery at the receiving site. Sound technical writing skills and interpersonal communication are required. Some travel is required (typically 1-5 trips per year) in the US and abroad. Leadership: Contribute strategic thinking to drug product development teams by providing knowledgeable advice on design for manufacturing, equipment vendor selection, manufacturing site selection / alternatives, project lead time and budget estimates. Advise functions and teams on new manufacturing technology selection and development. Develop risk-based characterization and validation strategies for manufacturing processes. Propose general working strategies and risk-based project strategies that meet requirements of design control, product quality, cGMP, as well as timeline and budget constraints. Research and design small scale comparability studies and template technology transfer processes. Education & Experience Requirements: Educational requirements include a degree in mechanical, chemical, or pharmaceutical engineering, chemistry, materials science, or a related engineering or pharmaceutical science field. Typical candidates will have a PhD 0-3 years or MS with at least 8 years, or BS plus 10 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry as appropriate (biotechnology area preferred). Required Skills: The candidate should have capability, skill and/or knowledge in most of the following areas: Protein degradation pathways and mechanisms Biopharmaceutical drug product development Knowledge of formulation and fill-finish unit operations such as freeze-thaw, formulation, mixing, filtration, asceptic filling Strong knowledge of lyophilization technology and scale-up principles QbD, experimental design, statistics, data analysis and modeling Technical writing and documentation cGMP, aseptic processing, and related regulatory literature Ability to handle multiple ongoing work streams in an organized fashion Leadership and interpersonal communication skills Experience: Suitable experience may include development of fill-finish and/or associated manufacturing processes. Tech transfer experience or experience organizing and leading cross-functional teams is required. A high degree of self-motivation, scientific strength and technical rigor is required. Experience working with biologics (mAbs, bispecifics, fusion proteins, enzymes, antibody-drug conjugates etc.) preferred. Strong communication and technical writing skills are essential. Experience participating in cross-functional teams is valuable. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. Where can I find out more? jobTitle: Senior Scientist - Hematological Cancers, Oncology BioScience
jobDescription: Senior Scientist Hematological Cancers, Oncology Bioscience - Waltham, MA Multiple positions open! We are seeking highly motivated molecular/cellular biologist to join the Hematology Discovery group in Waltham as an in vitro lab-based Senior Scientist. This individual will be responsible for identifying and validating new hematological targets, characterizing novel ex vivo cell models, exploring drug mechanism of action, and understanding target biology. These efforts will contribute to the identification of and build confidence in clinical drug candidates though the generation of compelling preclinical data packages. This is an opportunity to participate in a wide range of drug discovery projects and collaborate with scientists across multiple disciplines. About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AZ, we’re proud to have an exceptional workplace culture that encourages innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives – and made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. AZ is a place where passionate people can immerse themselves in their work and make significant contributions to scientific excellence and medicines – does this describe a place where you would like to work? We are seeking a candidate with passion to apply their expertise to deliver life-changing medicines to patients. The successful applicant is expected to have good understanding of a range of procedures related to antibody identification and development. In this role, the Scientist will complete laboratory experiments, develop methods, generate, interpret, and report scientific data. They will work within an interactive team of experts to support and advance pipeline programs in various therapeutic areas. What you'll do: Grow and characterize ex vivo Haematological models Design and execution of in vitro studies to support the characterization and development of candidate molecules Assist in CRISPR screens and validation of hits Analyse data and maintain clear experimental records Adept at managing multiple priorities in an efficient and organized manner Organize and clearly present experimental results to project teams Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience: Master’s degree with 3+ years’ experience or PHD; industry experience preferred. Familiarity with multiple assay platforms and technologies: proper culturing of suspension cells, flow cytometry, high throughput proliferation and apoptosis assays, CRISPR cell line generation, western blot, Q-PCR, Experience with haematological cancers and in vitro assays required Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big! Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. Site Description: Our Waltham, Massachusetts facility develops life changing small-molecule research in North America, with innovative laboratories at the Gatehouse Park Bio Hub, just west of the city center. Our BioHub facility, is a bold new R&D initiative, which fosters life science discoveries and the exchange of ideas. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. With a shuttle bus to and from Alewife station, the location provides you the ability to work in the heart of one of the world’s most vibrant research centers. Our Waltham site offers a variety of amenities to help book productivity and help keep our employees happy and engaged. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams and the greater research community. So, what’s next? A place built on courage, curiosity, and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take calculated risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and passionate about the possibilities, then we are keen to hear from you! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Next steps: Apply today, or connect with our Talent Acquisition Partner – Kayla Harris: https://www.linkedin.com/in/kayla-harris-8723ab13b/ for a confidential discussion to explore this opportunity further. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

jobTitle: Senior Scientist - In vitro, Bioscience Cardiovascular
jobDescription: Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees stay happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. About Our Group: In the Bioscience Cardiovascular department within Early CVRM, we focus on identifying and validating new drug targets for patients with cardiovascular disease and heart failure as well as evaluating pharmacological aspects, e.g. efficacy and mechanism of action, of new compounds crafted to hit these targets. The team delivers key data to projects across all phases of the drug discovery and development, and we work with different modalities such as stem cells, AAV, antibodies, small molecules, modified mRNA, antisense oligonucleotides and peptides. Main Duties & Responsibilities We are seeking a skilled and highly motivated Senior Scientist to enhance our in vitro capabilities in cardiovascular disease. Conducts routine cell culture experiments independently by applying molecular and cellular biology techniques. Conducts hands-on primary cell culturing, and cell functional assays. Able to manipulate and characterize primary cells and cell lines. Contributes to the experiment plans and designs, communicates the results to team members and is involved in the interpretation of data. Supports drug project teams and works collaboratively with project managers to ensure the efficient relay of information and forward translation of data. Assesses and reports data, with little or no guidance, in a clear and concise manner, with a clear understanding of its implications within the overall context of drug discovery. Communicates and shares information between distinct projects within the bioscience function and across other functions. Ensures own work, and work of peers, is compliant with Good Laboratory Practice, Safety, Health and Environment standards and all other relevant internal AstraZeneca standards and external regulations. Required Skills Proficient in culturing and manipulating human primary cells and cell lines Proficient in trouble shooting and theory. Well-developed understanding and expertise in molecular and cellular biology of cardiovascular relevant cells, design and performing functional and image-based assays, cell transfection/ transduction. Excellent team player with good interpersonal skills. Desired Skills Good communication and networking skills In vitro and cell-based assay development skills Education and Experience Senior Scientist: BS and 10+ years or MS and 8+ years of relevant experience, or a PhD or equivalent and/or professional certifications with 0-3 years of post-doctoral training, preferentially in cardiovascular disease area. Senior Scientist, In Vivo Oncology- Waltham, MA Do you have expertise in, and a passion for in vivo biology? Would you like to apply your expertise in Biology in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? AstraZeneca might be the one for you! About AstraZeneca AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AZ, we’re proud to have an exceptional workplace culture that encourages innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives – and made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. AZ is a place where passionate people can immerse themselves in their work and make significant contributions to scientific excellence and medicines – does this describe a place where you would like to work? At AstraZeneca Oncology R&D, we are not afraid to do things differently. Our vision is redefining cancer, redefining our solutions to cancer and restoring patients' lives. In this role, you will join a dynamic and collaborative in vivo biology team in our state-of-the-art Biohub facility in Waltham, MA. The primary responsibilities of this position are to build and characterize hematologic in vivo animal cancer models, conduct PKPD and efficacy studies to support our heme R&D portfolio. What you'll do: Leverage in vivo knowledge and hands-on technical skills to support our oncology platform by: Developing, characterizing and working with various in vivo models of hematologic including subcutaneous xenograft models, disseminated models, patient-derived xenograft (PDX) models and humanized models. Conducting in vivo pharmacology studies (i.e. tolerability, PKPD, and efficacy) and delivering comprehensive in vivo pharmacology data packages to support heme drug discovery programs. Profiling of tissue samples to explore mechanisms of drug response and resistance using both traditional and novel approaches. Support in vivo target validation across various heme indications. Demonstrate proficiency and flexibility in working with various programs and databases to capture all study data for broad access by project teams and stakeholders. Work collaboratively across disciplines to develop and implement aggressive work plans and timelines. Bring in new technologies and approaches to improve or replace existing disease model platforms to better predict clinical response. Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience: Requirements: Bachelor's Degree with 4+ years hands-on in vivo experience or Master's Degree in biology, pharmacology, or related field with 2+ years hands-on in vivo experience, preferably in industry. Demonstrated experience generating and working with disseminated rodent hematologic disease models including luc-tagged models. Ability to work both independently as well as within project teams and across disciplines. Ability to still lead from the bench in problem solving and in the development of innovative solutions. Excellent communication, organizational and listening skills. Hands-on expertise conducting (spectral) flow cytometry on rodent blood and tissues and/or patient samples. Ability to analyze biomarkers in blood and tissue samples using techniques such as Western blot, ELISA- and/or MSD-based platforms. Experience using small animal imaging modalities such as bioluminescence imaging. Why AstraZeneca? jobTitle: Senior Scientist, In Vivo, Oncology Research
jobDescription: Gaithersburg, MD, US At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being daring, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re passionate about the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we believe we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new insights to life. AstraZeneca’s vision in Oncology is to push the boundaries of science to change the practice of medicine, transform the lives of patients living with cancer, and to ultimately eliminate cancer as a cause of death. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. We are seeking highly motivated Senior Scientists in Immuno-Oncology with scientific and technical expertise in highly developed and adaptive immune cell biology with a track record of scientific achievement to join our team in Gaithersburg, US. As a Senior Scientist you will be a key member of a team focused on supporting immune-oncology projects through the drug discovery process. You will bring your theoretical and practical expertise in immunology to establish assay systems and deliver datasets that will have direct impact on immune-oncology research projects. Main Duties And Responsibilities AstraZeneca seeks an innovative and highly motivated Senior Scientist with a background in immunology or a related field to join the Early Discovery Oncology Bioscience team in Gaithersburg, MD. As a Senior Scientist you will be a key member of a team focused on supporting Immuno-Oncology projects through the drug discovery process. You will bring your expertise in Immunology to establish assay systems and deliver datasets that will have direct impact on pipeline programs. Working in this laboratory-based position within the Immuno-Oncology Research group you will develop, conduct and analyze experiments to assess the function of our candidate drugs. You will design novel therapeutics targeting the immune system for cancer therapy and help to dissect their mechanism of action. You will be encouraged to support cross-functional teams and work collaboratively with colleagues to ensure the timely generation and dissemination of critical program data. You will also review emerging literature and internal data to help in identifying new potential targets and give to target validation activities. A proven foundation in immunology and/or oncology, and experience in different in vivo mouse models (including humanized mouse models) for the assessment of immune cell function is essential for this role. As a highly organized, self-motivated individual with a strong lab/practical background you will stay up to date with relevant techniques and have a genuine passion for this field of research. The position requires strong interest in experimental work and ability to work in a fast-paced matrix structured work environment. Essential Requirements A PhD, or equivalent experience, in immunology and/or immuno-oncology, with 0-6 years of post-doctoral experience in a relevant research area. Validated experience is a plus but not required. Strong background in immunology and experience with performing standard in vitro assays (immune cell activation, cytotoxic assays, etc) and use of in vivo mouse models. Experience with ex vivo PD assessment assays (basic biochemical and immunological methods including cell culture, multi-color flow cytometry, ELISA/multiplex assays) Ability to independently craft and complete research plans for one or more programs, and to review, analyze, and interpret experimental results Ability to draft, implement and record protocols and experiments in a timely manner and maintain an excellent laboratory notebook Strong interpersonal, influencing, negotiating and collaboration skills together with evidence of having used these to support problem solving and delivery in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Experience preparing written scientific reports (e.g. manuscripts) and oral presentations (e.g. slides, posters). Desirable Requirements We would encourage applications from candidates who have experience in the evaluation of immune function and in the application of sophisticated immunological assays Post-doctoral training is preferred Working as a member of cross-functional teams, with a large degree of independence representing own department or area of expertise Experience working with patient-derived tumors and/or tumor infiltrating T cells is an advantage Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being daring - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, groundbreaking innovative methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you already encouraging yourself joining our team? Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Where can I find out more? We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. AstraZeneca has an opportunity for a Senior Scientist position within the Bioscience Metabolism group of the Early Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism department (eCVRM). The successful candidate should have extensive hands-on in vivo pharmacology experience in rodent models of diabetes, obesity and NASH as well as comprehensive scientific background knowledge in metabolic and liver disease. Expertise in working with a variety of drug modalities would be a plus, and ex vivo lab techniques including tissue gene expression, ELISAs, western blot analysis etc. is required. The successful candidate will drive experimental work, including the design, execution and interpretation of preclinical experimental data. Additionally, the candidate will present results to group and project team meetings, and potentially at scientific conferences. The ability to work well in a team environment, and to interact with departments outside of eCVRM is essential for this position. What You'll Do: Drive experimental work, including the design, execution and interpretation of preclinical experimental data. Prepare and present scientific data to in vivo group and project team meetings. Work in a cross-functional project team with responsibility of making decisions and recommendations for program in vivo pharmacology plans. Maintain an understanding of the scientific basis of the eCVRM project pipeline, with sufficient ability to successfully execute experiments needed to meet the requirements of the projects involved with. Participate in collaborations related to specific projects. Raise the scientific profile of CVRM externally through publishing data in peer reviewed journals and by presenting at conferences. Contribute to CVRM animal model work and/or development including areas of NASH, obesity, dyslipidemia, CV and diabetic kidney disease. Independently execute ex vivo analysis of blood/tissue samples including qPCR gene expression, Western blots, and ELISAs. Take part in all experimental work, including the design, analysis and interpretation of data from these experiments. Lead drug projects in metabolism disease area. Propose and champion new targets and novel approaches for disease treatment. Execution of metabolism in vivo assays including GTTs, ITTs, and measurement food intake. Additionally, the candidate will present results to group and project team meetings, and potentially at scientific conferences. Essential For the Role: Degree in a biological science field PhD and 3+ years of relevant experience (preferred), or MS and 10+ years of relevant experience or BS and 13+ years of relevant experience The successful candidate should have extensive hands-on in vivo pharmacology experience in rodent models of diabetes, obesity and NASH as well as comprehensive scientific background knowledge in metabolic and liver disease. Expertise in working with a variety of drug modalities would be a plus, and ex vivo lab techniques including tissue gene expression, ELISAs, western blot analysis etc. The ability to work well in a team environment, and to interact with departments outside of eCVRM is essential for this position. Highly proficient in working with rodent models of NASH, diabetes and obesity – hands on expertise in animal handling, dosing (SC, IV, PO and IM), and necropsy tissue collections. Desirable for the Role: Experience in surgical procedures desirable Experience in pharmaceutical industry desirable

Gaithersburg, MD At AstraZeneca we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s exceptional skills with those of people from all over the globe. As a part of our Imaging Center for Excellence team in Gaithersburg, MD, you will play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives. About AstraZeneca In Gaithersburg, MD Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D (Research & Development) and Oncology in the US (UNITED STATES). Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria, and copy center. This is where you will find newly designed, activity-based workspaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. Summary Of The Group The Imaging Center for Excellence is part of Dynamic Omics, which is part of the Centre of Genomics Research (CGR) in Discovery Sciences within AstraZeneca and works across all therapeutic areas. The team delivers key data to projects across all phases of drug discovery and development, and we work with all modalities from small molecules to biologics. As a member of the expanding Dynamic Omics department, you will be actively involved in analyzing preclinical and clinical samples using advanced imaging modalities and image analysis. Main Duties and Responsibilities: This role will be the primary resource for our Oncology users, for application of cutting edge, different modalities of fluorescence microscopy and image analysis solutions as well as tissue imaging activities involving live animals, live cells, fixed samples, or dynamic cell culture systems. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work and grow in a fast-paced environment under the supervision of senior staff members. Assist scientists with data collection, data analysis and image processing. Serve all non-clinical research programs by contributing to target and biomarker identification, and drug mechanism(s) of action for early development programs. Support early translational aspects of drug and biomarker development with research personnel. Contribute independently to project teams and multitask effectively. Prepare precise technical reports, summaries, protocols, quantitative analyses and contribute to preparation of manuscripts and/or patent applications. Identify opportunities for process improvement initiatives. Education & Experience Requirements: Education: Master's Degree in Engineering, Biology, Computer Science or other relevant field with 8+ years of experience OR PhD in Engineering, Biology, Computer Science or other relevant field. We will consider PhDs with no post-doctoral experience; however, 2-3 years of post-doctoral experience is strongly preferred, Required Skills: Expert in advanced quantitative microscopy techniques, particularly confocal. Operate instruments, design experiments, analyze data, interpret experimental results, and summarize data for presentations and reports with accountability for accuracy. Strong scientific background in the use of microscopy to solve problems in cellular biology as evidenced through a good publication record. Experience in image analysis. Excellent team player with strong collaboration and communication skills, both verbal and written. Should have “customer facing willingness” as will interface with many groups within and outside of oncology. Strong multi-tasking, time management and organizational skills. Desired Skills: Experience with TIRF (Total Internal Reflectance Fluorescence), super resolution microscopy, spinning disc confocal microscopy or laser microdissection. Experience in programming, preferably with a background in Python. Experience with working in a matrix organization. Experience with Imaris, Arivis and Nikon Elements software. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity, no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we are opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it is yours. Where can I find out more? Gaithersburg, MD, US AstraZeneca has an opening for a Senior Scientist in the Protein Sciences group within the Biologics Engineering Department to support pre-clinical research of innovative therapeutic products. An expertise in core and innovative molecular biology techniques is critical. Do you have expertise in, and passion for, Molecular Biology and Protein Engineering? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact on programs in Cancer, Respiratory and Immunology, Cardiovascular, Metabolic Disease and Infectious Disease in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Biologics Engineering is a science-led authority function of people with curious minds that supports the discovery and engineering of novel biomolecules. We are passionate about collaboration and innovation and strive to develop powerful technologies that help create the next generation of bio-therapeutics to improve patients’ lives. What You’ll Do We are seeking a highly motivated and independent Senior Scientist to initiate, direct, and perform research experiments and develop next generation technologies for molecular biology, cell line engineering, and protein chemistry. In this role, you will work within an interactive team of authorities to support programs in Cancer, Respiratory and Immunology, Cardiovascular, Metabolic Disease and Infectious Disease. Your ability to work with a cross-functional team of scientists to meet timelines and drive innovation will be crucial. You should be confident in your ability to multi-task and quickly adjust to changes in priorities and timelines. Essential For The Role Education and work history: A Ph.D. with 2+years of experience, or an MS with 8-10 years of demonstrated ability in molecular biology, biotechnology, or cell biology. Extensive and current hands-on experience in a wide variety of techniques, including cloning, CRISPR, RT-qPCR, DNA sequence analysis, epigenetic analysis, next-generation sequencing applications, and mammalian cell culture is required. Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. About AstraZeneca in Waltham, MA: The Waltham R&D site focuses on oncology research in North America, and is situated within a biopharma cluster of research institutions, medical centers, pharmaceutical companies and startups. The Boston region is consistently ranked #1 globally for research, investment, talent recruitment and lab space. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to encourage collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to crafting a culture of inclusion and partnership. The Waltham site offers a variety of amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, full-service cafeteria, beach volleyball court, hiking trails and plenty of free parking, with charging stations now available for electric vehicles, and a shuttle service to local transportation hubs. The campus, also known as the Boston BioHub, is one of the largest and most dynamic life-science research hubs in the region. It is home to more than 800 scientists working in nine different pharmaceutical and biotech companies. The site is also home to the AstraZeneca Incubator, a program that helps emerging companies advance novel and innovative healthcare solutions to meet the needs of patients. Summary of the group: Pharmaceutical Sciences is a department within AstraZeneca Biopharmaceuticals R&D with a mission to transform molecules into investigational medicines, meeting the unmet needs of future patients. Advanced Drug Delivery is a department within Pharmaceutical Sciences. Our portfolio of projects spans traditional small molecules, peptides, oligonucleotides to RNA-based therapeutics across AstraZeneca's therapy areas and our mission is to transform diverse modalities into investigational medicines. We are looking for a highly motivated Senior Scientist to join our Pharmaceutical Sciences team in Waltham, MA. In this role you will work closely with biologists, chemists and pharmacokinetic scientists at the forefront of drug discovery. You will be responsible for the preformulation assessment of small molecules and for the design and evaluation of formulations for non-clinical pharmacology studies. Furthermore, you will be actively involved in the design and selection of candidate drugs that have the potential to become life changing medicines. You will be collaborating with other small-molecule preformulation teams in Cambridge, UK & Gothenburg, Sweden. Main Duties & Responsibilities: Serve as the Pharmaceutical Technical Lead (PTL) on Drug Discovery and Early Global Project Teams Lead developability and preformulation assessment of new chemical entities (NCEs) Formulate NCEs using standard and enabling technologies (e.g. lipid delivery systems, amorphous solid dispersions) for non-clinical studies Plan and lead lab-based experimental work in accordance with project timelines Keep up to date with the scientific literature and proactively apply existing and novel approaches to projects Contribute to internal and external publications, posters, conference presentations as well as participate in local and global workstreams Education & Experience Requirements: Education: Master's degree or PhD in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences or a related field Experience: M.S. and 4+ years of relevant experience or PhD and 0+ years of relevant experience Required Skills: Practical experience in formulations selection including solubility enabling formulations Practical experience of analytical method development across a range of techniques including chromatography and mass spectrometry Strong technical knowledge of physicochemical and solid-state properties and their relationship to drug product design and performance Strong record of scientific excellence evidenced by publications, patents and presentations Detailed understanding of principles, applications and management of Safety, Health and Environment (SHE) Ability to handle several projects at the same time, using initiative and creativity to meet agreed objectives and timelines Desired Skills: Proven track record of problem solving and demonstrated excellent practical laboratory skills Knowledge of biopharmaceutics and pharmacokinetic concepts Good team working, communication and networking skills and an ability to engage relevant AstraZeneca staff in new initiatives Ability to mentor peers for enhanced individual and team performance and development Able to demonstrate the drive and energy to establish the role and make a difference Focus on delivery under pressure Why AstraZeneca? Summary Of The Group Biologics Engineering is responsible for the discovery, design, engineering, and optimization of next generation biologics to create biological drug candidates against diseases with improved safety and efficacy. The Multi-specific Engineering Team designs, engineers, and optimizes complex therapeutics through structure-function principles while collaborating broadly across the AZ Research organization. We're constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, with a passion for the development of in-house biologics discovery platforms and novel drug modalities to address unmet medical needs. Main Duties & Responsibilities Seeking a skilled and highly motivated scientist to enhance our antibody-based platform technology efforts. The successful candidate will be excited by research at the interface where innovative technology meets Biology. Lead collaborative workstreams with a diverse group of scientists across all therapeutic areas to ensure timely progress in research projects and drive technological innovations. Conceive, design, and execute the engineering of innovative multispecific antibodies with improved selectivity and developability Biochemical, biophysical and functional characterization of antibodies and multispecific modalities Prepare, analyze, and present data internally and externally Education & Experience Requirements PhD in Biotechnology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or other relevant scientific field with 2+ years of post-doctoral experience in antibody engineering and/or bispecific antibody technologies Required Skills Extensive hands-on experience in molecular biology and antibody engineering, including; design, expression, purification and biochemical/biophysical characterization of various bispecific antibody formats Proven ability to work independently, effectively plan and organize work activities and prioritize task completion to meet project deadlines Deep understanding of various imaging/multicolor flow cytometry-based instruments and data analysis programs Comprehensive experience in tissue culture techniques and functional cell-based assay development Demonstrated experience in optimizing/troubleshooting protocols with a problem-solving mindset Track record of scientific innovation as evidenced by scientific publications, patents and oral presentations at conferences Desired Skills Understanding of protein structure-function relationships and antibody structural remodeling Experience in engineering antibodies with improved properties (e.g., affinity, solubility, and other attributes related to developability) Background in antibody discovery using one of several display-based technologies Working knowledge of automation and high-throughput screening from bacterial or mammalian expression systems Experience in immunocytokine and T-cell engager Excellent written and verbal communication skills and effective presentation of complex scientific data to cross-functional and senior management About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world.
