jobTitle: US Oncology Training, Program Manager Specialized Markets
jobDescription: Oncology Training & Development, Program Manager, Specialized Role Training At AstraZeneca, embrace the varied opportunities, in a globally connected team, to work on intellectually stimulating challenges and gain transferable skills. We’re invested in supporting your development with access to great tools, smart people to learn from, and the opportunity to experience multiple careers. And you’ll be rewarded for your progression and contribution to the business. Play a role in powering AstraZeneca and helping all of us to fulfill our ambitions. As valued partners across the enterprise, we provide the platform for excellence and performance to happen. We draw on our network of diverse minds, harnessing our unique views and ideas to improve how we run. It means every day we power ourselves and others to focus on important and impactful work. The AZ Gaithersburg campus is located in Montgomery County, Maryland, a suburb of Washington, D.C. While Gaithersburg is part of a regional high technology corridor, the city has preserved its small-town appeal with smart urban development and planned communities like Kentlands and Lakelands (across the street from the core campus), and Crown Farm, all of which are walkable communities serviced by an array of public transportation options. Part of this thriving community, the Gaithersburg campus is surrounded by residential neighborhoods, schools, retail, and restaurants, and is easily accessible with a variety of transportation options. AstraZeneca is at home in this Sustainable Maryland Certified City and shares Gaithersburg's commitment to environmental stewardship. The site offers options that simplify and facilitate sustainable transportation choices, making it easier for our employees and visitors to reach the campus and its surroundings. Gaithersburg is served by three large airports and is accessible to the Washington Area Metro system which includes rail and bus services. What You’ll Do The Program Manager provides end-to-end support for an assigned Therapeutic Area (TA) or Capability focused team within the Oncology Training & Development team. This position will serve as a strategic partner for the team’s daily operations by providing forward-thinking, user-focused processes, and technology solutions that ensure an optimal user experience. Primary duties include project management, training evaluation, and reporting, identifying budget effectiveness strategies, program logistics, as well as organizational development. The Program Manager will provide strategic planning and training solutions that better the business and ensure best-in-class training programs are implemented across the AZ commercial field-based teams as aligned to business needs. Essential responsibilities of the role will include: Creates and implements learning and development experiences, partnering with stakeholders to build a high-performing organization. Ensures training programs support the evolving needs of the business and address new initiatives with an emphasis on current trends and practices. Supports the development and implementation of a comprehensive training curriculum that aligns with core competencies supporting the overall TA or Capability-focused strategy. Provides project management expertise for the Training teams by identifying and tracking milestones, anticipating and managing program risks, informing key stakeholders of status and issues, coordinating and facilitating functional meetings and communications, and ensuring central access to key planning documents and materials. Captures best practices and insights from other teams within OTD as well as external partners in an effort to optimize and improve the impact of our learning programs. Leads training content asset management for assigned team and the knowledge management of those materials in the OTD master repository. Serves as LMS lead administrator for assigned team. Works closely with vendors during the creation of training materials to ensure all curricula are properly developed and maintained as per AZ policies and guidelines. Collaborates with key cross-functional partners to ensure training strategy and plan are aligned to business goals, objectives, and strategies. Conducts ongoing needs assessment and recommendations on gaps and innovations to be considered by the training teams. Leads post-training event sustainment practices to include evaluations and assessments against identified objectives and is responsible for the report back to the business with clear recommendations on sustainment requirements. Essential For The Role 5 years of Project Management experience Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent 3+ years of Pharmaceutical or Biotech experience Minimum of at least 1 accumulated year of training or training-related experience, or key account management experience Desirable for the role Advanced degree in industrial organizational psychology, MBA, or a related field Knowledge of instructional systems design preferred Experience with TA subject matter knowledge and/or application within Oncology Experience in global markets preferred Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next! If you’re curious to know more then please reach out to Michael Fulginiti (Michael.fulginiti@astrazeneca.com). We welcome with your application! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca

jobTitle: US Senior Medical Director - Respiratory Inhaled - Asthma
jobDescription: AstraZeneca has an exciting opportunity available for a US Sr. Medical Director - Respiratory Inhaled - Asthma to join our BioPharmaceuticals Medical team at our Wilmington, DE location. Here, we take a holistic approach to patients, going beyond just medicines to address and transform the patient experience. This new generation of medical leader will have the opportunity to work along the whole patient journey – from prevention, to better diagnosis. Only then can we help to realise the genuinely transformative potential of our science. AstraZeneca holds a unique position in respiratory disease, including asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), with a range of differentiated potential medicines in development based on novel combinations, biologics, and devices. The Sr. Medical Director is a key member of the Core Medical Team (CMT), a physician who has a history of clinical practice and investigative work, and has significant experience in the respiratory therapeutic area. The Sr. Medical Director is knowledgeable of the actions of regulatory bodies, in particular FDA, and has experience in clinical trials and the pharmaceutical industry. An ideal candidate should have significant experience in respiratory disease management and would thrive on proactively engaging internal and external leaders. S/he is accountable for the development and execution of the Brand Medical Plans. It is preferred that the candidate will have a network of Allergist and Pulmonologist External Experts and/or thought leaders in primary care and Professional Society relationships. In addition, an ideal Sr. Medical Director will have strong business, healthcare system, and policy aptitude and/or experience, including proven ability to translate and align commercial and scientific goals and objectives. What you'll do: Lead the brand strategy as a core member of Core Medical Team (CMT) Provide medical input into the review of promotional materials and assets Interact with external leaders in the therapy area (External Experts, Academic Institutions, Professional Societies) Play an integral role in the planning and participation of national and regional medical advisory boards Play an integral role in the planning and providing of training for external medical/scientific speakers Provide clinical education and training for internal stakeholders such as Field Medical Team Provide input into Life Cycle Management studies and Phase 4 Study strategy/design Provide medical review in concert with cross functional team members for Externally Sponsored Scientific Research proposals Provide medical input into the publication strategy and review/comment for medical accuracy of publications Supply medical input into safety profile of the product in collaboration with Patient Safety (PS) physicians Ensure compliance with all AZ corporate policies Collaborate with field team to ensure comprehensive engagement plan with external stakeholders, e.g., Managed Care Organizations, External Scientific Experts, Prioritized Institutions and Hospital Systems, Professional Societies Collaborate with Payer and Evidence Strategy Directors to define research strategy and design of studies that address both clinical effectiveness and health Essential Requirements: Graduate of a recognized medical school and recipient of an MD/DO degree 5 years experience in medical or clinical setting Industry experience in Medical or Clinical Development Background in academic medicine, clinical research, and familiarity with biostatistics and epidemiology Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal, and organization skills Ability to travel nationally and internationally. Travel will be :30% of time Highest level of ethics and integrity Desirable: Board certification/eligibility preferred in Internal Medicine, Pulmonology, Allergy or related relevant specialty Strong business acumen, including working knowledge of U.S. payer and provider landscape Proven ability to interact productively with both commercial and scientific colleagues Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross functional teams Familiarity with OPDP, PhRMA code, and key regulations in the pharmaceutical industry Pharmaceutical industry experience or other experience in related areas including academic institutions Experience developing and/or launching a new pharmaceutical product/biologic product Working knowledge of FDA requirements Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

At AstraZeneca, we work together across global boundaries to make an impact and find answers to challenges. We do this with the upmost integrity even in the most difficult situations because we are committed to doing the right thing. We continuously forge partnerships that help pursue world-class medicines in new ways, combining our people’s outstanding skills with those of people from all over the globe. Our Frederick Manufacturing Center (FMC) is one of 30 production facilities in 18 countries that creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This biologics manufacturing facility makes a direct contribution to treating people with cancer, respiratory and autoimmune conditions across the globe. It’s ambitious but highly rewarding work, involves more than 675 hardworking people throughout the manufacturing lifecycle and supporting office functions. We work hard to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, and we take time to have fun and celebrate our accomplishments. From catered site festivities to competitive events, community outreach activities, environmental and wellness showcases and team-building events, we take time to recognize our achievements. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. We are committed to continuous learning and offer ongoing skill building and training for our staff and encourage additional secondary schooling with tuition reimbursement of 100% up to $10,000 each year. The FMC is also an award-winning employer and has been recognized as a ‘Top 50’ Business in Frederick and awarded Frederick County’s ‘Best Place to Work’ distinction in 2015 and 2019. Come join our award-wining team and support the manufacture of life-changing medicines for patients across the world. As a Validation Associate Scientist I/Engineer, you are expected to provide technical solutions to a wide range of critical issues in compliance with organizational objectives. As such you should have a complete understanding and be responsible for a wide application of technical principles, theories, and concepts in the field of Validation. Represent the organization by providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects. You are a member within a highly motivated team responsible for ensuring maintenance of compliance and supporting commercial biologics manufacturing under current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and Good Documentation Practices (GDP) environment. What you’ll do: Write, approve and execute validation protocols, generate reports, regulatory submissions, and audit responses Lead and Provide Technical Expertise on validation activities described in validation protocols including thermal studies, cleaning, shipping, computer systems, equipment and utilities qualification and/or validation Responsibilities include scheduling, forecasting project requirements, and preparation of validation master plans. Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of validation requirements, practices, and procedures Interact with cross-functional stakeholders to facilitate project/protocol execution as necessary. Provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Write validation master plans related to specific projects and coordinate project meetings related to execution of the validation master plan Write validation site specific and multi-site procedures, guidelines and gap assessments and governance documents Support implementation of change requests and resolution of process deviations through technical knowledge, execution of supporting validation studies, and manufacturing documentation review and approval Implement standard work and lean processes within area of responsibility Able to read P&ID, Isometric and “As Built” drawings Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Technical field 5-7 years’ experience in any area of Validation Experience in any of the following; cleaning validation, shipping validation, computer systems validation, Facility, equipment, and/or utility validation Preferred Qualifications: Experience performing, commissioning verification, IQ/OQ/PQ studies on large facility equipment and automated systems Autoclave and/or vessel SIP validation FAT and SAT experience with large equipment/automated systems Project management experience associated with facilities upgrades and major construction projects A questioning attitude and drive to develop solutions to complex problems requiring ingenuity and creativity/innovation is key. Validation Manager - Operations - Redwood City, CA Would you like to work in a fast-paced team environment in a company that follows science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines? Are you searching for career growth and development in a quality environment with competitive salaries and benefits? If so, this position would be a great fit for you! We are driven by our commitment to deliver accelerated growth for AstraZeneca and to make people’s lives better. It pushes us to keep building on our foundations and progressing as we turn our ever-growing and increasingly complex pipeline from molecule to medicine. Be part of evolving how we work with Lean, cutting-edge science, digitalization, and sustainable practices. AstraZeneca is at an exciting time of new products and launches. We get to work with innovative and scientific products on our leading-edge end-to-end supply chain, using the latest technologies and modern facilities. In 2013, AstraZeneca acquired Pearl to expand and strengthen its respiratory products portfolio, We have made strides in bringing therapies to asthma patients. Our mission and vision are to develop differentiated therapeutics for widely prevalent respiratory disease conditions, including chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), by using a proprietary drug delivery platform and existing therapeutic agents administered in metered-dose inhalers (MDIs). Join us as a Validation Manager at our Redwood City, CA site, the leading center of innovation in the West. The Validation Manager provides technical and analytical support to colleagues and carries out activities independently. Manages the Validation Department and manages the design, administration, coordination, documentation and performance of facility, utility, equipment, process, cleaning, automation and computer system validation activities. What you'll do: Develops, administers and improves Validation and Commissioning programs for the Redwood City site. Responsible for communication with related regulatory agencies and participates in compliance audits and inspections Ensures facility planning, permitting, construction, renovations or expansions are implemented in a compliant manner. Works collaboratively with key partners to supervise risk assessments and ensure new products/process/equipment are introduced to the facility in a compliant manner. Oversees Commissioning, Validation, and Qualification. Primary contact for start-up activities including Commissioning, validation, and qualification. Participate in internal and external compliance audits regularly. Works with staff and management to correct identified deficiencies. Responsible for maintaining required records and crafting a new engineering documentation system. Plan, review, and manage allocation of resources and budget. Interact and manage vendors, and consultants for Commissioning, Val, and Compliance related activities. Is responsible for delivery of outputs for Commissioning, Validation, and compliance functions. Advises new initiatives and improvement programs aimed at ensuring compliance, continuous improvement, technical excellence and improving cost-effectiveness. Coaches and develops professional aspects of all team members. Develops senior level contacts within AZ to resolve issues, optimize business performance and develop future improvement opportunities. Builds value through others by leading, managing and developing team members to a shared defined standard for validation Business Process Owner for key AZ objectives such as data integrity, validation or other Quality system components, as needed Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required Significant pharmaceutical manufacturing experience Safety, Health and Environment, Good Manufacturing Practice and regulatory management knowledge, Lean manufacturing principles, understanding and experience Preferred Qualifications: VEEVA system experience Knowledge and understanding of validation and qualification principles, project management, SAP and CMX Why AstraZeneca At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. jobTitle: Value Strategies Lead – Oncology, across brand (Secondment or Fixed-Term Contract until December 2023)
jobDescription: Be part of fulfilling our ambition to be world leaders in Oncology. We are the fastest growing team within AstraZeneca and across the industry, and there are countless new indications and targets in our game-changing pipeline. We deliver this value through launch excellence, commercial effectiveness and maximising the lifecycle. By leveraging our commercialised portfolio we are confident we can change the practice of medicine and redefine cancer treatment. The Value Strategies Lead is an integral member of the Global Oncology Market Access and Pricing team. In this role, you are responsible for developing and driving implementation of novel value strategies that enhance access, including usage of outcomes based agreements in collaboration with country access teams. As such, you will demonstrate not only outstanding methodological and scientific skills but also strategic thinking and innovative approaches to adapt to a quickly changing payer landscape as well as the development of exciting new science and technologies. You will also support teams across AZ oncology market access, globally and locally, in advancing the enablers of such value strategies, including access to the requisite real world data, and payer engagement/policy-shaping. The Value Strategies Lead will bring in-depth, expert technical knowledge and tactical experience of oncology-specific clinical evidence, healthcare outcomes, health economics and payer evidence (including analytic techniques and tools such as clinical trial design and analyses), and its application to pharmaceutical development throughout the development process. Main Duties And Responsibilities Identify, develop and drive forward value strategy frameworks and the enablers thereof that increase access to our innovative portfolio by addressing payer needs. Work closely with the Payer strategy and innovation director to advance the enablers of value-based agreements, supporting country value strategies teams and engaging relevant cross-functional expertise across AstraZeneca. As required, serve as member of (a) Global Value Strategy Working Group(s), which includes global cross-functional members and representation from key markets Evaluate clinical and health-care outcome value strategy framework options, and collaborate with Clinical Development and Medical Affairs colleagues to gain alignment on value strategy framework(s) Identify and develop opportunities/risk evaluations of clinical and health-care outcome constructs, and delivering mitigation plans that support markets implementing value strategy frameworks Work closely with Health Economics & Payer Evidence Leads/Directors to ensure consistent use of clinical and health-care outcomes evidence across both outcome-based agreements and health economic models and deliverables Develop brand-specific and/or disease area value strategy frameworks, which in collaboration with the Market Access Financial Analyst will be integrated into a Global Value Strategy Framework Work closely with regional and country Market Access Teams, increasing the awareness of value strategy frameworks and support with their development and implementation Drive the required payer insights and research to ensure robust and validated frameworks Communicate project issues and progress effectively and in a timely manner to all stakeholders As required by the business, ensure effective budget planning and secure resources to drive Value Strategy Frameworks forward Support key markets in negotiations with reimbursement authorities Essential Requirements Bachelor’s degree in biomedical science, business, quantitative disciplines or economics. Formal post graduate degree in health economics or a related quantitative discipline, or substantial work experience in the discipline. Relevant drug development and/or commercialization experience within the pharmaceutical/medical industry Demonstrable robust understanding of health technology assessment methods and processes Able to apply knowledge and understanding of payer analytic techniques in appropriate circumstances (including evidence synthesis, economic/clinical outcomes, and modelling), taking into account their relative strengths and limitations Ability to incorporate the needs of key marketing companies into analytics to ensure optimised use of global materials at the country level. Demonstrable project management skills in a matrix environment Desirable Requirements Payer launch experience at a local or global level. Experience developing value-based agreements and other novel access solutions

jobTitle: Vice President, Biologic Therapeutics - Oncology R&D
jobDescription: Location: Gaithersburg, Maryland US AstraZeneca is a global, creative, biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the most serious illnesses. But we are more than just one of the leading pharmaceutical companies. At AZ, we’re proud to have an exceptional workplace culture that encourages innovation and collaboration. Here employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives – an are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity. AZ is a place where passionate people can immerse themselves in their work and make significant contributions to scientific excellence and medicines. We are actively recruiting for a Vice President - Biologic Therapeutics for the Biologics Engineering & Targeted Delivery (BETD) department within Oncology R&D. Biologics Engineering is responsible for the discovery and development of biologics drug candidates to support all our therapeutic areas (Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic, Respiratory and Immunology) drug discovery pipelines and for in-house biologics discovery platforms and drug modalities to support future drug development efforts. Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. The modern, vibrant scientific campus employs more than 3000 experts in our field, and it is only a short drive from Washington, DC. It is filled with pioneering technology. Our labs spaces were built to facilitate collaboration, interaction and cross functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We offer everything from bean bag rooms for creative brain storming, game rooms and Zen garden to treadmill stations and regular campus happy hours. The Gaithersburg site offer a variety of amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. Join AstraZeneca and help us deliver life-changing medicines! Be among our employees who continue to make us an innovation-driven company that stands firmly among the leaders in Biopharmaceuticals. Main Responsibilities: Provide strategic, scientific, and operational leadership for the Biologic Therapeutics group (Gaithersburg, USA) Responsible for broad biologics drug discovery. The drug discovery technology platforms include phage display, hybridoma, B cell technology, bi-specifics, protein engineering, antibody-drug conjugates, structural biology, etc. Provide strategic direction for establishing new technology platforms and processes. Interact and collaborate with leaders across key therapeutic areas (Oncology, Cardiovascular/Rena/Metabolic diseases, Respiratory/Immunology) on pipeline delivery and new technology development. Work closely with Biopharmaceutical Development (BPD) to ensure new therapeutic molecules are compatible with CMC requirement. Foster the implementation of external innovation. Develop and manage operating budget. Develop high potential employees for managerial and scientific leadership positions. As a member of the BETD Senior Leadership Team, actively contribute to the overall strategy and direction of BETD, and undertake specific leadership assignments representing BETD, as required. Minimum Requirements: Ph.D. in a relevant scientific field (antibody/protein engineering, protein biochemistry, and biotechnology) required. 10-15 years professional experience in biologics research. Recognized leader in scientific specialty as evidenced by publications, participation in international conference, membership on journal editorial boards, etc. Must be an excellent communicator and highly effective in interacting with key internal and external partners. Ability to establish high level strategies for new drug technologies, and ability to apply new technologies to drug discovery. Solid collaboration and team-building skills; possessing great coaching and organizational skills Functions with a high degree of integrity and professionalism. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. So, what’s next? A place built on courage, curiosity, and collaboration – we make bold decisions driven by patient outcomes. Empowered to lead at every level, free to ask questions and take calculated risks that write the next chapter for our pipeline. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and passionate about the possibilities, then we are keen to hear from you! Where can I find out more? Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Next steps: Submit an application today, or connect with our Talent Acquisition Partner - Sam Hunter: https://www.linkedin.com/in/samhunter1/ or our Talent Scout, Ellen Willcox: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ellen-willcox-03a2b1/ for a confidential discussion to explore this opportunity further. We are looking forward to hearing from you! To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a phenomenal fit, please share this posting with them.

Would you like to work in a fast-paced team environment in a company that follows science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines? Are you searching for career growth and development with competitive salaries and benefits? If so, this position would be a phenomenal fit for you! We are driven by our commitment to deliver accelerated growth for AstraZeneca and to make people’s lives better. It pushes us to keep building on our foundations and progressing as we turn our ever-growing and increasingly complex pipeline from molecule to medicine. Be part of evolving how we work with Lean, cutting-edge science, digitalization, and sustainable practices. AstraZeneca is at an exciting time of new products and launches. We get to work with innovative and scientific products on our leading-edge end-to-end supply chain, using the latest technologies and modern facilities. The Mt. Vernon site was established in 1972 and is the flagship site delivering innovative, life changing oral solid medicines. At the site we formulate and pack OSD tablets, capsules for over 60+ markets. The Mt Vernon site is the largest AZ production site in the US and is located in the southwest corner of the state of Indiana, approximately 15 miles from Evansville, Indiana – the third largest city in the state of Indiana. The Mt. Vernon site is dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. We host yearly Inclusion and Diversity conferences and have an employee resource group devoted to promoting diversity and inclusion and enhancing employees' professional development through interactive and engaging events. The Warehouse Manager is responsible leading for the Process Operations (ie. unit operations) and provides oversight of several process operations (ie receiving, sampling, storing, and shipping of materials, etc). As the Warehouse Manager, you will manage the Warehouse Operation to support the production of high quality product in accordance with the PET operating strategy. As a responsible leader for the operation, this must be done while maintaining effective employee relations and compliance to cGMP, other regulatory and SOX requirements, as well as SHE obligations and AstraZeneca standards. What you'll do: Provide direction to Warehouse personnel in the efficient use of equipment and materials to support Production of Quality Product in accordance with the PET Plan or Rhythm Wheel. Responsible for all Warehouse activity within the area of responsibility, including coordination of support staff, scheduling, and improvement. Promote the use of safe work practices during all aspects of Warehouse activities and ensure all external and AstraZeneca SHE standards are met daily. Accountable for training of Warehouse personnel on equipment, processes, and Standard Operating Procedures and cGMP’s, OSHA, DOT, FDA, and DEA regulations.. Partner with Warehouse Coach to develop training plans and assist in providing resources for training. Ensure adequate availability of pertinent warehouse facilities space and equipment requirements for material handling, shipping, and storing. Provide complete view and responsibility for a larger area including, but not limited to, training, investments, budget, crewing, standardization, skill matrix. Provide coaching/mentorship to team and develop them as lean leaders. Ensure that cGMP’s are used and followed during all process so that all FDA and international regulations are met. Respond to monthly internal audit observations and eventually external audits. Promote a positive work environment by effectively administering AstraZeneca Human Resources policies and procedures including Performance Management and by communicating information to employees and responding to their concerns. Ensure proper documentation practices are maintained consistently to company standards in manufacturing documents, training documentation, production logs, etc. Generate reports for deviations, assist in the investigations, and recommend/implement solutions to resolve deviations. Approve deviation investigations as appropriate. Respond to product defect notifications. Author, review, and approve Standard Operating Procedures and other documents to ensure integration of cGMPs and improve process efficiencies. Promote and encourage continuous improvement in efficiency, quality, production, and safety through the use of team driven processes and key performance indicators and recognition and rewarding high performance. Use IS/IT and technology to improve service and reduce costs. Collaborate with PET from Form and Pack to optimize process performance. Contribute in design, selection, installation, and qualification of new Warehouse equipment, facilities, and processes. Review, approve, and implement change controls. Provide career development and performance management for direct reports. Lead or participate on interdepartmental and intercompany projects as required. Work collaboratively within and across PETs to ensure flow of product, sharing of best practices, lean behaviours and adherence to corporate policies in these areas. Promote a lean culture, drive improvements and process simplification. Maintain presence across multiple operating shifts. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Pharmacy, related Science or business. Minimum 5 years’ experience in a GMP or regulated Warehouse environment. At least 4 year previous supervisory experience. Knowledge of FDA cGMP’s. Excellent organizational and communication skills – verbal, written, and presentational Must have experience managing people. Problem solving and process improvement skills. Preferred Qualifications: Experience working in a LEAN manufacturing environment. Solid understanding of Microsoft applications, SAP, Trackwise. APICS certified Knowledge or previous experience in managing technical programs/projects. Ability to direct and participate in cross functional teams Project management skills. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial -finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Interested? Come and join our journey! Next Steps – Apply today!
